loans.name: Amaris Del Rosario

texts.es:
Amaris E. Gómez tiene 55 años y vive en San Jacinto, municipio del centro de Bolívar conocido por la elaboración de artesanías, tales como hamacas, bolsos y mochilas. Amaris es comerciante y productora de artesanías, actividad tradicional heredada de su madre. Los productos que más fabrica son las mochilas, las cuales elabora en horas de la noche y las hamacas que las elabora con sus hermanas y su mamá. Además, Amaris trabaja en una empresa en las horas de la mañana, mientras su esposo se dedica a labores del campo. Ha tenido 2 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo los que le han aumentado su ingreso familiar e hicieron que pudiera mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. El crédito que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilaza para producir hamacas tejidas en telar vertical y también para la elaboración de bolsos y mochilas.

Manifiesta que ha visto tiempos difíciles durante tiempos de violencia cuando su esposo no podía trabajar en el campo debido a aquella problemática y entonces a ella le tocó encargarse de la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar; gracias a Dios la situación se ha cambiado y ahora los sanjacinteros pueden trabajar en el campo de nuevo. Más adelante, Amaris sueña con mejorar su vivienda, la cual es una casa propia y con ayudar a uno de sus tres hijos para que realice sus estudios universitarios el año que viene.
texts.en:
Amaris E. Gómez is 55 years old and lives in San Jacinto, a municipality in the Bolívar town center known for the production of artisinal goods like hammocks, purses, and backpacks. Amaris is shopkeeper and producer of artisinal goods, a traditional activity inherited from her mother. The products that she makes the most are backpacks that she makes at night, and hammocks that she makes with her sisters and mother. Additionally, Amaris works in a company in the morning, while her husband does field work. She has had two loans with Fundación Santo Domingo which have improved her family income and allowed her to improve her living conditions. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of thick yarn to to make woven hammocks on a vertical loom, and also to make purses and backpacks. She expresses that she has seen difficult times during periods of violence when her husband could not work in the countryside, when it was up to her to take charge of the majority of household expenses; thank God the situation has changed and today most sajacinteros[those from San Jacinto] can work in the countryside again. In the future, Amaris dreams of improving her home, which she owns, and of helping one of her three kids finish their university studies this coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of thick yarn to produce hammocks woven on a vertical loom and to make purses and backpacks.

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The P. (shown in the photo), 50, is a widow with one daughter who is a silk weaver. She lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. .  

The is a farmer. Besides farming, she is a silk weaver as well. She is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat for donuts

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en:
Tungalagtamir L., 42, is married and the mother of a 19-year-old son. She and her family live together in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her son, Bulganhangai, is a university student. They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. 

Tungalagtamir operates a pig farm with her husband. They have been operating their business since 2008, and have been steadily expanding their business. She has created another pig farm in a Tuv province as well. With her business profit, she purchased a car for her family. Over the past years, Tungalagtamir and her husband have been successfully operating their business and have built a loyal customer base. She is an honest and hardworking person. 

Tungalagtamir would like expand her business and to be able to pay her only son's university tuition fee. She is requesting a 2,600,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT) loan to expand her pig farm and to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.use: To expand her farm

loans.name: Asovale

texts.en:
Asovale M. is 37 and married with two children (ages 2 and 5).  She owns a business baking & selling cakes in the local community.  Asovale has one year of experience in this business.  Asovale needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Asovale joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asovale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: God’S Favor Group

texts.en:
Odinga G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'God’s Favor'. He is 26 years old, single, and cares for two siblings. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 7 years, he has been selling soap, salt, and oil at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business by selling plastic bags. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of salt, soap, and oil. He describes himself as very determined and earnest.

Odinga G.'s dream is to improve his business and be able to open a mineral water factory. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kuta is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of salt, soap and oil.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos que estudian, el mayor tiene 18 años y el menor tiene 3 años, Anatolia vende medicina natural en una tienda alquilada que se encuentra en una calle concurrida, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima de los laboratorios, Anatolia también prepara las medicinas, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía, por las tardes se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos.
Anatolia vive en casa alquilada y en los últimos meses esta construyendo su casa y el préstamo que solicita en este ciclo será para la compra de materiales de construcción.
Los sueños de Anatolia son tener una casa naturista en el centro de la ciudad y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Anatolia lives with her partner and 6 children, all of whom go to school. Her oldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is 3 years old. Anatolia sells natural medicines in a shop she rents on a busy street. She buys her produce from laboratories in Lima. Anatolia also prepares medicines, working from 6 in the morning to 12 noon. In the afternoons, she looks after her children. Anatolia currently lives in a rented house but for the past few months has been building her own house. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for construction materials. Anatolia's dreams are to have a natural therapy shop in the town centre and for her children to secure professional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase five bundles of high quality used clothing

loans.name: Saby

texts.es: Saby tiene 26 años, vive sola en una casa alquilada. Desde hace un año empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, por lo que ahora se dedica a vender frazadas, así como organizar eventos sociales. Su forma de trabajo, en este caso la ventas de sus artículos para la casa, lo realiza mediante catálogos, y la adquisición del producto lo comprar al por mayor para luego ser ofrecidos a crédito. Le gusta las actividades que realiza porque le permite ser independiente, aunque reconoce que  a veces las dificultades  de los pagos  impuntuales de sus clientes le han perjudicado, pero ha sabido superarlas con estrategia de cobranzas, es por eso que su gran sueño es  tener más capital  para  que sus negocios tengan mayor rentabilidad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la implementación de ambos negocios.
texts.en:
Saby is 26 years old and lives alone in a rented house. She began working independently a year ago and now sells blankets and organizes social events. Particularly in the case of household items, she uses catalogues to buy her products in bulk and then later offers credit to her buyers to purchase them. She likes this kind of work beause it allows her to be independtent even though she knows that sometimes late payments from her clients cause difficulties for her. But she knows how to work around this challenge with her payment strategies. Her large dream is to have more capital so that her business become even more successful. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial help. In addition, she appreciates being part of her village bank since all participants are responsible and united. She is thankful for the people that administer the loan she requested. It will be important in her business' progress. With this loan she will expand both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more blankets and other household items

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor D. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger - a traditional nomadic housing tent. 

She initially worked as a saleswoman in Han-Ord, a local market, but since 2005 she has been managing her own business, retailing food products at the same market in her town. She began operating her business with her the savings from her salary, and today her working capital reaches to one million MNT. 

Dolgor is a very hardworking woman who has managed to build her own house with her business profits, and she is planning to open a small food shop in her town. Her husband works for a local construction company, which is considered profitable during the summertime. However the construction work is very seasonal, so he raises cattle during the other seasons. 

Dolgor is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase fruits in bulk to resell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits in bulk

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO est formé de 20 membres. Il a vu le jour la veille du financement du Banc Villageois le 04/12/2007. Elles sont des femmes très entreprenantes unies par des liens d'affinité et de voisinage. Elle s'entraident et de mènent des activités commerciales

MAME BOURY N. debout à l'extrême droit sur la photo, vêtue de bleu, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est veuve et vit avec ses deux enfants. 

Elle vend des parfums et ustensiles de cuisine, des tabourets. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar et revend sa marchandise à Louga.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises ci-dessus pour augmenter ses revenus financiers.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge de la gestion familiale et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The MANKO solidarity group, consisting of 20 members, was created on the eve of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois (04/12/2007). These are very enterprising women who came together because they share an affinity and they are neighbors. They help each other, and they engage in commercial activities. MAME BOURY N., standing at the far right in the photo and dressed in blue, is the head of the group. She is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two children. She sells perfumes, cooking utensils, and stools. She gets her stocks in Dakar and sells the merchandise in Louga. Her loan will allow her to increase her stocks and boost her income. Her goal is to support her family and bolster her savings.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes, cooking utensils, and stools

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta G. is from the village of Tamil. She is 59 years old. Marieta is married and has four children. To make a living, Marieta owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Marieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cristo Salva Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es la coordinadora del Grupo Cristo Salva 1 y 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha sido dedicarse como madre para darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Esperanza está muy emocionada de recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 20 años, el cual inició vendiendo joyas de plata, como anillos y cadenas utilizando un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Esperanza está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Ropas interiores por docenas, tanto de hombre, mujeres y niños. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para ropa nueva y de esta manera poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su sueño de poder terminar de construir su casa, también desea tener buena salud y tener una vida más estable económicamente. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de La Romana, una ciudad cuya economía depende de la producción de Caña de azúcar y la industria del Turismo de alto nivel.
texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of the Silva Groups 1 and 2.  Her family is made up of 4 children and a husband. Both of them, (father and mother) have raised and educated their children.  Her most difficult challenges, she tells us, have been in her role as a mother trying to provide a better future for her children.

Esperanza is very excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza International.  She has had her business for about 20 years, which she started by selling silver jewelry such as rings and chains, using money that she had saved up.  Esperanza is planning to invest the proceeds of her loan in the purchase of undergarments in dozens, for men, women and children.  She will use her income for new clothing and in such a way will be able to grow her business and achieve her dream of being able to finish building her house.  She also wishes to maintain good health and have a more financially stable life.

This member of the Esperanza Group joined us because of the flexible loan payments and better interest rates.  Her background is representative of  the other members of the group and customers of Esperanza, the Haitians (who for the most part have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans, both generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other areas of limited resources in the Dominican Republic, is lacking in drinking water and constant electrical energy.  This group is located in a low resource area of La Romana, a city whose economy depends on the production of sugar cane and the high level tourist industry.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments in dozens.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena K. sells palm kernel oil and palm oil at Elmina. Helena has attained junior high level of education.  She is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She sees to the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of palm kernel and palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and palm fruits to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth ella tiene 27 años. Lidia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.  los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 5 años, el cual dio inicio debido a una alternativa para sufragar los gastos de su hogar pues tenía cierta experiencia en el negocio. Luego ella observo que el mismo era rentable, por lo que lo ha mantenido subsistiendo ahora con ingresos de ella. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para el negocio. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande, que sea de capital propio para obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera poder subsistir ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Lidia is 27 years old and sells general merchandise from her own house and on the streets.  She began this business nearly 5 years ago to help with family costs.  She had some experience in the business.

Lidia soon observed that the business was profitable, and she has kept it going with her own earnings. She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise for her business.

Lidia's dream is to turn this into a large business, with her own capital, in order to obtain larger earnings and consequently, for her husband and her to be able to subsist.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno Bancud, Jr. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. He is 23 years old. Benigno is single. To make a living, Benigno owns & operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Benigno has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Benigno joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benigno has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Benigno is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair vehicle used in the business and to purchase piglets for fattening. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Benigno from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
K. Robinah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Robinah has a boutique business, which she has had for 7 years.         

To help expand her business, Robinah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robinah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Robinah hopes to open up another business.

loans.use: more cloth

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Estrella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like biscuits & snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like biscuits & snack foods

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 60 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ana de 52 años y sus 2 hijos menores Luis de 19 e Isabel de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de café, plátano y yuca es la actividad a la que se dedica Jorge, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos son muy peligrosos para su salud. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más así tener una mejor producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más plantas de café, para ampliar sus actuales sembríos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 60 years old.  He is a kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 52 year-old Ana, and his two dependent children, 19 year-old Luis and 11 year-old Isabel, for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Jorge grows coffee, bananas and cassava.  Every day, very early in the morning, he goes out to work on his farm with the goal of working hard so that he grows good-quality crops.  What he most likes about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land since the chemicals are very dangerous for his health.

Over time, Jorge hopes to grow more and improve his production.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his repayments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan.  He is a very punctual and active member of his community bank.  He will use the 500 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy more coffee plants so that he can expand his current crops.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants

loans.name: Silbera

texts.es: Silbera, de 42 años, es una mujer muy forjadora y convive con Juan (43)  y sus cuatro  hijos que viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Palmapampa; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante.Los arduos trabajos que realiza Silbera  en su parcela, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta en la ciudad de San Francisco, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados en los centros de acopio. Sus principales fuentes de ingresos, son la venta de cacao, café y coca, ya que son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que esta obteniendo ganancias después del arduo trabajo que le costo sembrarlos, ya  lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar su máquina fumigadora para combatir la plaga y obtener buenos frutos.Este es el decimo préstamo de Silbera  con MFP, y promete ser  muy puntual en su cronograma de pagos; en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el carisma que siempre le caracteriza.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas, abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar sus cultivos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silbera is 42 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who lives with her partner Juan (43) and her four children in her own home in the community of Palmapampa.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

Silbera's hard work on her plot of land has meant that her crops are very well cared for and, when she comes to sell them in the city of San Francisco, they sell quickly in the warehouse centers.  Silbera's main sources of income are her cacao, coffee and coca sales since she grows very good quality products.

What Silbera most likes about her work is harvesting her products since she is making profits after the hard work that she put into growing them.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be protecting her crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, she would like to buy a dusting machine to combat these pests and obtain good products.

This is Silbera's tenth loan from MFP.  She pledges to be very punctual in making her loan repayments.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because of her charisma.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers to improve her crops.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a mother of one child who is three years old. She sells rice and sugar on a wholesale scale, while she sells other items such as salt and toothpaste on a retail scale. Claudine’s husband works with her and their business is going well. 

Claudine is requesting for a loan to buy more sacks of rice and sugar to make more profits. Since she bought a piece of land with the proceeds from this business, she hopes to start building a house as soon as she makes some more profits.

loans.use: Buying more rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school while one is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

He has operated an electronics shop for the past seven years, doing business in a shop to his neighboring community. Jones faces a major challenge of rationing of electricity and fluctuation of prices of goods. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts for his electronics shop. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loans.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his electronics shop

loans.name: Gregorio Arsenio

texts.es:
Gregorio albañil su compañera trabaja como domestica, sus hijos menores de edad estudiantes, que sus hijos se preparen es su objetivo y meta para ellos.  Familia humilde, trabajadora que requieren mejorar su vivienda para mayor seguridad.
El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrín, piedras cantera, hierro, camisa, alambre de amarre y otros materiales para la construcción de la pared lateral de la casa. Obteniendo una mejor condición de vida y protección de los robos que sedan en el sector donde viven.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a bricklayer and his spouse works as a domestic employee.  His minor children are school age.  His goal and objective for them is that they prepare themselves.  They are a humble, hard working family that needs to improve their dwelling for greater security.

The loan he’s asking for will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, gravel, paving stones, iron rods, facing, wire and other materials to build a side wall for the house which will lead to better living conditions and protection from break-ins that are common where they live.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to build a wall.

loans.name: Mavlonberdi

texts.en:
K. Mavlonberdi is 34 years old. He is married with two children. Mavlonberdi is selling cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market feeds them and then resells them at a higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for many years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. 

Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family. Mavlonberdi has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Today, knowing that the price for animals is not so high right now but will increase for sure, Mavlonberdi is planning to expand  his herd  and purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he requests a loan of 10,000 Somoni. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. 

Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her  2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase seeds and seedlings for her rice farm

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a small business owner from Khujand, Tajikistan. He works to support his family by selling clothing at a busy central market. Naimjon has been in business for about 4 years and makes around $200-$250 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits. 

Naimjon has requested a loan of $3000 USD to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with IMON International. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Naimjon with the success of his business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, a 43-year-old widow, lives with her mother in her apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her only son Enkhmend 27 is married and lives with his wife. He works in city's rescue department. 

Mrs. Altantsetseg started her retail business in 2006 by selling shoes. Now she rents a space inside the shop and sells cosmetic items. Her business is growing and during past few years she has managed to buy a plot of land for her son and a car for herself. Now she is planning to increase her profits by increasing her working capital and buying more products to sell. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.use: to increase working capital by buying more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, age 48, is married Kahoro and they have two children. Her primary business is M-PESA (mobile money transfer service) but she sells electronics alongside. She has been in this business for ten years and this is her first loan from KADET.

She will use the anticipated profits to open several M-PESA outlets and hopes to operate a large wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of electronics to sell.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann, age 28, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  Van and her husband produce traditional drums to resell, earning an income of $7 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  Their standard of living has been improved since Vann has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a machine to help produce the drums.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a machine to help produce drums

loans.name: Alyiman's Group

texts.en:
Alyiman, 59, is the leader of this group; unfortunately she is a widow. She has a son who is married and has three children.  Alyiman’s son works in construction; his monthly salary is 5000 soms. He earns additional money by selling fruits and vegetables on the market. 

In order to contribute money to the family budget, Alyiman breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Alyiman wants to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wants to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son and build a sauna near the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pedro  Rafael

texts.es:
Don Pedro de 43 años, es originario de la ciudad de León, esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos, de oficio contador, el es dueño de una panadería. El inicio en este negocio a la edad de 23 años de edad , anteriormente trabajaba como contador en una institución estatal para ese entonces el tenia 18 años de edad, el también estudiaba un curso de Ingeniería Agrícola y al mismo tiempo trabajaba pero le resulto difícil seguir pagando este curso pues su familia pasaba por una situación económica muy difícil tuvo que dejar de estudiar , y había perdido su trabajo . Un tío lo motivo a que pusiera su propio negocio para salir adelante así lo hizo poco a poco hasta tener hoy en día su panadería. 
El solicito el préstamo para comprar un horno industrial. Para aumentar la producción de pan y atender la demanda de sus clientes con esto aumentar sus ingresos por medio de las ventas. El desea abrir nuevos mercados en las zonas rurales de León  pues considera que es buen punto de venta para distribuir sus productos, comprar una moto para distribuir su producto y ahorrarse en combustible. Sus siguientes pasos son realizarles mejoras a su negocio, modernizar algunas de sus herramientas de trabajo como la compra de una batidora industrial.
texts.en:
Pedro, 43, is from the city of León.  He’s married and the father of three children.  He’s an Accountant by profession and also owns a bakery.  He started this business at the age of 23.  He used to work as an accountant for a state institution.  Back then he was 18 years old.  He was also taking Agricultural Engineering courses while working but it became difficult to pay for the schooling because his family was going through a difficult economic situation.  He had to stop studying and had lost his job.

An uncle encouraged him to set up his own business so that he could get ahead.  He did so and gradually attained the bakery he has today.  He asked for the loan to buy an industrial oven to increase bread production and meet customer demand increasing income through his sales.

He wants to open new markets in the rural parts of León because he feels they are good sales points for his products and to buy a motorcycle to distribute his products and save on fuel.  His next steps include doing some improvements to the business and modernizing some of his work tools like buying an industrial mixer.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 36 years old, married with two children.  He operates a barber shop to earn a living.  He has operated the business for 10 years and employs two people.  He says that he gets a good number of customers in a day.

Victor has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has grown his business and managed to acquire some business assets.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy disinfectants and hair products.

loans.use: To buy disinfectants and hair products.

loans.name: Marizol Valeria

texts.es:
Marizol es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos aún estudiando.  Tiene educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de comidas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma de   S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas, también se dedica a la crianza de truchas y vende pan.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la  compra de veinte sacos de alimentos para las  truchas,  cada saco cuesta S/. 150.00 nuevo soles, para completar esta compra ella cuenta con un pequeño capital.  Cuenta que los días viernes, sábado y domingo vende comida, dos veces a la semana vende pan en Ilave y la trucha lo vende cada ocho meses en Desaguadero, en el negocio le ayudan  sus hijos y su esposo quien es albañil.  Ella es toda una comerciante.
Su sueño es salir adelante en el negocio y tener otros negocios más que le permita generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las bromas de las socias.  No hay caso de retirarse porque dice que se acostumbró a ese ritmo.
texts.en:
Marizol is a member of the communal bank "Medalla Milagrosa", located in the district of Pomata, province of chucuito, department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  She received a high school education.

Together with her husband she sells food.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years.  The first loan she had, in the amount of 300 PEN, was used in her food business.  She also raises trout and sells bread.  The new loan she is requesting, for 2,500 PEN, will be used to buy sacks of feed for the trout.  Each sack costs 150 PEN.  On Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays she sells food, and two times a week she sells bread.  Her trout is sold every eight months in Desaguadero.  Helping out in her business are her children and husband, who is a bricklayer.  Marizol is every bit a saleslady.

Her dream is to grow her business and start up new ones that will increase her income.  What she likes best about the communal bank is the joke-telling among the members.  She is not planning to retire soon because she is accustomed to her work pace.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed for her trout.

loans.name: Zanabu

texts.en: Zanabu is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. She is a seamstress at Takoradi, a trade she has practiced for 10 years. Her husband also works. The loan will be used to buy wax prints, thread, zips, buttons, needles and other sewing materials to sew clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zanabu plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to buy wax prints, thread, zips, buttons, needles and other sewing materials to sew clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mee Group

texts.en:
From Gweru, the capital of Midlands Province in Zimbabwe, Elita runs a general dealership and flea market stall. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy groceries, clothing and footwear.

To this point Elita has managed to meet orders and demand, but the loan will help her to grow her business capacity. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will provide her with more disposable income and an improved standard of living for the family. She will also be able to pay her dependents' school fees.

In the future Elita sees herself being successful and owning her own shop and perhaps even buying a car.

loans.use: to buy wares for her flea market stall and general store.

loans.name: Caramelos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARAMELOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de alimentos, comercio de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, ferretería

La señora Virginia, indica que este es tercer año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella pretende iniciar un nuevo negocio (ferretería); ya que anteriormente ella trabajó elaborando masitas por nueve años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de tubos que comprará de la fábrica y lo ubicará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “CARAMELOS” is starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Santiago II group.  The bank is made up of eight members, and is headed up by a board of directors led by Señora Virginia.  The businesses which the members of the Communal Bank are progressing are varied, among them we have: animal sales, clothes retail, food sales, neighborhood store, hardware store.

Señora Virginia says that this is her third year working with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of her friends.  Right now, she is is intending to start a new business (a hardware store), as previously she worked baking cookies for nine years.

The loan that she is now looking for is for the purchase of tubing, which she will buy from the factory and sell from her store.  This form of work will allow her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the health services, the training and the saving.

loans.use: to buy tubing.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El señora José Alberto es un hombre trabajador, casado tiene dos hijos una ya Licenciada de 23 años y su hija menor  de 14 años cursa la secundaria. Él se dedica a la venta de perecederos en especial la piña desde hace 20 años en mercado local.  
El invertirá el crédito en la compra de piñas para seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en: Sr. José Alberto is a hardworking man who is married and has two daughters: one daughter is 23 and  already a college graduate and the other is 14 and in secondary school. He has been selling perishables, specifically pineapples, in the local market. He will use the loan to buy pineapples in order to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: 2185 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Frorentine is 36 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and fifteen years old. She is the president of a group which is called “Tuzamurane” in the local language. She is the first woman on the right side.

Frorentine owns a business that sells Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava flour. Her business is open from 7am until 7pm every day except on Sundays, and she currently has two people to help her. This is her second successful year in her business. 

Frorentine and her group will use this loan to expand their Irish potato and cassava flour business. With the profits, Frorentine and her team would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children, and Frorentine will be able to buy goat.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Luisa Karolina

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa Karolina se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de El Sauce. Se ha identificado por ser una persona muy dedicada al trabajo y a las labores que lleva a cabo en conjunto con su familia.

 Luisa Karolina es Casada, pero sin hijos a su cargo y además vive junto con su madre. Actualmente labora en su municipio en una institución la cual es responsable de un área.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel  con el fin de realizar una solicitud de crédito para la compra de arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que con esto le permitirá mejorar sus propias condiciones de su vida y la de su familia que tanto requiere de dicha mejora para tener un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Luisa Karolina lives in the town of El Sauce.  She describes herself as a person who is very dedicated to work and to the tasks she carries out together with her family.  Luisa Karolina is married but has no children in her care; she lives with her mother.  She’s currently employed by a municipal institution and she’s responsible for an area.

She has called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy sand and cement and to pay labor costs to do some home improvements because this will provide better living conditions for her and for her family that so needs a proper roof to live under.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 39 and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised five children: three daughters and two sons. All the children except the youngest daughter study at school. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 20000 soms, Aizada started to sell children’s clothing at the local market. She earns about 2600 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase the turnover of her business. She plans to purchase more clothing for trade. In the future, Aizada wants to provide her children with a good education and save money to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Chreub

texts.en:
Chreub is 41 years old and married with two children. She is a farmer, and she also raises pigs. Her husband is a construction worker. She has been raising pigs and farming her rice field for 18 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Chreub requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice field and also to buy food for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income, feed her pigs to be healthy and fat, keep her children in school, buy necessary household stuff, and save some money for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and fertilizers for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 36 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, May has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells items like books and pens. 

To help expand her business, May has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books for resale, and will help May to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. May hopes that in the future she will be able to own two other shops of the same business. 

May is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like May who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books for resale,

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35 year old married woman. She has four children between the ages of 3 and 12 years, three of them are in school. 

Rose has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for one and a half years. Rose requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Feliciana;  La socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 23 años de edad; la socia tiene un kiosko en el cual vende todo producto de abarrotes y golosinas; la socia también se dedica  a tejer chompas, chalinas, gorros; la socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes, la socia desea comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, gelatinas, mazamorras entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Feliciana is a member of the "Virgen Concebida de Arin" community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department. Feliciana is 49 years old, married, and has a 23-year-old son. She has a stall from which she sells groceries and candies. She also knits sweaters, scarves and hats. On this occasion, Feliciana would like a loan to invest in buying groceries. She would like to buy rice, sugar, milk, gelatin desserts, mazamorras (corn pudding) and other products. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying basic household products. Feliciana is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying basic household products

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: Santos Agustín  tiene 28 años de edad, es un emprendedor con éxito que su actividad económica es de brindar servicio musical. Santos Agustín se le ha apoyado atreves de los fondos  Kiva con un financiamiento para que el pueda invertir en su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Santos ha tenido éxito con su negocio, desde sus inicio a buscado como mejorar su nivel de vida buscando alternativas para poder generar ingresos a su familia y darle  una calidad de vida mejor. Santos ha sido un excelente clientes y está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder comprar materia prima como: alambres, extensiones, parlantes entre otros equipos que requiere.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín is 28 years old and a successful entrepreneur who provides musical services. Once again, he is seeking the support of Kiva funds by requesting a loan to invest his business so that he can provide better service to his customers. Santos has been successful with his business from the beginning and is looking for ways to improve his standard of living. He looks for alternatives that will generate income for his family and give them a better quality of life.

Santos has excellent customers and is requesting a new loan to buy supplies such as wires, extension cords, speakers, and other equipment that he needs.

loans.use: to buy wires, extension cords, speakers, and other equipment.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela de 59 años de edad vive en  la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 30 y 41 años; allí se dedica a la venta de productos de aseo,  hace 2 años, cuando comenzó disponiendo un espacio en su habitación, desde donde vendía a sus vecinos. Con el tiempo y mediante su trabajo persistente, el negocio fue creciendo, su clientela se expandió y ya con la necesidad de un local, se arriesgó a adquirir uno mediante arriendo y con ello logró estabilizar su negocio;  a Mariela le ha ido muy bien, ella ha conseguido algunos contratos  que le ayudan gradualmente al incremento de su capital de trabajo. Su meta mas adelante es aprender a fabricar traperos y a elaborar desinfectantes, para darle un giro a su negocio y con esto  aumentará sus ganancias. 
Su mayor desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente,  para responder oportunamente, a la demanda del mercado, especialmente en el último trimestre del año,  cuando hay dinero disponible en el ambiente comercial y crecen sus ventas. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor cantidad, traperos, escobas y desinfectantes, para surtir su negocio y aprovechar las oportunidades que le ofrece la época decembrina.
texts.en:
Mariela, 59, lives in the city of Barranquilla and has two children, ages 30 and 41. She has been selling cleaning products since 2 years ago when she started using a space in her house to sell to her neighbors. With time and hard work the business grew, her clientele expanded, and needing more space she decided to risk renting a store, which helped her to stabilize her business. Things have gone well for Mariela: she has received some contracts that help her to gradually increase her business capital. Her goal is to learn to make mops and disinfectants which will take her business on a different route, and increase her earnings. 

Her major challenge is getting sufficient capital to be able to respond to the demands of the market, especially in the last trimester of the year when there is money available in the business sector and her sales go up. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy mops, brooms and cleaning products at wholesale to stock her store and take advantage of the opportunities of the holiday season.

loans.use: to buy mops, brooms and cleaning products in bulk.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina es una emprendedora que día a día lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería que con muchos esfuerzos la emprendió para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Carmelina ya tiene experiencia en crédito ya ha tenido crédito anteriormente con fundación león 2000 , y ella misma nos expresa que gracias al apoyo con el financiamiento a salido adelante porque aumentado el inventario del negocio. Carmelina actualmente está solicitando crédito a Fundación León 2000 para comprar granos básicos, aceite, golosinas jabón entre otros productos del hogar que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Carmelina is an entrepreneur who strives day after day to move her family forward. Her business activity involves managing a store. With great effort, she launched this business so that her children could move forward.

Carmelina has previous experience working with loans through Fundación León 2000. She expresses her thanks for the financial support that has allowed her to move forward because the inventory in her business has increased. Carmelina is currently requesting a loan from Fundación León 2000 so that she can buy basic grains, oil, candy, soap, and other household products that her customers are demanding.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, candy, soap, and other household products.

loans.name: Santos Fernando

texts.es:
el joven Santos Fernando es soltero, tiene 14 años de edad, cursó su estudios de diversificado, es bachiller, se dedica a la sastrería a la confección de sudaderos, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su señora madre, lleva 1 año de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas y también hilos, que le servirá para la confección de sudaderos y deportivo y casuales, quiere ver un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Fernando Santos, 14, is a High School graduate and works tailoring tracksuits. He has a one-year experience and learned the business thanks to his mother.

He is asking for a loan to purchase fabrics and threads, which he will use to tailor sport and casual tracksuits. He hopes that his business will be a successful one.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and threads to tailor tracksuits and pants.

loans.name: Mumbo

texts.en: Mumbo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to expand his meat goat business. With the loan, he wants to purchase goats and establish a butcher shop to sell meat. Since the first Kiva loan, his business has improved greatly, and he dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of goat meat in the area.

loans.use: to purchase goats and establish a butcher shop to sell meat.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells beauty products in Kufur near Elmina. She has received no formal education. Aba is married and has ten children. Her husband is a steel binder. 

Aba has been selling beauty products for ten years. She is responsible for supporting her husband with her large family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more beauty products, such as lotions, makeup and hair products, for sale. 

Aba hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as lotions, makeup, and hair products for sale.

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en: Khurshid was born in 1983 year. He is hardworking man. Khurshid is married and has 3 children. He has his own barber shop. Khurshid works in this field more than 10 years. Thanks good service he has regular customers. Local people of his village are glad from his work. He is only feed keeper of his family as his wife is a housewife. Khurshid now needs to financial support. He must to buy food items and some clothes for his children but he has not money. He is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni with this aim. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items and some clothes for his children

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda G. Pescina has been working for 2 years in food sales, of tacos and burritos.

She is located in a very competitive area and starts to sell from 7 in the morning. Her business is going very well, but the transporting the trailer has been hard, since she doesn't have a car to tow it and has to ask favors from friends and family. This has become a difficult situation, so she is requesting a loan of $15,000.00 to buy a van to be able to tow her food stand more easily. Mrs. Elda plans to pay for it in the timeframe of one year. Español

Elda G. Pescina se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de comida, tacos, burritos Se instala en una zona muy concurrida de la localidad y comienza a vender desde las 7:00 am en negocio marcha muy bien, pero transportar el remolque ha sido difícil ya que no cuentan con un auto para remolcarlo y tiene que pedir el favor a familiares y amigos, lo cual ya se ha vuelto una situación penosa, por lo cual solicitan un prestamo de $15,000.00 para comprar una camioneta y asi poder remolcar su puesto de comida con mayor facilidad. La Sra Elda planea pagarlo en un plazo de un año.

loans.use: buy a pick up truck to haul

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She always wanted to be an entrepreneur and saw many opportunities everywhere she looked. Irina decided on a small business selling clothing and footwear for women and today she runs a vending kiosk in one of the local markets. Currently, Irina has about $4,000 of working capital in her business and she makes about $600 a month in net profit. Irina is very cheery and optimistic. Her radiant smile and ability to make her clients feel welcome at her kiosk attracts many potential customers and helps her business grow. Irina has been a client with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2002. Irina is requesting a loan for $1,000 to open a new vending facility where she would like to begin selling shoes. She is planning to rent a facility, do all the necessary remodeling and purchase a variety of shoes, sneakers and sandals in preparation for the spring season. Irina’s business and marketing abilities in combination with financial assistance will help her to get this new venture off the ground and further increase her success and income.

Ірина – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона завжди хотіла бути підприємцем, вміла бачити можливості для цього навколо. Ірина вирішила відкрити власний бізнес з продажу жіночого одягу та взуття. Зараз в неї є торгівельна точка на одному з місцевих ринків. В Ірини приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісяця вона заробляє приблизно 600 доларів чистого прибутку. Ірина - дуже жвава та оптимістична. Її промениста посмішка та привітна вдача приваблюють багато потенційних покупців до її кіоску, що, в свою чергу, сприяє росту її бізнесу. Ірина співпрацює з „Надією України” з 2002 року. Ірина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб відкрити нову торгівельну точку з продажу взуття. Вона планує орендувати приміщення, зробити необхідний ремонт та закупити різноманітне взуття, а саме, кеди та босоніжки напередодні весняного періоду. Досвід Ірини в сфері бізнесу та маркетингу у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможе їй досягти мети, збільшити власні прибутки та зробити свій бізнес успішним.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Mrusal

texts.en: Mrusal lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow; her husband died of cancer. She always wants to make a good life for her children. One of her sons is a coil seller. He has a shop and his mother took her 4th cycle group loan so that he could expand his business and make a good income for his family. Now his mother wants to take anther loan so that her son can buy more coil to attract more clients to be a good business dealer in the future. He would like to thank his mother for helping him.

loans.use: To buy more coil

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is 43 years old, is married, and has 2 children. The oldest is 17 years old and is a student in the last year of high school. The younger one is 8 years old and is in the second year of primary school. Dionisia’s husband works as a private security guard for a family. Dionisia’s family lives in their own house.

She is a seamstress and she inherited this job from her parents. Her father was a tailor and her mother was a seamstress. She is a very entrepreneurial person; her clothing is well maD. and her prices accessible. She makes shirts, pants, sports clothes, and uniforms for businesses and high schools. Two months ago she proposed a plan at two high schools to make all of their uniforms. Due to her quality work and low prices, both high schools accepted her proposal and now she must make approximately 100 uniforms for them.

In order to get started, she is requesting a loan of $300.00 which she will use to buy fabrics at whole-sale price. This way she can get good discounts and start her work so that she can deliver the orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dionisia tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años es estudiante, actualmente cursa el último año D. la secundaria y el menor tiene 8 años está cursando el segundo año D. la escuela primaria; el marido D. Dionisia trabaja como guardia D. seguridad privada en una casa particular; todos ellos viven en una casa propia. Dionisia es modista ella heredo el oficio D. sus padres; su padre fue sastre y su madre modista; ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, sus trabajos son bien elaborados y sus precios accesibles, ella confecciona camisas, pantalones, remeras, ropas deportivas y uniformes para empresas y colegios. Hace unos meses presentó en dos colegios grandes D. la ciudad diseños D. uniformes para elaborarlos exclusivamente, gracias a su buen trabajo y bajos precios los colegios aceptaron su propuesta y debe elaborar alrededor D. 100 remeras para dichos colegios. Para poder empezar su labor ella solicita un crédito D. $ 300 que les servirá para comprar las telas al por mayor, D. este modo ella obtendrá importantes descuentos y podrá empezar su trabajo para entregarlos en fecha.

loans.use: To buy fabrics at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Mr. I. earns a low income, which is vulnerable to the local economy. He is 32, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region

. He rents a barber's shop and at the end of each month pays the owner for the rent. But he sees that some of his customers are cutting their hair at another, nearby barber's shop because of its inventory.

Mr. I. is not so modern to keep competition at a high level. On the other hand, there is a school season coming up and as a rule all schoolchildren must cut their hair before going to school.

He believes that it is time to look for investment to buy new inventory immediately. He has applied for a loan of $500 to Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan, he plans to attract more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To buy new inventory for barber shop.

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru:
Samira I. was born in 1989 in Aksu. She has been in business for three years. Her business has been actively growing, and Samira took a $500 loan from NorMicro to finance the expansion. Now she asks for another loan to purchase an inventory of products.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исаева Самира родилась и проживает в городе Ахсу . 1989-го года рождения. Третий год подряд занимается бизнесом. Ведет активную торговлю. Самира хотела расширить свой бизнес , поэтому она взяла кредит в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала . Взяв сумму в размере 500 долларов она дополнительно купила еще товаров .

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Tamara Abilio

texts.pt:
Tamara is legally single but lives in a social marriage with a man with 2 sons. Tamara opened her shop in her residence, where she runs the business. She expanded beyond the sale of commodity products by selling fire wood. Her husband is a public transportation driver and makes little money, so Tamara decided to join the loan program to help with their living and household expenses. The children are still young, but they will grow and need to go to school, and the couple have made the necessary sacrifices to afford the children's basic needs. Since joining the program in 2006 her live has improved and they continue to build their residence in stages. Tamara wants to work hard to make sure that her business continues to grow profitably.

Translated by Camila, Kiva volunteer.

Tamara e solteira mas vive maritalmente com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos. Tamara abriu uma tenda na sua residencia onde faz o negocio. Introduziu para alem da venda de produtos de primeira necessidade a venda de lenha. Tudo isto e feito na sua residencia. O marido de Tamara e motorista de um transporte semicolectivo de passageiros vulgo chapa 100. Como condutor de chapas o seu salario e baixo por isso Tamara teve que entrar no programa para ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Os filhos de Tamara ainda sao pequenos. mas irao crescer e terao que estudar. Por isso ocasal tem de se sacrificar para que nada faltre aos filhos.Tamara entrou para o programa em 2006 .De la para ca a sua vida tem registado melhorias.O casal esta paulatinamente construindo a sua residencia e ela diz que vai trabalhar muito no sentido de a concluir com os rendimentos do negocio.

loans.use:
Tamara wants to use the money for the purchase of additional supplies and fire wood for sale at her shop.

Tamara quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mais produtos para asua tendinha e comprar mais lenha para a venda

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana’s husband is a businessman like her; however sales aren’t going very well as the sales were low and the money not sufficient to pay the children’s school expenses. As time passed the children needed more things like clothing and school supplies. This was the reason that Ana decided to start to sell groceries outside her home. Little by little people were realizing that she sold basic products in her little store. She began to quickly acquire clients, and thanks to this she was able to invest more and more in new merchandise to be able to offer more variety to her clients.

Nevertheless today consider she is at the point of needing to be able to buy more items, so she is asking for a loan and that will enable her to increase her earnings. For this reason Ana is asking for a loan of US $375 that will be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Ana will be able to buy new merchandise in order to have greater income and with this money be able to secure her children’s future so they may study in the university and have better opportunities in their future. With your help Ana will be able to grow little by little as a person and as a mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Ana es comerciante igual que ella, sin embargo en las ventas no le va muy bien puesto que vende a menudeo y la cantidad de dinero no le era suficiente como para pagar los gastos que sus hijos estaban teniendo al estudiar. Y conforme pasaba el tiempo sus dos hijos necesitaban más cosas como ropa y artículos escolares. Fue por eso que Ana decidió comenzar a vender productos de abarrotes a las afueras de su casa. Poco a poco la gente se fue dando cuenta que ella vendía productos básicos para la despensa. Y comenzó rápidamente a adquirir clientas, gracias a esto pudo ir invirtiendo más y más en nueva mercancía para poder ofrecerle más variedad a sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente considera que está en el punto necesario para poder comprar más artículos que le están solicitando y así incrementar sus ganancias. Es por eso que Ana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar nueva mercancía para poder tener mayores ingresos y así con este dinero poder sacar a sus hijos adelante para que estudien una carrera universitaria y tengan mejores oportunidades. Con tu ayuda Ana podrá crecer poco a poco como persona y como madre de familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A., a mother of three, leads a group of five entrepreneurial women in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. They wish to use a $1,475 loan to invest in their families' businesses, so they can build a better life for themselves and their children. Shamim's husband is retired, and her son helps support the family. He's worked by dying cloth since elementary school, and Shamim will use the money to purchase more supplies for his business. Meanwhile, Hanifa will put her share to purchasing a donkey and cart so she can sell fruit, while Sardarn will invest her loan in her family's grocery store. Shakila hopes to buy her son a rickshaw, while Sharifan will purchase materials for her son's welding shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth for a cloth-dying business

loans.name: Ndeeba North E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Jamawa is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children aged 2 and 5, and her children go to school. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost her business.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Madina N., Aisha M., Betty K., and Mariam K.. Madina N. has a business in produce sales and wants to add capital.
