Aisha M. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Betty K. operates a business trading produce and wants to add stock. Mariam K. is currently in the business of furniture selling and is requesting a loan to invest in the business.

loans.use: To add capital to retail shop business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy a car

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs. V. has obtained five loans with Fundación Leon over the past 12 years. She has invested this capital in the cloth and other materials necessary for her craft. This time around she wants to buy an upgraded sewing machine to improve her small workshop.

Mrs. V. has one employee in her business. She is married with one child. Both husband and son work to help with the family's expenses.

Translated by from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace dos años y medios obteniendo cinco creditos en este periodo, los cuales ha invertido en telas e insumos materiales necesarios para llevar a cabo su negocio, ella da empleo a una persona en su negocio, es casada con un hijo el marido e hjo trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos familiares, su idea es comprar una maquina de mayor capacidad y agrandar su pequeño taller.

loans.use: Invest in cloth and materials for sewing

loans.name: Madame Koura

texts.fr:
43-year-old Mrs Koura Dembélé is the mother of 5 children and lives in a polygamous family in Ségou’s Médine neighborhood. She is unusual because she works in a sector monopolized by men, that is, selling timber (for use by building contractors). Her business is flourishing. After four solidarity loans (group loans), all of which were repaid, she is now requesting her first individual loan. She buys her supplies in the villages around Ségou and from the classified Faya forest (in the Koulikoroi region). The wood is taken to and stocked in Ségou. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 30,000. The profit will go towards the clothing, health and schooling of her five children. She plans to increase the size of her business and add on some complementary businesses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Koura Dembélé est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 5 enfants, vivant dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou. Elle est une femme spéciale car évoluant dans un secteur monopolisé par les hommes à savoir la vente de bois (utilisé par les entrepreneurs de bâtiment pour faire les bétons). Elle mène une activité florissante. Après quatre prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) tous remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de la région de Ségou et dans la forêt classée de la Faya (Région de Koulikoroi). Le bois est acheminé et stocké à Ségou. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice est utilisé pour les dépenses d’habillement, de santé et de scolarité de ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle compte augmenter la taille de son activité et y ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires.

loans.use: To buy timber for the building trade.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: 26 year old Agnes A. V. is a mother of two children. Her husband is an electrician while she runs her own general store. Open four days per week, Agnes earns a weekly net cash flow of 1200 Tala (~500 USD).  SPBD loans are Agnes’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for loans from traditional banks. She is requesting a loan to purchase timber, iron roofing, nails and paint to expand her shop. She requires additional storage space because she is currently having difficulty maintaining her large amount of stock.  Agnes has a strong loan history with seven previous loans with SPBD.

loans.use: To expand general store

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida lives with her common-law husband, is 23 and has a child. She sells meat at the 12 de Abril market, located in Ayacucho center. Now she only works on Saturdays and Sundays because the other days, she studies primary education in an institute. She buys animals at fairs and then sends them to the slaughterhouse.

Zaida belongs to the Kusirikuy ("Be happy" in Quechua) Village Bank. She needs a 1400 soles loan to buy a new freezer.

She dreams about having her own house and a butcher's trade which would provide all the city with meat.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. sells clothing, fabric and groceries on the Cape Coast. Paulina has received polytechnic education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Paulina has been selling clothing, fabric and groceries since early 2008. She is responsible for providing, along with her husband, for their children's education. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad de Limpio. Este comité se formo con la ayuda de una señora quien asistió a reuniones de conformación de un comité en la ciudad de Limpio. Se realizaron cuatro reuniones previas al crédito en donde las interesadas se interiorizaron más a cerca del programa Comité de mujeres emprendedoras. En las reuniones compartimos muchas experiencias de las señoras con sus negocios. Al comenzar las reuniones asistieron 17  señoras de las cuales 16 estuvieron de acuerdo con los compromisos del comité. Actualmente se encuentran en el 9º ciclo del programa, la línea de crédito que manejan es de a partir de 100.000 Guaraníes hasta 500.000 guaraníes por cada integrante, según lo que le corresponde de acuerdo con el ciclo en el que se encuentran,  actualmente son 17  integrantes. Lo solicitado en el crédito cada una de las integrantes utiliza para la compra de herramientas de trabajo o para la compra de mercaderías y/o materias primas para la elaboración del producto que finalmente llevarán a la venta. La mayoría de las integrantes del comité se dedican al trabajo independiente como por ejemplo: venta de comidas, de ropas, de joyas de plata, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles. etc.
Las actividades especificas por nombre se dan a continuación:
1- Lilian Noelia O. L.: Venta de Comestibles
2-Raquel A. A.: Venta de ropas
3-Teresa P. Rodriguez: Venta de Ropas (no esta en la foto)
4-Maria Lourdes C. Duarte:Venta de Bebidas
5-Jessy Evelin O. L.: Venta de Carbon
6-Ceferina Fernadez V.: Venta de Ropas
7-Maria V. Alfonso: Venta de Merceria
8-Delia Mercedes R. de A.: Kiosko
9-Albina T. Isasi: Ventas (no esta en la foto)
10-Petrona Noemi B. de Paredes: Venta de Verduras 
11- Nelba Antonia G. T.: Merceria
12-Cintia Carolina A.: Venta de Ropas
13-Valentina F. de A.: Venta de golosinas
14-Carolina Beatriz R. Diaz:Ventas
15-Eloiza A. V.: Venta de Ropas
16-Norma Liliana G. Nuñez: Venta de ropas
17- Nidia Esmilce L.: Venta de comidas
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Emprendedoras" is from the city of Limpio. This group was formed with the help of a woman that assited group forming meetings in the city of Limpio. The group had four meetings before requesting the loan where all interested members looked into the program "Comite the Mujeres Emprendedoras." In these meetings, the women shared their experiences with their businesses. The first meetings were attended by 17 women, 16 of whom agreed with the responsibilites of the group. They are currently in their ninth cycle of the program and have 17 members. The loan will be used by the various members to purchase tools for their work or to purchase merchandise or prime materials to make the products which will eventually be sold. The majority of the members of the group dedicate themselves to their independent work such as: sale of food, clothing, sliver jewelry, fruits and groceries. Their specific businesses are the following: 1- Lilian Noelia O. L. - Sale of groceries 2-Raquel A. A. - Sale of clothing 3-Teresa P. Rodriguez - Sale of clothing (not in this picture) 4-Maria Lourdes C. Duarte - Sale of drinks 5-Jessy Evelin O. L. - Sale of coal 6-Ceferina Fernadez V. - Sale of clothing 7-Maria V. Alfonso - Sale of hardware 8-Delia Mercedes R. de A. - Kiosk 9-Albina T. Isasi - Sales (not in this picture) 10-Petrona Noemi B. de Paredes - Sale of vegetables 11- Nelba Antonia G. T. - Sale of hardware 12-Cintia Carolina A. - Sale of clothing 13-Valentina F. de A. - Sale of candies 14-Carolina Beatriz R. Diaz - Sales 15-Eloiza A. V. - Sale of clothing 16-Norma Liliana G. Nuñez - Sale of clothing 17- Nidia Esmilce L. - Sale of food

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as vegetables, fruits, candies, coal and clothing.

loans.name: Noa

texts.en: Mrs. Noa R. is a farmer in Phnom Rontas Village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Noa R. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is only five years old.  Her husband, Mr. Bun Chun, owns a small farm where he raises ducks. He does not have enough money to buy duck food so Noa is requesting a loan to purchase the duck food for her husband's business. Any remaining money would be used to buy fertilizers to support her field. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.ru: Худойбердиева Мариета проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке в центре города. Торгует одеждой. Бизнес пибыльный , так как товар привозится из города Душанбе и население , не выезжая за приделы своего города делает покупки там.  Его товар пользуется большим спросом. Но он хочет увеличить ассортимент товара. Для этого он обратился к нам. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marieta H. lives in a city of Qurgan-tube. She is married and has four children. She has a secondary education and works at a market in the city center. She sells clothes. The business is profitable because goods are brought from Dushanbe, and customers are able to make purchases without leaving their locale. Marieta’s clothes are very popular, but she wants to increase the assortment of goods. This is why she approached Kiva. She plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his buisiness

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel H. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Daniel sells electrical gadgets and electrical parts and also repairs electrical appliances at Elmina, which he has done since 1996. Daniel uses his income to take care of his aged mother and his brothers, who are still in school. Daniel will use the loan to purchase a variety of electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. Daniel plans to reinvest the new profits back into his business. The additional profits earned will enable him meet his financial responsibilities.

This picture was taken at his workshop where he does the repairs.

loans.use: Daniel will use the loan to purchase a variety of electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 42 años de edad, hace 17 años vive con su pareja, con padres de 5 hijos, los 3 menores viven con ellos en su casa propia. Hace 10 años se dedica en la venta de muebles usados en uno de los ambientes de su casa que destinó para la venta de muebles. Su actividad empieza cuando viaja a la ciudad de Lima, a un lugar denominada “La cachina” donde escoge y compra los muebles, una vez en su ciudad, su esposo y sus hijos realizan el trabajo de lijar y sacarles brillo con laca hasta que queden muy brillantes. Una vez terminada esta labor los muebles quedan así de nuevos, y puede cotizarlos a un precio considerable, pero también al alcance de los bolsillos de sus clientes. Con todos los retoques llega a ganar por mueble entre 300 y 500 soles, pero la dificultad es que demora algunos días en vender un mueble. Mercedes está feliz con su negocio, su esposo y sus hijos están ocupados en ello también, la mayor demanda de muebles es a finales de abril, cuando empieza la cosecha de café, porque la gente empieza a adquirir sus muebles, es el tiempo donde se pueda hacer capital y “guardar pan para mayo”. Mercedes está con muchas ilusiones de trabajar, ya que ha recibido el cargo de vocal en su banco comunal, y está comprometida a trabajar al servicio del grupo, asimismo efectuar los pagos puntuales, este es su 1er préstamo, del que está muy agradecida. El dinero que solicita es para comprar muebles, los cuales le servirán como capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old and has lived with her partner for 17 years. They are the parents of 5 children, 3 of the youngest who live with them in their own home. For 10 years she has worked selling used furniture from her home. Her work starts with a trip to "La cachina" in Lima where she selects and buys the furniture. Once back in her home city, her husband and children perform the work of sanding and lacquering leaving them shining and like-new. She can then sell them for a higher price, which is still within reach of her customers' pocketbooks. After all of this pre-work, she earns about 300-500 soles per piece although it takes a few days to sell one piece. Mercedes is happy with her business especially since it involves her husband and children. The greatest demand for furniture is near the end of April when the coffee harvest comes in because then folks start buying furniture - it is the best time for earning capital and putting something away for a rainy day. Mercedes is eager to work especially since she has taken on the job of representative for her community bank and is committed to working for the group, and making payments on time. This is her first loan for which she is very grateful. The funds will be used to buy furniture which serve as capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: S. is 39 years and who resides in rural area of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She currently makes an income by selling fish at the local market, including dried fish and fish paste. She normally buys fish from a wholesale supplier at a low price and sells retail to earn a higher price. S. is married with three children who are attending the primary school, while her husband is assisting her selling fish. S.'s business is very profitable for the family, so she requests a loan of $400 in order to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Monsieur Ameth A. est un boucher depuis 25 ans.  Il a une bonne expérience du milieu.  Parallèlement, il a deux dibiteries à travers la ville. Il fournit en général de la viande à certaines personnalités et des boites.  A cet effet, il réalise un bon chiffre d’affaires.  Ce prêt lui permet de renforcer mais aussi d’ouvrir un mini-marché devant la Seras.  Il est marié et il habite à Thiès avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ameth A. has been a butcher for 25 years and knows the ins and outs of this business. In parallel, he runs two grilled meat stands in the city. He usually sells meat to people and companies, and makes a good turnover. This loan will enable him to bolster his business and to open a mini-market. He's married and lives in Thiès with his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a mini-market

loans.name: Héctor Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Héctor Eduardo P. ya ha tenido dos créditos en FVP los cuales pago puntual mente, con los que empezó la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta alta de su casa. 
Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar las habitaciones que serán para sus hijas ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio.
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos de su trabajo como chofer de camión.
texts.en:
Mr Héctor Eduardo Perez has already had two loans with FVP which he repaid punctually and with which he began construction of two rooms on the top floor of his house. He is now requesting a loan to finish the rooms which will be for his daughters since they are growing and need their own space. He plans to repay the loan with earnings from his work as a truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of two rooms in his house

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khodor has been working as a mason for six years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Khodor has requested a loan.   
Khodor is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Dumitru

texts.en:
P. Dumitru, together with his family of four, makes a living raising pigs and growing vegetables. Starting in spring, he makes the trip into the city before sunrise every day to offer his peppers, cucumbers, watermelons, potatoes and pumpkins to the farmers’ market’s first wave of shoppers. It has enabled him to bring his spring crops to market earlier at considerably higher prices.

In April of this year he received a third loan in the amount of 25,000 MDL for a term of 12 months. It is financing construction of another animal shelter and the purchase of a tractor that will serve as the new means of transportation to the produce market. He thanks Microinvest for giving him the opportunity to grow.

loans.use: To construct another animal shelter and purchase a tractor

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 59 years old, married to a construction worker, and has two older children.

Erma, as she is called by her clients and friends, has a diner and a small grocery store. She provides breakfast, lunch and snacks to paper factory workers located close to her house.

She owned a grocery store and a butcher shop, but it was robbed three times and she was forced to close her business. After one year with out any business, the factory opened and Erma started selling fast food and later full meals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Vera

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est une célibataire, elle est rentrée dans la vie active tôt pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres charges, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle a embrassé est le commerce de pagnes bazins, elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de mèches. Elle s’approvisionne en passant des commandes au mali. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes bazins de haute qualité.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and had to begin to support herself early on. The business that she took up is selling "pagnes bazin" (lengths of African-dyed damask cloth). She also sells hair extensions. She buys her inventory by ordering it from Mali. Her stock is diminished and she wants to replenish it, so she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy 20 lengths of high quality "pagnes bazin".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes bazin"

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Don Sebastian de 52 años es soltero, comerciante, propietario de repuestos automotriz y autolavado, quien tiene una excelente clientela, tiene mucha experiancia en el negocio, su compañera de vida Rosa Amelia se encarga de otro negocio en su casa con una pulperia quien ayuda en los gastos del hogar, tiene 3 hijos, todos estudian 2 la secundaria y 1 la universidad.  Esta solicitando su credito # 1 el que utilizara para la construccion de una tapia y un anexo para un dormitorio, ya que considera que su casa es muy pequeña y desea mayor comodidad para su familia, sobre todo porque sus hijos ya estan bien crecidos.  El Señor F. goza de prestigio y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 52-years old and has never married. He is an experienced business man, owner of a spare auto parts shop and car wash with an excellent customer base. His life partner, Rosa Amelia, is in charge of another business in their house; a local store that helps cover household expenses with its revenues. They have three children, all in school. Two are in high school and one is in college. Sebastian is requesting his first loan, which he will use to build a wall around his home and an extra bedroom. His house is very small and he hopes to make it more comfortable for his family, especially because his children are growing up. Mr. F. has a good reputation and the capacity to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of wall and bedroom

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, quien es mecánico, y el deseo de ambos es el progreso de su familia. Desde hace un año ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas y caballeros, mercadería que lleva a vender de casa en casa por los distintos lugares de su localidad, vendiendo al crédito o al contado, según acuerde con sus clientes. Para ella es muy importante tratar bien a sus clientes, pues de ello depende que le vuelvan a comprar, dice; además que le gusta conocer varios lugares de su ciudad, pues antes de trabajar no salía mucho de casa y hay lugares muy bonitos de su región que la dejan asombrada. Su negocio le viene dando buenas ganancias, pues también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda a vender según su disponibilidad de tiempo y así se generan más ingresos. Para un futuro, a Adela le gustaría tener una zapatería exclusiva para damas porque lo considera más rentable. Este es su 6to créditos con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es no tienen problemas y todos los integrantes son muy comunicativos y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más zapatos y de esa manera incrementará su stock.
texts.en:
Adela is 37 years old and lives with her husband who is a mechanic and the father of her three children. Their desire is the progress of their family. For a year she has been selling shoes for both women and men. She sells the merchandise by going house to house in different areas of her town. She sells on credit or for cash, according to what she agrees on with her customers. It is very important to her to treat her customers well because that determines if they will buy from her again. Additionally, she likes getting to know the different places in her city, since before she worked she didn’t go out of her house a lot and there are many beautiful places in her region that have amazed her. She has made good earnings with her business, and she also counts on the support of her husband, who helps her with sales when he is available, increasing her income. In the future Adela would like to have a shoe store exclusively for women because she considers this more profitable. This is her 6th loan with MFP and what she likes about her village bank is that they don’t have problems and all of the members are very communicative and responsible. With the money she is asking for she will buy more shoes and therefore increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthou Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of 14 people located in Lvea Sa Leu village in Kandal Province, led by Mrs. Chanthou C., the village bank president selected by the members. A pig breeder, Chanthou is married to Mr. Y. Chorn, a village chief and farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. Now Chanthou is requesting a loan to build a piggery for her pig-breeding business. She is 54 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a piggery for her pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aydalina L. es originaria de la Ciudad de Masaya. Este Departamento está ubicado en el pacífico de Nicaragua y es uno de los principales centros de turismo y por ende de comercio del país.

Aydalina tiene 35 años de edad y trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio de elaboración de calzado típico y calzado fino desde hace 8 años. Sus zapatos se venden en el mercado de artesanías de la ciudad y algunos son exportados fuera del país. Que son los zapatos más finos que ellos fabrican.

Este negocio data de muchos años atrás y lo aprendieron de sus padres; Ella tiene dos niños pequeños y por ellos han sido muy esforzados. Trabajó en un grupo solidario y pasó a individual por su record crediticio. Con el negocio han podido mejorar su casa; Su crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima y poder producir más.
texts.en:
Aydalina Lopez lives in the city of Masaya. This Department is located on Nicaragua's Pacific Coast and is one of the country's main tourism destinations and thus an important center of commerce. Aydalina is 35 years old and has worked with her husband manufacturing typical and fine shoes for the past 8 years. They sell their shoes in the city's artesanal market and some, their finest, are exported outside the country. This business has been around for a long time; they learned from their parents. She has two small children and they are the reason they are so dedicated to their work. She began in a solidarity group and, thanks to her credit record, now works as an individual. Their business success has allowed them to make improvements on their home. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials in order to increase their production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoe making raw materials

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
D. Rahmatullo lives with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer since he was young because his parents also grew large amounts of crops. He is happy being a farmer and enjoys it very much and, following the example of his father, he plants and then his wife or son take the products to the market to sell. Rahmatullo also raises and sells cattle. Farming gives Rahmatullo good earnings. He tells us that you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. As such, he fertilizes so that he has a good harvest. This is his second loan with Kiva partner IMON International and he is responsible with his payments. He plans to purchase high-quality seeds, mineral fertilizer and also young cattle. Rahmatullo is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his goals with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.en:
Sherzod is an energetic 20-year-old. From the time he was young he was looking for a way to start his own business to be able to help his parents with family expenses. With much effort he initiated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling soft drinks and juices, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, incorporating the sale of grocery items too and improving the quality of service he offered.

Sherzod needs a loan of 5000 Somoni, which he will use to provide more juices and soft drinks so he can continue to work hard to sustain his family. Sherzod very much appreciates your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing juices and soft drinks

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es: María Irene M. G. es originaria del departamento de La Libertad, es madre soltera, actualmente vive con su hijo quien ya la hizo abuela. María y su hijo Carlos siempre se han tendido mutuamente, son más que una madre e hijo, María manifiesta que su hijo lo es todo en su vida y lo único que ella tiene, y por el que ha trabajado arduamente para sacarle adelante, aunque ahora Carlos ya es hombre independiente económicamente, pero María sigue trabajando en su negocio por el cual es muy conocida en su cantón, es una tienda de productos de consumo para el hogar, la genera ganancias a María, ya que en la zona no hay muchas tiendas, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para poder surtir su negocio y bastecerse de nueva mercadería.
texts.en:
María Irene M. G. is from the La Libertad department. She is a single mother. She currently lives with her son; he has now made her a grandmother. María and her son, Carlos, have always taken care of each other. They are more than mother and son. María says that her son is everything in her life, and he is the only thing she has. She has worked arduously to get him ahead. Even though Carlos is now an economically independent man, María keeps working in her business for which she is very well known in her county. The store carries consumable products for the home. It generates income for María because there are not many stores in the area. She is now asking for a loan to be able stock her store with new merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale dishes for resale

loans.name: Susana Petrona

texts.es: La señora Susana T.  tiene 52 años de edad, es Casada cuanta  con un taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 8  años de elaborar  en los oficios ya mencionados su  residencia  se encuentra en el Paraje Xelajcruz, Cantón Paqui, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para incrementar su negocio, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Susana T. is 52 years old. She is married and has a workshop. She lives with her husband. They are the two employees of their business. For eight years, they have worked in this trade. Their residence is in Paraje Xelajcruz, Cantón Paqui, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The economic conditions that they find themselves in are not sufficient to expand their business. Therefore, they have come to the Asociación ASDIR and requested a loan. They hope this will increase their sales, hoping also to move forward with their family and have better conditions in life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for artisan work

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila P. lives in the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old, married, has six school-aged children and makes a living by selling seafood. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Viginia

texts.en:
Viginia Wanja is 38 years old and married to Peter Gitau .They have two children; Owen and joy. Viginia sells movie and music CD’s and she started her business 10years ago.

Viginia was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. This is her first loan with Kadet and she has never borrowed from any other MFI before. She intends to increase her CD stock with the money and she also wants to bring in many varieties so that she can cater to her clients demand. Her business is doing well and she has many clients who are loyal.

Viginia describes herself as a hard working and determined lady whose hopes and desires are to expand her business and be a wholesale distributor for all kinds of CD’s.

loans.use: Add additional CD's and movies to her stock

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is single. He lives and works in Ivano-Frankivsk with his younger brother. He is in the transportation service business. Sergyi has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, he receives about 5,000 Grivnyas of income each month.  

Sergyi is seeking a 9,000 Grivnya loan to do major engine repairs. His transportation business is the main source of income for him. Sergyi likes to be self-employed as it gives him a chance to have a flexible schedule and make a stable income. Sergyi has cerebral palsy and he believes this type of business is perfect for him. It gives him a chance to support himself and be comfortable doing what he’s doing.

loans.use: To make major engine repairs on his taxi

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Liz es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Liz tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama, además Liz tiene un kiosco escolar en un colegio.
Liz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Liz son que tener una tienda de ropa, zapatos y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the “Banco Comunal Sonrisa” (Smile Communal Bank). She is 22 years old and has one son. She has a restaurant in a rented location and works daily with her mother’s help. She also has a snack stand at a local school. Liz needs a 1000 soles ($350) loan to invest in soft drinks and snacks. She dreams of one day having her own clothing and shoe store and to be able to help her son get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo B. es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución, al igual que su familia ya que son unas personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, pero sobretodo comprometido con su objetivo. Ellos están tramitando este nuevo crédito para la colocación de una losa en el cuarto que tienen en construcción, lo cual es para una mayor amplitud y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Eduardo B. is a distinguished client of our institution. His family members are all very responsible and hard-working, and above all committed to his goals. They are undertaking this loan to install a flagstone floor in the room currently under construction, for additional space and comfort for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of flooring

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina E. N. desde ya hace tiempo compro a un familiar la vivienda donde vive actualmente. Solo que por motivos no ha podido escriturarla, con este crédito lo quieren utilizar para arreglar este tramite ya que es el patrimonio que quieren dejar a su hijo el mas pequeño. 
El esposo de María  Cristina tiene dos trabajos para solventar los gastos y la señora se queda en casa para cuidar a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Cristina E. N. bought the house where she currently lives from a relative a while ago. For several reasons she has not been able to formalize it legally. She will use this loan to settle the transaction because this is the inheritance they want to leave their youngest son. María Cristina’s husband has two jobs to pay the expenses. She stays at home to take car of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legally formalize house ownership

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María Cárdenas es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, ella  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector Don Bosco, Cuenca es muy conocida por su hermosa arquitectura colonial, y su gente que es muy cálida y amable y los diferentes atractivos turísticos que ofrece al visitante nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia es una mujer que siempre dibuja una sonrisa en su rostro y mantiene una buena amistad con todas sus amigas del bankito,  ella  tiene 27 años de edad,  labora en los quehaceares de su casa y cuidado de su familia mientras  su esposo es chofer profesional de un taxi de su propiedad, tienen una niña de diez  años que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, y como aún  no tienen casa propia viven arrendando. 

Este es su segundo crédito en la fundación, con el dinero que pronto recibirá comprará   uniformes y textos escolares  que aun le hacen falta para la educación de su hija, tiene como  sueño ver a su hija ser una profesional en la especialidad que ella escoja.
texts.en:
María Cárdenas is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in the Don Bosco sector of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful colonial architecture, its warm and friendly people, and the various tourist attractions it offers to domestic and foreign visitors. María is a woman who always keeps a smile on her face and maintains good friendships with all of her fellow communal bank members. She is 27 years old and works as a homemaker, taking care of her family while her husband works as a professional taxi driver in a vehicle he owns. They have a ten-year-old daughter who is attending school in the city. They live in rented quarters, since they do not have a house of their own. This is María's second loan with the foundation. With the funds she will soon receive, she will buy school uniforms and textbooks which she still needs for her daughter's education. María's dream is to see her daughter become a professional in the field of her choice.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school uniforms and textbooks for her daughter

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey R., age 44, has lived with his five family members for years in a medium-sized wooden house along the village road of the province of Siem Reap. Mr. R. currently earns daily income by buying and selling piglets. He normally buys the pigs from farmers who live in the rural area. He uses his motor to deliver them to the customer's house. 

To meet the family's foods needs, his wife makes skewers for sale. They have been married for years and are blessed with four single children who help them in the business of making skewers. Mr. R.'s pigs are commanding better prices that make it easier for Mr. R. to earn more income. Mr. R. is lacking capital, so he would like a loan to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inició la Señora Estela C. del comité Santa Ana quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona. 
El comité se Denomina “San Francisco”,  están en el Tercer ciclo con  18 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Iris quien se dedica a la venta D. celulares, ella posee un salón domicilio y ahí sus productos, además D. los aparatos celulares, cuenta con accesorios , reexpuestos y carga D. saldo para todas las líneas que funcionan en el lugar.
El negocio es atendido por ella y sus hijas quienes siempre le ayudan en todo a su madre.
Ella esta muy feliz con su negocio ya la venta siempre es buena y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra D. nuevos modelos D. celulares. 
Se encuentra muy agradecida con las socias del comité, con la Fundación Paraguaya, y KIVA por el apoyo que brinda  a las mujeres con ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
To form this group, called the San Francisco Committee because of its location, Ms. Estela C. of the Santa Ana group contacted her neighbors and friends to begin organizing. The San Francisco Committee is in its third loan cycle with 18 members and their respective productive activities. They are very united, responsible, and supportive as a group. One of the members is Ms. Iris who works selling cell phones. She has a room in her house where she sells her products including the cellular devices together with accessories, parts, and prepaid cards for all the lines that work in the area. She runs the business with the help of her daughters who always help their mother in everything. She is very happy with the business as sales are always good. For this reason she requests a loan to buy new cell phone models. She is very grateful to the members of the committee, with Foundation Paraguay, and with Kiva for the support they have maD. available to the women who want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new cell phone models

loans.name: Bartholomew

texts.en:
Bartholomew is 63 years old, married and has 9 children aged 16 to 37 years old. Two of the children are currently in school. He is a farmer from the Rift valley near the town of Litein. He has been farming for 35 years and has 3 employees. His main products are milk and maize, which he sells to the local market. He also owns some rental houses in Litein and earns income from selling vegetables to the local market.

Bartholomew is one of the many active clients in Juhudi Kilimo. He recently completed his second loan for KES 40,000. He has requested this third loan from Juhudi for KES 40,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The income from this loan will assist him in paying fees for his children. His main challenges in this business have been the shortage of water, which has affected production in the greenhouse (vegetable farm), and lack of machines to prepare the animal feeds.

In the future, he would like to have fully-fledged greenhouses for more vegetable and tomato production. He also intends to construct and improve his dairy units. He says, "Juhudi loans have improved my standard of living, have even helped me increase my rental houses and even buy a car."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda C. is from the village of Gosi Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 59 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting decorative plants for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. Erlinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Jorge Alberto se dedica a brindar el servicio de venta de comida, pues siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy responsable con su actividad económica y con su familia, pues con el apoyo de su compañera de vida han mejorado juntos y le han proporcionado a sus hijos los estudios necesarios, ya que en las afueras de su vivienda es donde ofrecen la variedad de comida como gallo pinto, carne asada, pollo asado, queso frito, empanadas y refrescos. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, frutas, verduras y carnes.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge Alberto makes his living offering the service of food sales. He is known for being very responsible as a business man and with regard to his family. With his wife's help, they have grown together and given their children their necessary education. They sell a variety of food items in the outskirts of where they live: rice and beans, roasted meat, roasted chicken, fried cheese, empanadas (a local item similar to a "hot pocket"), and soft drinks. The financing they are requesting is to purchase raw materials, like basic grains, fruits, vegetables and meats.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Arvin Ramon

texts.es: Arvin Ramón tiene 21 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de comida. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su medio de vida, el tiene muy buenos clientes que ha adquirido con el paso del tiempo pues siempre se ha dedicado a ser una persona muy independiente y trabajadora pues poco a poco es que su negocio ha ido creciendo. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, bolsas, platos y cubiertos plásticos.
texts.en:
Arvin Ramón is 21 years old and his business sells food. He has had this business for more than six years, therefore he has always liked his way of life. He has very good customers, who he has acquired as time went on. He has always been a very independent and hardworking person, so his business has been slowly growing. The loan is for the purchase of raw materials like basic grains, bags, plates, and plastic silverware.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Mabini, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Lolita is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jasmina Elibeth

texts.es: Jasmina Elibeth tiene 34 años, tiene 1 hijos menor de edad a su cargo, ella cuenta con una buena clientela, que siempre llega a su vivienda pues saben que ofrecer mercadería en general. Jasmina se dedica a esto desde hace más de 12 años ella trabaja todos los días y desde muy joven a prendió a ganarse la vida y sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo que no es su primera experiencia con financiamientos, pues han sido necesarios para su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar   perfumes, ropa interior, ropa en general y tratamientos para el cabello y la piel.
texts.en:
Jasmina Elibeth is 34 years old and has one young son, whom she supports. She has good customers who always go to her house because they know that she offers general merchandise. Jasmia has been doing this for more than 12 years. She’s been working every day since she was very young and learned how to make a living and earn enough to pay her household expenses. This is not her first experience with financing, as it has been necessary for her business. She is asking for this loan in order to buy perfume, undergarments, general clothing items, and hair and skin treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, age 33, lives in Bint Jbeil with his wife and their only child. Samir earns his living by repairing cars. This is a business he has been engaged in since 1998. In total, he has 15 years of experience in this kind of work. 

Samir is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to update his machines and expand his business. Samir is professional in his work and expects to grow his business in the future through opening a larger car maintenance company. 

His goal is to provide security and a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To update his car repair equipment

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for three years and has employed one farmhand. He sells his milk at a local market. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority factory.

David is 32 years old. He is married with 3 school-aged children.

He has requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will increase his production and he will earn enough income to enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been animal diseases and lack of enough animal feed. He however hopes to improve the quality of his dairy cows in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina S. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Marina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling home made ice cream delicacies in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 13 años que tiene este negocio, inicio para mejorar los ingresos de su vivienda, tiene una amplia variedad de clientes que llegan a solicitarle diferentes productos, por lo que ha sabido salir adelante. Es con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado adquirir experiencia y además en los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, calzado y ropa interior.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen is 51 years old.  She sells general merchandise and began this business more than 13 years ago to increase her household income.  She’s learned how to get ahead and has a large variety of customers who request different products from her.  Over the years she’s gotten more experience and the loans have been a great help.  She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory, such as pants, shirts, cosmetics, shoes, and underclothing.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “están en el Séptimo Ciclo   con 23  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, todas ellas con diferentes actividades y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité en caso de que alguna de las compañeras necesite.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosalina quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas.
Ella tiene un salón donde ofrece las bebidas que tiene para la venta y nos comenta que los fines de semana tiene la mayor venta.
Además comenta que el negocio le beneficia bastante ya que la venta de bebidas deja buena ganancia y quiere seguir con la misma.
Su familia le ayuda especialmente los fines de semana ya que abre su negocio hasta altas horas de la noche.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Santa María". They are in their seventh cycle, with 23 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because they are very close, supportive and responsible among themselves. All of them have different types of activities and some will start new work. They all have an entreprenurial spirit and work to raise funds for the committee, in case one of the members is in needs them.

One of the members is Rosalina, who sells beverages.  She has a place where she sells the beverages and she tells us that on the weekend she has the highest sales. In addition, she tells us that the business really benefits her since selling beverages earns a good income and she wants to continue doing it. Her family helps her, especially on weekends, since she is open until very late.

loans.use: To buy beverages such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and more.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Teresa M. B. de oficio secretaria labora para UPONIC es soltera y solicita crédito para ampliar su habitación comprar playsen y madera, clavos y mano de obra. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su beligerancia.
texts.en: Teresa M. B. is an office secretary who works for UPONIC. She is single and is seeking a loan to improve her home. She would like to buy fiberboard building material, wood and nails and she would like to hire a worker. She thanks CEPRODEL for its activism.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Barangay 3, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a candy-making business. Her husband Agapito M., who is 38 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have four children who are between 3 and 14 years old, and all of them are currently going to school. 

Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Mercy M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a business selling food, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Esther hopes to own a retail shop.        

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her new games.

loans.use: food

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias G. is from the village of Kidahon, Gingoog City. He is 57 years old. Elias is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elias owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack  foods in the local community. Elias has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products sell. Elias is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory like snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elias from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 35 años, convive con Cledia, de 32 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 años: Junior, de 15, Sarai, de 13 y Amitai, de 3 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruano). La siembra de café, plátanos, es la principal actividad económica de Rafael; junto a su esposa e hijos todos los fines de semana se dedican al cuidado de sus sembríos, los cuales después de cada cosecha los comercializa en las ciudades de La Merced y Villarica, donde viaja constantemente. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y para más adelante está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus frutos, pues desea incursionar en el negocio de las licitaciones, donde podrá abastecer los requerimientos del estado peruano, en los diferentes comedores populares, cárceles y demás instituciones. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y asegura que el trabajo conjunto, compromiso y solidaridad, lograrán que su banco comunal, sea una de los mejores. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar lo necesario para plantar viveros, y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la limpieza de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Rafael, 35, lives with Cledia, 32.  They have four children together but only three live with them: Junior, 15, Sarai, 13 and Amitai, 3 months.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  His main economic activity is banana and coffee farming.  Together with his wife and children they dedicate every weekend to their plants.  Each harvest is then sold in the cities of La Merced and Villarica where he travels to constantly.

He has been a farmer for 5 years and later on plans to improve the quality of his fruits because he wants to go into the business of bidding for requirements of the Peruvian state to supply popular dining rooms, jails and other institutions.

This is the first loan he’s had with MFP and he assures that the joint work, commitment and solidarity will make his communal bank be one of the best ones.

He will use the loan he’ll get to buy what he needs for his nurseries and if there is enough money he will invest in clearing his fields.

loans.use: To buy coffee and banana plants as well as to hire laborers to clear the fields that will be planted.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo, es un cliente de 26 años, conviviente quien reside en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.


Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. El cría ganado ovino y vacuno en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda alimentándoles de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente comercializa leche a la Municipalidad Distrital de Tambogrande. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía.


Erasmo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen de mejor modo. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Erasmo is a client who is 26 years old. He lives with his partner in one of the small towns in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area in Piura, which is located more than 3.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

He has a business related to raising and selling livestock. He raises sheep and cattle in some corrals that are located near his home. He fattens them by feeding them natural grasses and when they have reached a good weight he offers them for sale to the general public, and also to businesspeople who visit the area where he lives. He also sells milk in the Municipal District of Tambogrande. This business allows him to help his family with expenses.

Erasmo would like to buy balanced feed to improve the growth of his animals so they can achieve better development. This will help him to improve the income from his sales. In order to achieve his goal, he has requested a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve the growth of his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: upgrade her mini-market's refrigeration and expand stock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the village of Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Josephine is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that he can expand his facilities

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is single with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hadija has operated a vegetable stall for the past 10 months, selling at retail prices to her local neighbors. Hadija faces a major challenge of high transportations costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her food stall in the future.

Hadija plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, mangoes, onions and bananas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of assorted vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.fr: Gaspard M.  est commerçant dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Il a 41 ans, il est marié, née à Rutsiro-Rwanda, et il a 6 enfants entre 16 ans et 2 ans, et aussi 1 personne en charge.  4 de ses enfants vont à l’école, et il a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des  50 tôles pour couverture de sa maison, 40 planches pour les portes, 2portes métalliques, 2 fenêtres, 10kgs de clous pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est la construction d’une belle maison et beaucoup d’autres pour les locataires et  en  bénéficier de plus.  Il voudrait devenir une grand locataire.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille, scolariser ses enfants, ainsi tous les enfants a sa charge.
texts.en: Gaspard M. is a businessman in the area of Rubavu.  He is 41 years old, married, a native of Rutsiro-Rwanda, and has 6 children between the ages of 2 and 16 as well as one other person in his care.  Four of his children attend school and he himself finished 2 years of secondary school.  This loan is his first cycle with ACB and he will use it to purchase 50 sheets of metal for the roof of his house, 40 planks for the doors, 2 metal doors, 2 windows and 10 kg of nails.  His strategy for increasing business is the construction of a beautiful house and many others for the current tenants and to attract more.  He would like to become a big landlord.  For his life, he would like to improve the quality of life of his family, educate his children and all the children in his care.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal, planks, windows, nails, etc... for the construction of his house

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 50-year-old lady who has three children. She has a hobby creating and organizing plastic plants and flowers as decorations.  

Two years ago Khadra took a loan to start a small home-based business making this kind of decorations and selling them. Over these two years, her business has grown and gained a good reputation in the neighborhood.  She also started to give courses to teach how to make such things. 

Now Khadra is applying for a second loan in order to open a special independent store to sell her handmade decorations (plastic plants and flowers).

loans.use: To open a store of her own to sell her handmade decorations.

loans.name: Kitunga Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Ivan is the leader of the Kitunga Tukore group in Kihihi. He is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He has a retail shop that deals in general merchandise at the Kanyasti trading center in Kitunga.  From this business he is able to generate 400,000 UGX monthly in income.  He is also involved in the selling of tea leaves and it is from this business that he got the capital to open up a retail shop. 

Ivan is very hard-working and his dream is to educate his children and expand his business. He is quick to say that the loans have enabled him to improve his business working capital and he is very grateful for that. He needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items for his store.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other items for his store

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa D. 48 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con unos familiares, no cuenta con ningún servicio , ubicado en el caserio San Isidro que pertenece al distrito D. TambogranD., a una hora D. distancia del departamneto D. Piura.  Esta zona  se caracteriza por tener una mucha actividad agricola, ganadera, artesanía y turismo. 

Rosa se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catálogo, ésta actividad lo realiza desD. hace algunos años, tiene su propia clientela que le hace pedidos, pero además recorre las casas D. su caserío ofreciendo sus productos.  Los cuales sirven para  mejorar la imagen personal, y son consumidos por más clientela femenina, con estos ingresos D. sus ventas se ayuda para solventar sugastos y necesidades.

A solicitado Rosa a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles para comprar productos y exhibirlos en su casa y así sus clientas tengan esos productos a la mano cuandolo deseen. Con los ingresos D. la venta D. todos sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado y mejoraría su calidad D. vida.  Rosa es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy responsable con su clientela y negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old, she lives in her own home with some family members but her home doesn’t have any basic services. Rosa’s home is located in the San Isidro hamlet, district of TambogranD. an hour from the department of Piura. Most of the inhabitants in the area are farmers, cattle breeders and in handicrafts.

Rosa has been selling beauty products by catalogue for several years. She has her own customer base that she takes orders from, and goes to houses in her neighborhood offering her products. Rosa’s products serve to improve ones personal image and they are consumed mostly by females. She uses her earnings to help meet her expenses and needs.

Rosa went to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy products and show them at home so that her customers have greater access to them. With the income from the sales of all of her products she will be able to pay back the loan and improve her quality of life. Rosa is very well-known for being a hardworking, happy and very responsible woman with her customers and business.

loans.use: buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a housewife but she offers her full support to her family at their time of need. She prepares decorative embroidered clothes. She is expert in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 
She also sews clothes and has a good name among her clients due to the good quality of her work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who operates a business selling garments. His shop is located in the market and he sells pants, t-shirts and other garments to his clients at cheap rates. Her husband is 63 years old and sells milk as well as animals. He has some goats at his home, which he used to sell to butchers for a profit. 

Naseem has five sons and a daughter. Her second son also operates a business selling garments and the third one works abroad. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school getting their education. Naseem is hopeful that purchasing garments in larger quantity will enable her son to improve the financial condition of his business. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur, 41, is the leader of this group. She resides in the small town of Nookat with a population of approximately 13 000 people. The residents of the town most of the year enjoy caressing sun rays and fresh air. Ainur is a native resident, who was born, grew up and built a family here. She is the mother of five children, the youngest of whom is 3. She married her spouse Orozali Mamataliev 21 years ago. In 2001, joining their efforts, Ainur and Orozali started cultivating several hectares of land using start up capital of 2 000 soms. The soil together with the favorable weather conditions of Nookat and its nourishing water, turned out a rich harvest. Now the children are grown and are capable of accomplishing their own portion of field work. Relying on his skills and knowledge in architecture, Orozali was accepted as a construction worker to a local company. Currently Ainur cultivates potatoes, corn and sunflowers.
