She believes that intensive work and care will bring a rich harvest this fall. For now she still has a lot to do including using fertilizers. Ainur hopes that a loan from Kiva with the help of Mol Bulak Finance will allow her purchase some fertilizers.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Yola Paquita

texts.es:
Yola es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad, es  viuda y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene educación primaria. 
Ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales domésticos como vacunos y ovinos.  Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año,  con su primer préstamo  D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles compró dos ovejas.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra  D. dos vacas para engordarlas por dos meses y poder venderlas a buen precio. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener más capital para comprar más ganados y obtener buenas ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yola, 50, is a member of the Virgen D. Concepcion community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is a widow with 2 children.  She has an elementary school education.  
Yola operates a livestock business, raising and selling farm animals: cattle and sheep, for example.  She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year.  She used her first loan, for S/.500 new soles, to buy two sheep.  
She will use this loan, for S/.2000 new soles, to buy two head of cattle that she will fatten for two months so that she can sell them for a better price.  Her two children help her with the business.
Yola wants to increase her working capital so that she can buy more head of cattle and, in turn, increase her income.  
Her favorite things about her community bank are the meetings and the ease of borrowing.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle for a livestock business.

loans.name: Metodia

texts.en:
Metodia, a 61-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol, has had a sari-sari store business for eight years. She sells items such as softdrinks, chips, sugar, shampoo and other daily-use products to the people in her community. She is also sometimes hired to cook for parties and other events.

Metodia is requesting a loan of 13000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Vicuñas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑAS DE ORO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Claudina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Comedera, tejido de mantas, venta de espejos, albañil, carpintería, producción de chicharrones.

La señora Claudina,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de comida que inicio desde hace dos años, el que aprendió de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra aumentar su capital (compra de fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.) que comprará por mayor de la Ceja y 16 de Julio y que posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en una parada de minibus. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Vicuñas de Oro” (Golden Vicuñas) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Claudina.  The members are engaged in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: eatery, blanket weaving, mirror sales, bricklaying, carpentry and fried pork production.

Claudina indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a business selling food that she started two years ago and that she learned from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital; she will purchase noodles, rice, sugar, etc. at wholesale in La Ceja and 16 de Julio market.  Once she makes the food she’ll sell it at a minibus stop.  This way of working allows her to generate family income because she’s single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the credit and health training.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad 57 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su señora esposa. El va a comprar con su crédito los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de sus siembras de tomate y chile. El cuenta con la siembra de tomate y chile ya establecida en un área de excelentes condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirla y poder obtener mejores resultados de ella. El tiene como meta obtener una buena cosecha de estos cultivos y fortalecer su proyecto cada día más y si es posible ir creciendo con su proyectico. También el quiere generar las ganancias para así salir adelante con los pagos del crédito y seguir dándole una buena calidad de vida  a su señora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 57 years old, and lives in a civil union with his wife.  He is going to use the loan to buy the supplies needed to care for his tomato and chili pepper crops.  He relies on these tomato and chili pepper crops.  He has already established them in an area with excellent conditions, to which he wants to attend and improve his results.   His goal is to have a good harvest from these crops and to strengthen his project every day, and if possible to grow with his project.  He also wants to generate profits in order to get ahead with the loan repayments and to continue to provide a good quality of life for his wife. 

This is his first loan received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans previously through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his tomato and chili pepper crops.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж вместе с детьми находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Гулбахор имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке района. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает школьную форму и женские национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности Гулбахор занимается уже два года. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in Shahritus region, she is 47 years old and has completed high school. Gulbahor is married and has three children. Her husband and her children are all working away in Russia. She herself is working in retail at the local market. Gulbahor has a market stall where she sells school uniforms and women's national clothes. Gulbahor has been selling clothing for the last two years. She would like to take out this loan to purchase clothes for the upcoming fall and the starting school season.

loans.use: To buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria tiene 39 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de prodcutos. Angela es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, que cuentan con educación secundaria. Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, papel higiénico, detergentes otros productos. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para empezar a brindarle a sus clientes lo que le solicitan. Ella se siente feliz por tener algo que le genere ganancias.
texts.en: Ángela Maria is 39 years old, and she has a local store. She's had this store for more than 6 months. The majority of her clients request a large varieties of products. She is a single mother and has 3 children, with a secondary education. This loan is to buy grains, candy, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent, and other products. Every day she has to get up early to give her customers what they ask for. She's happy to have something that gives her income.

loans.use: to buy grain, candy, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, esta casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 06 y 04 años, por ello trabaja muy duro para poder darles una buena educación. El trabajo de Loyda se inicia desde muy temprano, sale a su taller, lugar que alquila en un local cerca del centro de la ciudad. Ella es una socia de un negocio en el que se dedican al alquiler y vender disfraces, y en este mismo lugar tiene su pequeño taller de costura, en donde a parte de hacer los disfraces y otras cosas, brinda el servicio de costura a sus clientes. Realiza un muy buen trabajo y es por eso que es muy buscada, tiene meses en este lugar, pues anteriormene lo ejercia en su casa. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que puede compartir con personas con quienes se lleva muy bien, a parte de tener un buen ingreso para su hogar. Espera poder crecer en este trabajo ya que tiene muchas expectativas a futuro. Este será el segundo préstamo que tiene por ello desea el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales de costura para así tener en cantidad, asimismo desea comprar productos para instalar una pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Loyda, 36, is a very cheerful, enthusiastic woman.  She’s married and lives in her own house with her husband and three children who are 11, 6 and 4 years old.  Because of that she works very hard to be able to provide them with a good education.  

Loyda’s work starts very early.  She goes out to her workshop, a place she rents downtown.  She’s a partner in a business dedicated to costume rentals and sales.  She also has a small sewing workshop here where besides making costumes and other items, she also provides sewing services to her customers.  She does very good work so she is quite sought after.  She’s been in this place for a few months because she used to work from home.  What she likes about her work is being able to spend time with people that she gets along with very well besides earning good household income.  

This will be her second loan and she hopes to have your support.  She will use the amount requested to buy sewing supplies in order to have them in quantity.  She also wants to buy merchandise to set up a small store.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
A sus 21 años de edad Mary Luz es una luchadora incansable, que trabaja con la ilusión de brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo de 11 meses, y para su fortuna cuenta con el apoyo de su familia que le han ayudado mucho a sacar su negocio adelante, trabaja diariamente en la producción y venta de buñuelos y aunque no son muchas las ganancia Mary Luz sueña con llegar a tener un gran negocio que sea reconocido por sus clientes y allegados.

Actualmente Mary Luz necesita un préstamo para invertirle a su negocio, comprar insumos como harina, queso, aceite, huevos y otros con los cuales se hacen los buñuelos, pues comprando en mayores cantidades las utilidades serán mejores y sus ingresos se incrementaran, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su bebe.
texts.en:
At the age of 21, Mary Luz is an indefatigable fighter who works cheerfully to provide a better future for her 11-month-old son.  Luckily, she has her parents' support since they help her with the business.  She works every day making and selling "buñuelos" (doughnuts), and even though her earnings aren't high Mary Luz dreams about having a great business that is recognized by customers and acquaintances.

Mary Luz is currently in need of a loan to invest in her business.  She needs to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, oil, eggs and other items to make the buñuelos.  If she buys larger volumes she can cut costs and increase her income, which will improve her baby's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "buñuelos" (doughnuts).

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina tiene 36 años de edad esta casada  desde hace 17 años con el señor Javier quien  trabaja de comerciante vendiendo fantasía y bonetería. Juntos han procreado cinco hijos Gamaliel de 15 años que esta estudiando la preparatoria, Diana Lizet que tiene trece años ella está cursando tercero de secundaria, Leidi Esmeralda de 12 años está en el segundo año de secundaria, Litzi Joselin que tiene 10 años ella está en quinto año de primaria, Alan Daniel de 7 años el más pequeño está cursando el segundo año de primaria.
Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 17 años, la cual tiene el nombre de “Miscelánea el paso” esta vea ha solicitado para subastara su tienda de abarrotes ya que la hacen falta varios productos como alimentos enlatados, leche, azúcar, pan, huevo, aceite, etc. Comprara lo que cree que vende más en este caso serian los productos alimenticios.
El desafío que presenta es la competencia que tiene en sus comunidad ya que hay ya muchas tiendas, sin embargo quiere dar la mejor calidad y a precios más bajos para poder aumentar su clientela ya que es una de sus metas aumentar y no perder, también un problema es cuando da fiado y no le quieren pagar.
Otras de sus metas es expandir su negocio “Yo estoy muy gradecida con el préstamo que nos otorgan ya que para mí y para mi familia es de gran ayeada para suplir los gastos del hogar y escúllela”
texts.en: Florentina is 36 and has been married to her husband Javier since age 17.  Her husband sells costume jewelry and accessories. Together they are raising 5 children: Gamaliel, age 15, Diana Lizet, 13, Leidi Esmeralda, 12, Litzi Joselin,10 and Alan Daniel, 7.  Florentina has run a small store since she was 17, called “Miscelánea el paso.”  She seeks this loan to buy inventory of food items such as milk, sugar, eggs, canned items and other products.  She wants to buy mostly foodstuffs since they are fast-selling items.  She faces several challenges such as competition in her community from other stores, and seeks to provide good service and low prices to grow her customer base.  Another difficulty is that many clients want to run credit tabs instead of paying cash for purchases.  Florentina also has the goal of growing her business.  She notes “I am very grateful for this loan which is of great help to my family to meet our household and school expenses.”

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, eggs, canned items and other food products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is single. 
Rosalie has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Rosalie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosalie hopes to have a successful business because she wants to help her parents.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es: María Hilda D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, jabones, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad y últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita con productos D. excelente calidad a precios accesibles; María siempre esta alegre es la mejor arma en su trabajo ya que eso la motiva a mejorar cada día, para ella lo más importante para adquirir el compromiso del éxito en la vida es creer en uno mismo, confía en sus capacidades es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, pan, granos básicos, productos instantáneos, jabones, etc. María Hilda tiene fe que así lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: María Hilda is 42 years old and lives with her life companion and their children.  She has a store where she sells basic staple items like rice, beans and soap.  Her store is very well known in her community and she’s acquired quite a few customers lately because she always has what people need: quality products at affordable prices.  María is always cheerful; this is her main weapon at work because it motivates her to improve daily.  For her, the most important thing to achieve success in life is to believe in oneself, to trust in our abilities.  Because of this, she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy snacks, bread, basic grains, instant products, soap, etc.  María Hilda has faith that she’ll manage to proviD. a better quality of life for her family this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yanira Neptalina

texts.es:
Yanira, se dedica a atender un comedor, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, el negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, adquirió experiencia como empleada, no tiene un horario establecido ya que se adecua según la demanda.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería como aceite, arroz, pollo, carne, condimentos, bebidas, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar el inventario en el comedor, abasteciéndose D. toda la mercadería que necesita para preparar los alimentos D. la venta.
La aspiración D. Yanira es tener estabilidad en el negocio, aumentar el espacio para atener a más clientes, y sobre todo mejorar las condiciones D. su familia.
texts.en:
Yanira runs an eatery.  She lives with her husband and two children.  The business arose through her own initiative.  She gained experience working as an employee.  She does not have a fixed work schedule since she adjusts to demand.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise like rice, oil, chicken, meat, condiments and beverages.  This purchase will help her increase inventory in the eatery supplying her with all the merchandise she needs to prepare the meals to sell.

Yanira’s goal is to have a stable business, to increase space to accommodate more customers and, above all, to improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, chicken, meat, condimetns and beverages.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is a farmer from the village of Boriti. He is 32 years old and lives with his family: his wife – Ia, three daughters, and parents. His elder children go to school. Badri and Ia work in a local restaurant. Badri works as a waiter and Ia is a cook. Along with their main jobs, Badri and Ia are leading the family agricultural business. They have 200 vines and sell harvested grapes at a local market. Also the family grows various vegetables on the 1 hectare of land they own, and they sell the harvested vegetables at a local market as well. The family's total average monthly income is 600 Laris. 

Badri has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. The family will produce cheese and sell it at a local market. Their income will increase, and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: La socia Adelayda se sigue dedicando a trabajar haciendo limpieza departamentos y tambien sigue vendiendo productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes,la socia los productos de belleza lo vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio y trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales al por mayor.
texts.en: The member, Adelayda, is still continuing to work by cleaning departments and also selling beauty products like creams and perfumes.  The member sells these beauty products independently, through this business and work she moves forward for her children. The member wants to expand and improve the business of selling beauty products. The credit she is requesting is to purchase beauty products like perfumes, creams and lipstick wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products like perfumes, creams and lipstick wholesale.

loans.name: Gonzalo Adalberto

texts.es:
Gonzalo, quien es un agricultor, nuevamente tiene el plan de iniciar su cultivo de maíz, pipían, plátano, por eso solicita otro préstamo e invertirlo en insumos como abono, herbicidas y semillas de los productos antes mencionados, para iniciar en estos días el nuevo proceso de siembra.
El ha tenido buenos resultados de las inversiones anteriores ya que a pesar de la afectación de las lluvias en su cultivo, siempre logró sacar producción para alimentar a su familia y además logró cancelar el préstamo anterior.
texts.en: Gonzalo is a farmer and is about to plant new maize, chili peppers and plantain crops.  He is requesting another loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and seeds for the above mentioned products.  In the next few days he will start planting.  He has obtained good results from previous investments, because despite the rains affecting his crops he was able to produce enough to feed his family and pay off the last loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Madeleyne

texts.es:
Madeleyne tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Madeleyne trabaja en uno de los terminales terrestres de la ciudad del Cusco en una de las agencias de viajes en el área de venta de boletos de viajes. Madeleyne requiere el préstamo para uso personal como por ejemplo para la educación, alimentación de sus hijos.  

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Madeleyne is 38 years old and she has a domestic partnership that has produced two children.  She was born in the province and department of Cusco and she lives in the beautiful city in which she was born.  Madeleyne works selling tickets at a travel agency in one of Cusco's train stations.  Madeleyne needs this loan for personal use, such as the education and nourishment of her children.

The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who get their families ahead.  Most of its members live and work in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for being a big tourist attraction, for its business, for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration, and because it is the location of one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to educate and feed her children

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Mari is a dress maker. She decided to begin her business because her husband earns a minimal salary that does not allow him to cover all the home expenses. In that situation Mari has been worried. Then she stared to work and began doing seamstress work around her neighborhood. She is constantly gaining more customers because she always does a good job. Mari has very young children and need them an education, and for that reason she works very hard to cover all her necessities.

She needs a loan of $750 USD to purchase a sewing machine, which will allow her to have a bigger capacity to cover her orders from her clients. She plans to return the loan in 6 months and with your help she can grow and improve her business.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Mari es una costurera, decidió iniciar su negocio a raíz de que su esposo gana un salario mínimo que no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Por lo que esta situación mantenía a Doña Mari preocupada, entonces empezó a trabaja, comenzó haciendo trabajos de costura alrededor de su barrio entre vecinos y conocidos, sin embargo cada vez mas personas la buscan por su buen trabajo. Doña Mari tiene hijos muy jóvenes que necesitan de una educación, por lo que ella trabaja muy duro todos los días para cubrir sus necesidades.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $750 USD para comprar una maquina de cocer, esto le permite tener una mayor capacidad de enfrentar sus pedidos de sus clientes. Planea regresar el préstamo en 6 meses y con tu ayuda ella puede crecer y mejorar en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en: Saboat M. is a very optimistic always-smiling person. She has three children and her husband works as a teacher. She started her own business five years ago. At that time she had a place at the open-air market and the desire to improve the conditions of work motivated her to succeed. Today her trade site is at one of the busiest closed markets in town. The turnover of her trade is very fast and she feels very lucky.  Now she doesn’t have to work under rain, snow and during very hot summers. Most of her clients are young women and she would like to expand by adding goods especially aimed for men. She will use the loan to buy additional goods and with bigger volume of goods to sell, she will ask her oldest son to help her in her work.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a stand where she sells fresh fruit and juice. Maria used to sell vegetables from her stand, but because profits were not sufficient she and her husband decided to try something different. After being forced to move from their old location because they did not have government permits, they moved the stand to a location closer to their home. Maria and her husband prepare the juice and fruit salad in the mornings. While Maria stays at the stand, her husband travels around the community in his tricycle cart selling the fresh juice and fruit salad.

This is Maria's second loan with Kiva and Mifex. With her first loan she purchased new types of utensils and appliances. She purchased a new blender, sandwich maker and juicer. Although she had planned to invest in a new cart, when time came to make the investment she decided it was a wiser move to reinforce her current stand before venturing into a new point of sale. She is happy with the decision now that she can work much more efficiently and her client base has increased. Her second loan will be directed towards making the investment in a new cart as she planned before.

Maria is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. They live in her husband’s family's house where they pay rent. Maria’s goal is to save up enough money to buy herself and her children a home.

Translated by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy a new tricycle cart

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell shoes. He wants to get $1200 from AL-Aman to bring more goods. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Cristian  Sergio

texts.es:
" I have a small business selling new & used clothes out of my home. My sells are good, but I would like to purchase more merchandise to offer my clients more of a variety since most of the things my clients want are very expensive. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to reinvest it in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una venta de ropa nueva y usada en mi casa y mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 600.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To reinvest in his business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo. She lives in the San Martín region, province and district of Lamas. Her business is located on Jr. Junín Cdra. 1 (Municipal Market of Lamas) and she specializes in the production and sale of baked goods such as mini-sandwiches, bread, cookies and muffins.

Thanks to the help of her husband and children, along with her own strength, she has been successful in expanding her business. She first started producing small quantities and now she produces over hundreds of baked goods. She sells at her own stand in the market, where she has a large number of clients. She also delivers her product to other stores around the area.

With the recent credit she received from Manuela Ramos of $500 that will be paid back in four months, she will purchase products such as flour, sugar in quantities of 50 kilos, butter, and other ingredients for the production of her baked goods.

Mrs. Francisca is 65 years old and lives with her husband and her grandson. She works everyday in order to meet her goals. She also demonstrates that there are no limits. With dedication and strength, goals can be easily achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas y distrito de Lamas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Junín Cdra. 1 (mercado municipal de Lamas) y se dedica a la producción y venta de bocaditos como rosquitas, kekitos, panes, biscochos, entre otros. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, pues en sus inicios producía en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente produce bocaditos por cientos, los cuales vende en su puesto del mercado, tiene gran clientela, además reparte sus productos a diferentes bodegas de la localidad. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 ($ 500.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará insumos como harina, azúcar en sacos de 50 kilos, manteca en latas, y otros para la elaboración de sus bocaditos y cumplir con todos los pedidos pendientes. La señora Francisca tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo y su nieto, trabaja diariamente, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir las metas, no hay limites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat A. is one of  Microinvest’s most active clients, and over the last few years has proved to be an especially skillful, responsible and hard-working businesswoman. Her customers like doing business with her because she is very friendly and has a nice selection of items for sale. She has applied for a loan to increase the number and variety of goods available in her shop during the busy holiday season.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
In preparatory school, Laura Elena took a sewing class, which she liked very much. Also, she was motivated to take up this career choice due to the fact that classmates who had taken this course and who were working in this field informed her that they earned good money while still having free time to enjoy other activities. Consequently, she was encouraged to start her own tailoring business. Little by little, she is becoming known in her area.

It is for this that Laura Elena is soliciting a credit of US $375, which will be repayed within 3 months. With this money, Laura will buy materials such as fabric, thread, and other products needed to make her products. She can then continue growing her business and give better service to her customers. With your help, Laura will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Laura Elena en la preparatoria tomó un curso de corte y confección ya que a ella le gusta mucho. También otra motivación que la llevó a esta actividad fue que sus compañeras que tomaron este curso ya estaban trabajando en esta actividad y le comentaron que les dejaba buenos ingresos y hasta un tiempo libre para más actividades. Fue así como se animó a poner un taller de costura. Poco a poco se está dando a conocer en sus alrededores.

Es por eso que Laura Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Laura comprará mercancía como telas, hilos, y otros productos necesarios para poder elaborar sus productos y así seguir creciendo su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Rwamunono

texts.en: Rwamunono P., a single mother of 5 primary school-going children, has run a retail shop at Kazo town for 7 years. She is our client and she has taken loans of $150 and $300 before, which have helped her in paying school fees for her children, buying household items, and buying a plot of land in Kazo town. She needs a loan of $300 to help her restock her shop with kerosene, cartons of soap, and cooking oil. Her dream is to complete the unfinished building on the plot of land that she bought and buy more land for her children.

loans.use: To restock her shop with kerosene, cartons of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Busazi East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nulu M.. She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize from surrounding villages. Nulu is 36 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Nulu makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for the children and re-invest in the business. Nulu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nulu is joined in her small group by Janet Nayiga, Metrini N., Aisha N., and Habiba N.. Janet Nayiga has a business in clothing sales and wants to boost business. Metrini N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add stock. Aisha N. operates a business trading produce and wants to add more capital. Habiba N. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To add to maize business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 46 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages19 and 23 years old. Adelina owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business and to do some renovations on her store.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics at whole-sale price

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Louise B., aged 45, is married and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona – in Senegal’s Ziguinchor region - for seven years. She runs a business selling gold-plated jewelry. She gets the jewelry from France with the help of her sister. She uses her income to contribute to the family expenses and put towards finding a permanent stall. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Louise B., 45 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de bijoux en plaqué or. Les bijoux lui viennent de la France avec l’aide de sa sœur. Avec ses revenus elle participe aux charges familiales et cherche le moyen de se trouver une cantine. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Jewelry business

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr:
This woman is an experienced dressmaker. She is seeking a loan to buy fabrics and sewing materials in order to increase her inventory of ready-to-wear clothing. This mother of ten manages to support her husband with this business. She also participates in training young girls in the techniques of making clothes.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Cette dame est une couturiére expérimentée, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des tissus et de la mercerie afin d'augmenter son stock de prêt à porter. Avec activité, cette mére d'uine dizaine d'enfants, arrive à soutenir son mari. Aussi elle participe à la formation des jeunes filles ux techniques de confection : coupe et couture.

loans.use: Sewing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more drinks to keep running her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, 56 years old, is the mother of 4 children who work and study. She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is a mechanic and who supports her a lot.

She owns 3 motocycles, which are driven by her sons who take care of transporting passengers. She bought these vehicles a year ago, and she is the one in charge of managing family expenses and the earnings from the motocycles. Her husband is in charge of repairing them and maintaining them in good condition.

What she likes about her work is that it generates good income and things are going well now.

With a loan, Carmen would like to buy replacements parts and repair her motorcycles so they are in good condition and continue to generate income. Later on she would like to have some rooms built onto her house and rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, de 56 años, es madre de 4 hijos que estudian y trabajan, vive junto a su esposo Jorge, quien es mecánico y la apoya mucho.

Ella es propietaria de 3 motocarros, los mismos que manejan sus hijos, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, hace ya un año que compró estos vehículos y es la que se encargada de administrar los gastos familiares y las ganancias de los motocarros, su esposo es el encargado de reparar cualquier falla y mantenerlos en buen estado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos y por ahora le va muy bien.

Con el dinero del préstamo, Carmen, quiere comprar repuestos y reparar sus motos para que estén en buen estado y sigan generando ingresos, ya que posteriormente quiere mandar a construir habitaciones en su vivienda para arrendarlos.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycles.

loans.name: Martha Delia

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio porque desde niña le gusto ese oficio de estilista y desde la edad de 19 años empezó a tomar cursos. ella quería desarrollarse en lo profesional poniendo en practica lo que había aprendido en los cursos sin descuidar a los niños, solo que por algunas cuestiones no había podido iniciar su negocio pronto hasta hace 1 año y medio aproximadamente empezó con su salón de belleza y ha tenido muy buena respuesta.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material e trabajo como: tintes, peróxidos, tratamientos y material para la estética.
texts.en:
Martha began her business because since she was a child she liked the trade of a stylist. And, when she was 19 years old she began taking classes. Martha wanted to develop herself in the professional realm, putting into practice what she had learned in the classes, without neglecting her children. Only due to some issue she had not been able to begin her business until a year and a half ago, when she began her beauty salon. She has had a good response in this short time. Martha needs a $475 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase material and work such as dye, peroxides, treatments and esthetic material.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dies and other materials for her hair salon.

loans.name: Mahwish

texts.en: Mahwish Baji is married to A. A.. Since last year, the couple has been living in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, located 40 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Mahwish Baji’s husband earns income selling buffalo milk to a number of shops. He has been involved in this business for the last 10 years. Presently, A. A. owns two buffalos.  Mahwish Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman runs a small business selling toys in Belaya Tserkov. He has a vending facility in one of the local markets called “Oberyg”. He launched his small venture 4 years ago and has been growing it since then. Roman realizes one big advantage he has in this market - low competition in this sphere of trade. This factor has helped him considerably in expansion of his business--up to 15,000 Grivnas invested in turnover capital.

Roman’s two sons are his testing experts. They always help him choose the best quality and saleable merchandise. This time Roman is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory. We believe his hard work and determination will help Roman repay the current loan. Moreover, it will help him fulfill his long-term goal of starting a second business. He plans to offer transportation for market vendors traveling to wholesale centers to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Irma Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Irma O. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote dedicándose a su negocio de pulpería donde vende sus productos en su propia casa de habitación. Se ha destacado como una persona muy esforzada que tiene grandes deseos de superación en su negocio. 

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por la razón de que ha logrado beneficiarla con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos y también ha logrado comprar una vitrina para colocar dichos productos. 

La razón por la cual ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es para obtener el financiamiento para la compra de los productos y así comercializarlos en su pulpería que necesita de mucha inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma O. is originally from Nagarote and she has a small general store in her home. She is known as a strong person with great desire to have her business be successful. Ceprodel has been a pillar for her business because of the loans it provided in order to buy products and also to be able to buy a display case to display said products, benefiting her business. The reason she has asked Ceprodel for a loan is to obtain financing to buy products to sell in her store, which requires an investment of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D., 52 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du citron et du bois pour préparer et vendre de la bouillie de mil. Ses revenus vont permettre d’assurer une partie des charges familiales.   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa D., age 52, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kadior for seven and a half years. She want to buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge

loans.name: Anacleta Anastacia

texts.es: Doña Anacleta Menchú cuenta con 30 años de edad, es Madre Soltera de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a  sus 2 hijos, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Anacleta Menchú is 30 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 2 children. She is a seamstress and makes traditional women's clothing. She has three looms and 2 employees working for her business. Doña Anacleta has been making traditional garments for 8 years from her home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala. Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for her to increase her capital. For this reason, Doña Anacleta has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she can increase her weekly sales. With this loan, she hopes to help her children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (to purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks to people in her community. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She needs a loan of  N140000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nilo

texts.es: Nilo tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente con su pareja por 5 años y tienen un hijo, actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres. Labrar la tierra es parte de su vida, creció en la chacra realizando el cultivo de productos como; la papa, alverjas y maíz, y hasta el día de hoy lo sigue haciendo, los días que no tiene trabajo en la chacra, va con sus toros para el arado en las chacras de sus vecinos y familiares, quienes que le pagan por cada terreno entre 50 a 80 soles dependiendo de la extensión. Por ello que su preocupación mayor es de alimentar muy bien a sus toros por la mañana antes de salir de su casa, para ello compra las hojas secas después de cada cosecha de maíz. Las agallas y la fuerza para saber usar el arado las heredó de su padre, y de ello se siente muy orgulloso, además, nos comenta, que hay que saber domar al animal, de lo contrario no se puede arar. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser un cliente muy puntual, y del mismo modo tiene mucha muestras de gratitud a quienes le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito que le permite seguir trabajando. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de hojas secas para la alimentación de sus toros, y la otra parte es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de arvejas.
texts.en:
Nilo Mancillo G. is 27 years old, lives with a common-law wife and has one son. At present they live with his parents. Nilo works the soil as a farmer, planting the same fields he grew up on, growing crops such as potatoes, peas and corn. When he doesn’t have to work in his own fields, he works by taking his bulls to plow the fields of his neighbors and other family members. They pay him from 50 to 80 Soles for this work, depending on the size of the area plowed. Keeping his draft animals healthy and strong is a major preoccupation for Nilo, and he feeds them well every morning before taking them out to plow. He buys the corn stalks after each corn harvest as food for his animals. He inherited his skill and strength for plowing from his father, a fact of which he is very proud. He also mentioned that knowing how to control the animals is critical – without that you can’t plow. This is the eighth loan request for Nilo with MFP; the previous loans have been repaid on time and in full, and Nino has shown to be a very reliable borrower. He is thankful for the chance to obtain this new loan, to enable him to keep working. He will use the proceeds to buy more feed for his draft animals, and also to buy fertilizer to grow more peas.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for draft animals

loans.name: Librado

texts.es:
El señor Librado H. es padre D. familia y tiene dos hijos ya adolecientes que necesitan ya su propio espacio en L. casa. 
Portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para empezar L. construcción D. un cuarto en L. parte trasera D. L. casa y así sus hijos tengan su propia recamara y privacidad. Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos se su trabajo como custodio.
texts.en:
Mr. Librado H. has two children. They are now adolescents, and they need their own space in their home. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan to start construction on a room in the back of their house. This way his children will have their own bedroom and privacy. He plans to pay back the loan with his income from his work as a police officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back of the house

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou S.  est membre de banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de céréales. Elle veut acheter du mil, du niébé et des arachides pour renforcer son commerce et améliorer ses conditions de vie.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou S. has been a member of the Mbousnack village bank for seven years. Her business is the sale of grain. She wants to buy millet, black-eyed peas and peanuts to bolster her business and improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan, to be reimbursed after six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of millet, black-eyed peas and peanuts

loans.name: Maritza Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Maritza  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en Jr. Horacio zeballos con la Av. Circunvalación, ella posee estudios D. 5to grado D. primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará diferentes productos como son fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas,etc.  Desea que su negocio crezca mucho mas, y le gustaría mucho tener su propia distribuidora y un carro para distribuir sus productos.

Le gustaría  tener una tienda para venta al por mayor, pero necesitaría mas capita.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho la modalidad D. los pagos y los ahorros en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Punta Sahuacasi" Community Bank in the province of Azangaro, Puno, Peru. She is a 40-year-old married mother of three and has a fifth-graD. education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past five months. Maritza makes a living buying and selling groceries. Her first loan was for 500 soles, and she is currently requesting an additional loan of 600 soles, which she plans to use to buy different grocery products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft drinks, etc. She wishes for her business to really grow and would like it very much to have her own distribution company and a car to deliver her products. She would like to have a store that sells wholesale, but needs more capital. She also says that she really likes the system of payments and savings with her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different grocery products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 4` Group

texts.en: Paul is the head of his household and provides for his wife and three children. He owns a small clothing retail business called 'Ropas Paul', and his customers are primarily people from the local community. With his loan Paul will buy clothes in bulk. This will reduce his transport costs to the nearby city. In the future he hopes to expand his business and generate enough income to have his own house. Please help Paul and his group expand their businesses. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is 34 years old and married with a child. She sells phone accessories like phone batteries in her shop. She opens her shop from Mondays to Sundays from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Saidu is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. This, she says, will increase the living standard of her family and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is a resident of the Sapang island village in the town of Bianangonan in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to Bartolome, who is 49 years old and her partner in business. She is a mother to two boys, both of legal age.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008 with a hope to free herself from poverty. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store and she spent her previous loan wisely and orderly. Now, she proposes to borrow a second loan of 10,000 pesos to serve as additional capital for her sari-sari store. The funds will be used to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for the store.

She is sure that people in the village will visit her store regularly because she sells the food that meets their daily needs. She dreams of expanding the business, turning it to a grocery store, and repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice and groceries for her general store

loans.name: Chanta Arame

texts.fr: Chantal, 50 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Son activité est la vente de boisson et la restauration. Elle veut un prêt pour réparer son congélateur, acheter des stocks pour vendre de la boisson et le petit déjeuner. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Chantal, age 50, is married and has 7 children to support. Her business consists in selling drinks and foods. She wants a loan to repair her freezer, replenish her stock to sell drinks and breakfasts. Her income enables her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her freezer and replenish her stock of food and drinks

loans.name: Tappe

texts.fr: Cette dame vend dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé des beignets d’arachide communément appelés « Gonazo » ; ce sont des beignets qui sont très appréciés de la population et surtout des enfants. Elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 07 sacs d’arachide pour pouvoir fabriquer ses beignets. Elle est mariée et sans enfants.
texts.en:
At the marketplace of Agoè Assiyéyé, this woman sells peanut fritters commonly called gonazo;  these are fritters that people really appreciate, especially children.  She would like to obtain a loan from WAGES to buy 7 sacks of peanuts for making her fritters.  She is married and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Vitalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Vitalia F. H. tiene 51 años, esta casada con el Sr. Raul Rocha durante 30 años, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es profesional e independiente, el segundo siogue estudiando en la universidad. Viven a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Cochabamba en una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, ganaderia y lecheria.

La Sra. vitalia y el Sr. Raul se dedican a la lecheria desde que se casaron, empezaron con 2 cabezas de ganado y poco a poco fueron creciendo. 

Requieren del dinero para poder terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que se paralizo la obra por falta de dinero, lo que les ayudaria de mkucho el prestamo para mejorar la vivienda y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Vitalia is 51 years old and has been married to Raul Rocha for 30 years. She has two children, one of whom is already grown up and a professional, and the other who is studying at the university. She lives 25 minutes from the city of Cochabamba in a rural zone dedicated to agriculture, livestock and dairy products. Vitalia and her husband have been making a living in dairy products since they were married. They started with two heads of cattle and little by little grew their business. They are requesting the loan in order to finish construction on their home because the work had stopped due to a lack of funds. The loan would help them a great deal in improving their home and in turn also improving the quality of life for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on her home

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
A. Tursunoy is 46 years old. She is married with two children. Since 1999, Tursunoy has been engaged in bicycle spare parts sales. She has a shop in the local market. She sells spare parts of different types and for different bicycles.

As a result of the success of her business, Tursunoy has improved the living conditions of her family and is doing her best to meet all the needs of her dearest children. But she is not satisfied with the volume of sales and wants to increase her inventory, thus increasing the volume of sales. With this purpose in mind, today Tursunoy requests 4500 Somoni that will be spent for purchasing spare parts for bicycles to increase her range of goods. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Tursunoy’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción M. D. A. resiD. en San Salvador  la capital del popularmente llamado Pulgarcito D. América. María tiene 55 años D. edad, vive con esposo don José y sus dos hijos D. 20 y 21 años D. edad estudiantes universitarios. Hace diez años María aprendió confección y costura, conocimientos con los cuales ahora María maneja su propio negocio desD. su casa elaborando variedad D. estilos en ropa a la medida, pero ahora María urge D. un crédito, ya que desea comprar tela para elaborar prendas, para ser comercializadas con clientes y vecinos D. su colonia.
texts.en:
María Concepción M. D. A. lives in the capital of San Salvador, which is popularly called “The Thumb of the Americas”. She is 55 years old and lives her husband Don José and her two children (ages 21 and 20) who are university students. Ten years ago, María learned how to sew and make dresses. Today she utilizes these skills and manages her own home business where she makes different styles of clothing.

Maria is in urgent need of a loan so that she can buy fabric to make garments that she can sell to customers and neighbors in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: 41-year-old Juanito D. is a farmer. He has been married to Rosalyn D. for 3 years now. He owns 2 hectares of rice field in his hometown in Agusan Del Sur. His farm is where he generates his income. He recently joined CEV to take advantage of its financial services because he admits he lacks capital for his farm. He requested to borrow Php 7,000. He will use this loan to purchase the farm inputs he needs for his farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia’s business is selling drinks, candies, and clothing in the city of Leon. She will use the loan to buy sodas, water, juices, caramels, clothing, and used toys. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4 years. With loans her business has grown in little increments she said. For instance, clothing and used toys are fairly new items for her store. They are more expensive to buy than the other items she sells.

 About 10 years ago she received permission from the Mayor’s office to set up her goods on the northwest corner of the Park of San Juan. Her store is open-air, underneath a tree that provides shade. This is a good location because many of the people who visit Leon or who are passing through go by this street corner. Apolonia is married with five children. Four of her children are school aged.
texts.en:
Apolonia’s business is selling drinks, candies, and clothing in the city of Leon. She will use the loan to buy sodas, water, juices, caramels, clothing, and used toys. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4 years. With loans her business has grown in little increments she said. For instance, clothing and used toys are fairly new items for her store. They are more expensive to buy than the other items she sells. About 10 years ago she received permission from the Mayor’s office to set up her goods on the northwest corner of the Park of San Juan. Her store is open-air, underneath a tree that provides shade. This is a good location because many of the people who visit Leon or who are passing through go by this street corner. Apolonia is married with five children. Four of her children are school aged.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, candies, clothing, and used toys

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Mrs. Pilar S. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Pilar owns and operates a business selling dried fish in the local community and earns 10,000 PHP monthly. Currently, Pilar is obtaining her 9th loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her existing business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Diana Lizbeth

texts.es:
La Sra.Diana C. R. de 21 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija Danitza Ramos C. de 3 años. Viven en el asentamiento Humano Virgen de Chapi-Subtanjalla-Ica.
Trabaja como Ayudante de Venta de Comida en el CC Polvos Rosados y como trabajadora del Hogar dejando a su niña a cargo de su mamà.
La vivienda que habita actualmente es de esteras y palo no cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua ni desague. Fue afectada por el terremoto y obtuvo un modulo de madera donado por una ONG y solicita el crédito para poder hacer un falso piso y poder armar el módulo.
Cuenta con buenas referencias de los vecinos; ya que es una mujer Jóven con muchas ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
Diana C. R., 21, is a single mother who lives with her 3-year-old daughter, Danitza Ramos C.. They live in the Humano Virgen settlement in Chapi-Subtanjalla-Ica. She works as a food sales assistant at Polvos Rosados Shopping Center and as a domestic; her mother cares for her daughter. The dwelling they inhabit is made of sticks and matting; it lacks electricity, running water and sewerage. It was damaged by the earthquake and she received a wood modular unit from an NGO and she is requesting funding to build a false floor and assemble the modular unit. She has good references from her neighbors in that she is a young woman with a strong desire to work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely S. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Fely is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fely operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Fely has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Fely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Fely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Selling diesel has been very profitable for Ese. This is a business she has been conducting for the past three years. She buys her diesel in bulk and sells in retail. With the business she is able to assist her husband with household expenses. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. Ese is 37years old and married with a child who is just 6 years old. The child is still in primary school. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more diesel to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 2 años viene desempeñándose efectivamente en su propia fábrica D. maní y habas confitadas. Para este negocio cuenta con la participación D. toda su familia, y lo hace en la comodidad D. su casa, allí tiene los equipos y herramientas necesarias para la elaboración D. estos confites. Magda trabaja durante toda la mañana y por las tardes reparte su producción a las diferentes tiendas y bodegas D. su barrio. Debido a la calidad D. sus productos han aumentado sus pedidos y clientela, por lo que espera que en los próximos años su negocio será más próspero, para ello se está implementando con maquinaria más sofisticada que le ayuden a  tener mayor producción. 

Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socias con larga trayectoria en un banco comunal, y está muy deseosa D. seguir trabajando en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. una cocina industrial y utensilios D. acero para el preparado.
texts.en:
Magda is 58 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in her own house. For the past 2 years, she has been effectively working in her own factory making candied peanuts and broad beans. With this business she relies on the participation of the whole family. She works from the comfort of her own home, where she has all of the equipment and tools necessary to make this candy. Magda works the whole morning and in the afternoon she distributes her products in the various stores in her neighborhood. Because of the quality of her product, her orders have increased and so have her customers. Because of this, she hopes that in the coming years her business will be more prosperous. In order to make this happen, she is working with more sophisticated machinery that helps her to have greater production. This is the sixth time she has had a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva Field Partner]. She is one of the members with a history with a communal bank, and she wants to continue working in a group. The money she is now requesting will be used to purchase industrial kitchen equipment and steel utensils for preparing her candy.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase industrial kitchen equipment

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with four children. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like beans sauce and fried plantain popularly as “red red” etc. She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. This adversely affects her business progress. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meals quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like beans, palm oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna G. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Rosanna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosanna owns & operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice and ice water in the local community. Rosanna has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosanna is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosanna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Silvana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora  Silvana S. es otra de las socias del banco comunal Maluay, vive a  las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca a unos 30 minutos en la comunidad Maulay en la parroquia el Valle, caracterizándose  por ser la mayor productora de papas y maíz, además de ofrecer  hermosos paisajes  de la serranía ecuatoriana. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos AVON lleva 3 años trabajando en esta actividad y ya cuenta con su clientela fija que las visita de casa en casa,  también tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa donde ofrece productos para el hogar y adornos.

Este  es su tercer ciclo en el bankito  y fue su tía y una prima de su esposo  quienes la incentivaron a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras, nos comenta que los créditos le ayudan a cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar e ir incrementando poco a poco su negocio.

Silvana tiene 21 años de edad, siendo su estado civil casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad y actualmente se entero que se encuentra embarazada de 2 meses, su esposo trabaja en una ferretería, la casa en la que habitan es prestada por sus familiares quines no le cobran el arriendo.

Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra de vitrinas para su bazar, teniendo como meta algún día poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvana S. is a member of the communal bank Maluay. She lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca, around 30 minutes from the Maulay community in the Valle province, which is known for being the greatest producer of corn and potatoes as well as having beautiful mountainous Ecuadorian landscapes. Her business is the sale of AVON products (cosmetics), which she has been running for 3 years and now has a loyal and constant clientèle who she visits in their homes. She also has a small stand in her house where she offers home goods and decorations. This will be her third loan cycle from this great group of strong women who make up her communal bank, which she joined thanks to encouragement from her aunt and her husband's cousin. She tells us that her loans have helped her to cover her household expenses and to slowly but surely grow her business. Silvana is 21 years old, married with one child, and two months pregnant. Her husband works in a hardware store. The house they live in is owned by some family members who do not charge them rent. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, Silvana is going to buy class cases for the cosmetics stand in her house, with the goal of one day being able to afford to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of glass cases to display cosmetics in a store within her house

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando, tiene 34 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él socio estudió en la escuela de bellas artes del cusco “Diego Q. Ttito” y se especializó en pintura al óleo, el socio es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que las ingenió para tener ingresos económicos propios por lo cual decidió abrir un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde confecciona su arte, el también vende sus pinturas en un pequeño espacio del las galerías “Intipakari”. Ya son 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales pre determinados, acuarelas y pintura contemporánea. El anhelo del socio es tener tres galerías donde pueda vender sus pinturas, comprarse un carro y estudiar ciencias políticas.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rolando is 34 years old and belongs to the "Sacsayhuaman" communal bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association. He studied at the Cusco School of Fine Arts “Diego Q. Ttito” and majored in oil painting. He is an enterprising and hardworking young man who has harnessed his skills to earn his own income. Thus, he decided to open a small shop in his home where he does his art. He also sells his paintings in a small space at the "Intipakari" galleries. He has spent 14 years working at his craft and things have gone well for him. He requests this loan to buy predetermined materials, watercolors and contemporary paint. His aspiration is to have three galleries where he can sell his paintings, to buy a car and to study political science. He is thankful for the opportunity granted through this organization and promises to adhere to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy predetermined materials, watercolors and contemporary paint.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Mrs. Lolita T. owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in her community. She is also a BHW (Barangay Health Worker) in her village, paid an honorarium of 1,000 monthly. She is 57 years old, married and blessed with six grown-up children. She is from the village of Ospital, Aloran. Lolita earns a monthly net income of 5,000 from her business and extra income. In 2000, Lolita joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the coop. She's availing a new loan of 50,000 which will be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store and for housing renovation. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
