Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For housing renovation

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se Denomina Nueva Esperanza están en el Sexto Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable entre ellas, las mismas poseen un ahorro para cualquier caso de emergencia, cabe destacar que  las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, realizan actividades para recaudar fondos y otras  que realizan  labores domésticas para incrementar sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Antonia se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ella alquila un salón en el mercado y expone todos sus productos naturales, ella comenta que tiene muchos clientes ya los remedios son muy efectivos y mas baratos que los químicos.
Además de los remedios naturales ella vende cremas para  la piel todos elaborados de forma artesanal.
Ella compra los remedios naturales en gran cantidad y a granel y luego los envasa en bolsas mas pequeñas y de esa manera ofrece con mas facilidad y con precios mas sin dejar de tener ganancia.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo y desea adquirir mas mercaderías(remedios naturales y cremas artesanales para la piel) para  este fin solicita el préstamos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Neuva Esperanza" and is in its sixth loan cycle. There are 17 members of the group, and they stand out in the neighborhood for being very close-knit, supportive, and responsible. They have set-aside savings for whatever emergencies they have. It is worth noting that the members have a great entrepreneurial spirt and undertake fundraising activities and domestic work in order to increase their incomes. One of the members, Antonia, sells natural remedies. She rents a salon in the market place and displays all her natural products. She comments that she has many clients and that her remedies are very effective and cheaper than chemical products. In addition to the natural remedies, she sells artesanal skin creams. She buys the natural remedies in bulk and packages them in smaller bags, and in this way offers a convenient product at a good price, while making a profit for herself. She finds her work very satisfying and wants to add more products (natural remedies and artesanal skin creams) and that is why she has requested this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies and artesanal skin creams in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y jovial, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, por lo que su trabajo lo realiza visitando de casa en casa de sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos, adicionalmente el buen trato que tiene ha hecho que capte mucho compradores.  La gran ventaja que tiene es cuando lo productos están de oferta, logrando así comprar la por mayor, por lo que logra obtener un stock de estos cosméticos, vendiéndolos luego a un buen precio. Gloria esta muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, ahora su mayor anhelo es incrementar la cantidad de estos productos, además desea incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir, para que así pueda independizarse de sus suegros y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, para aumentar sus ganancias y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria, 34, is a dynamic and jovial woman; she lives with her husband and three children in her in-laws’ house. She sells beauty products door-to-door. Thanks to the positive way she treats her customers she has captured many regular customers. She takes advantage of being able to buy stock items at wholesale when they are on special and then reselling them for a better price. Gloria is very happy with the work she does and her greatest wish right now is to increase her stock; she also wants to start to sell clothing so that she can become independent of her in-laws and be able to offer her children a better quality of life. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy beauty products and items of clothing to increase her profits and meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and items of clothing.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak T. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two married children in Takeo province. So far, she stays at home looking after her grandson and granddaughter. Her husband is a priest. On average, he typically makes US$ 2 per day. This family is also supported by two children who are construction workers. 

Hak T. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. (Hak T. is pictured with her husband and her grandson and granddaughter.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yairo Francisco

texts.es: Yairo tiene 27 años el se dedica a la venta de ornados y repostería. Hace as de 5 años que tiene este negocio, el vive con su familia en una comarca de achuapa a pesar de que no tienen todas las comodidades el cada día se supera para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Además que sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos que el mismo elabora el es joven muy ejemplar pues además es un buen hijo y padre al mismo tiempo a pesar de que recorre muchos lugares siempre está contento de ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor en calidad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Yairo is 27 years old and sells baked goods and desserts. He has had this business for five years and lives with his family an area of Achuapa. Even though they do not have all of the comforts, he works hard each day in order to provide his family with their daily needs. He sells the products that he makes daily and is a very exemplary young man, a good son, and a good father. He is always happy to offer his best quality products to his customers. He will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients, including butter, cheese, and flour, among other things. He hopes to someday offer his family a better home and obtain an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita A. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She makes her living from her general store.

Merlita lives with her husband Armando and their two children who are 10 and 21 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Merlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Merlita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th cycle loan, in the amount of 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store. Merlita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 35 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, biscuits, soap powder, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. María Piedad L. es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la mismas que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

Nuestra socia se dedica hace 10 años al bordado de polleras y blusas que son la vestimenta típica de la región, aprendió este bonito arte gracias a que su mamá y también ha seguido cursos de costura, trabaja sin horario gracias a que cuenta con su propio taller.
 
La Señora María Piedad tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos están en la escuela, su esposo es albañil; no tienen  casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su taller, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una máquina de coser, en hilo y varios materiales más que necesita. Su sueño es llegar a tener un almacén para vender todo el producto que elabora.
texts.en:
María Piedad L. is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength”) communal bank. She lives in the Punta Corral area of Turi, known as a viewpoint over the city of Cuenca. The people in her community are farmers and raise livestock, though many have left the area in search of opportunities to better provide for their families. For over 10 years María Piedad has embroidered skirts and blouses that are the traditional dress of the region. She learned this beautiful skill from her mother and by taking sewing courses. Since she has her own sewing studio she makes her own hours. María Piedad is 28 years old, married, and has three children, ages, 9, 7, and 5. All of her children are in school and her husband works in construction. They live in her parents’ house as they do not have their own home. She has been a member of the communal bank for five years and the loans she has received have greatly assisted the development of her sewing studio. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a sewing machine, thread, and other necessary materials. Her dream is to one day have a store where she can sell all the items that she creates.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, thread, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Elizaya

texts.en: Elizaya S. is currently in the business of selling various raw foods such as cassava, yams, Irish potatoes, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and rice to sell.  Elizaya is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Leonor Mercedes

texts.es:
Leonor de 62 años, es viuda y vive en una zona suburbana del Suburbio, tiene un centro de llamadas. 

Cuando murió su esposo ella inicio el negocio para poder estar económicamente estable. Con la ayuda de su hijo pudo comprar algunas cabinas telefónicas y tener su centro de llamadas. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h30pm.Una de las dificultades que tiene para su negocio es que no tiene mucha seguridad ya en algunas ocasiones los ladrones le han robado. 

Para que su negocio siga con mas éxito ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina de recargas celulares.  En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio y seguir unida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 62 year old widow. She lives in the rural area of Suburbio. She has a call center. She started this business in order to have financial stability when her husband died. With her son’s help she was able to buy some telephone booths and have a call center. She now works from 7:30 a.m. until 10:30 p.m. One of the difficulties that she has with her business is that it is not very safe. She has been robbed on a few occasions. In order for her business to continue with more success, she wants to use the loan to buy a machine that recharges cell phones. In the future she wants to improve her business and to continue being a close-knit family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Machine to recharge cell phones

loans.name: God's Grace Kikaaya "a"-Kampala Group

texts.en: With the help of affirmative action, many Ugandan women have disproved the old rule that business is an activity only for men. N. Teopista, 38, who belongs to God’s grace Kikaaya "A"-Kampala, exemplifies these new women in today's Uganda. This happily married mother of five, who describes herself as honest, hard-working and pro-people, has been banking on her will power as a cardinal stock in trade in her second-hand clothes sales and brick-laying businesses in Kikaaya market-Kampala. She started this business with savings from her pig sales business, though she also dealt in poultry. In a week, her business generates 70,000 shillings. With this loan she wants to buy more bales of second-hand clothing for resale and also improve her brick-laying business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale and to also improve her brick-laying business

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes se dedica a  la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha salido adelante.  Sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de suplir la demanda con sus clientes como pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella desea obtener buenas ganancias de este crédito y al mismo tiempo mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes has sold used clothes for over five years.  She has always been a very tenacious, enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead with help from the loans.

Her customers are always asking for different items so she is asking for funds to meet customer demand for pants, shirts, skirts and suits.

She hopes to earn good profits from the loan and at the same time improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jacquelin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jaquelin de 38 años, tiene un puesto de desayunos, es madre soltera con dos niños de 10 y 8 años. Vive en las Orquídeas “Pascuales” de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Inicio su negocio vendiendo empanadas y muchines (son piqueos tradicionales) en las calles de Orquídeas, poco a poco y después de tener dinero tubo la idea de sacar provecho a que viviera por un sector comercial ya que por su casa queda el mercado de “pascuales”. Ubico unas mesas y unas sillas afuera de su casa y comenzo con las ventas de desayunos y piqueos. Poco a poco se le ha incrementado su clientela debido a que la gente del mercado llega muy temprano y sin desayunar. Trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 11h00am todos los dias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, mesas y una cocina industrial para que la elaboración de los desayunos sea mas rápida. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien adecuado en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is 38 years old and has a breakfast stall.  She is a single mother with two children, ages 10 and 8, and lives in Orquídeas “Pascuales” de Guayaquil (an urban zone called Orquídeas, which means orchids, because there were many orchid flowers growing there when the area was discovered).

She started her business by selling empanadas and “muchines” (a traditional bite-sized food) on the streets of Orquídeas.  Little by little, after saving some money, she came up with the idea of opening a stall, since her house was located near the Pascuales marketplace.  She set up some tables and chairs outside her home and began selling breakfast and bite sized food.

Her customer base has increased little by little, because the people in the marketplace arrive very early without having had breakfast.  She works daily from 5:00 AM to 11:00 AM.

She will use the money from this loan to buy tables and chairs and a commercial grade cooker so that she can prepare breakfast faster.  In the future she would like to open a well-stocked eatery in the city center.

loans.use: Tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and under clothes

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter is a regular loan user of Asasah. This time she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s grocery store. He is operating his grocery shop in the market where he sells daily use items like cooking oil, salt, rice, spices, etc. He has a good number of customers who prefer to purchase groceries from his shop due to his reasonable prices. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity for his grocery store and that will help him make more sales. 

Shamim is hopeful that with the help of an investment, her son’s business will grow and she will be able to help him get married soon. She lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishan. Her home is in the area named Kot Mianiaan which is a small housing colony in the city. She has been living here since her marriage to S. A., 24 years ago. Her husband sells clothes while her younger son works in a factory for a low wage.  
She also has a daughter who is fifteen years old, who stays at home and manages the household chores. Shamim couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints. 

In her previous five years' loan record, she has been found to be a very responsible person who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Harriet has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and paraffin. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and taking care of herself.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own cows. Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by knowing how to play netball.

loans.use: sugar and paraffin

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma C. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Alma is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal(tax) services as her husband is the driver for local community members. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Malis, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store, a livestock business and a fishing business .Her husband Reynaldo, who is 40 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have four children who are 6 to 20 years old. Shirley joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Shirley has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store so she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Shirley B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside con su familia en uno de los caseríos agrícolas de Tambogrande, que pertenece a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. El cría ganado ovino y aves de corral en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda alimentándoles de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permite ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Miguel desea comprar alimento balanceado para engordar a sus animales, y una vez que estén desarrollados venderlos y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old.  He is married and lives with his family in one of the agricultural villages of Tambogrande, in Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department.

Manuel raises and sells animals.  He raises sheep and poultry in some pens located near his home.  He fattens them, feeding them natural fodder and, when they have raised a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who normally visit his area.  This business allows him to help support his family financially.

Miguel would like to buy balanced animal feed to fatten his animals and, once they have reached an appropriate level of development, he will sell them, thereby making bigger profits which will allow him to continue making progress and helping his family to get ahead in life.  In order to achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi M. is single and has three children, two of whom attend school, while one graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past nine years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.  With the  20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 20 kilograms of rice and 20 litres of cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase 20 kilograms of rice and 20 litres of cooking oil

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling firewood.  She lives in Compostela, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Welma is borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she can purchase a new tool for her business.   This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Welma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference  in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase a new tool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cart to sell food.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé depuis le début des activités du Banc Villageois en 2000. Il est composé de 12 femme qui sont toutes du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. GUEYE

Madame BIGUE D. (debout à droite de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du groupe de solidarité depuis sa formation au jour d'inauguration du Banc Villageois

Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers, tels du mil, du riz, de l'arachide et des noix d'acajou. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans.

Son crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises citée ci-dessus

Son objectif est de soutenir son marie dans la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom solidarity group  as created after the launching of Banc Villageois in 2000. The group is composed of 12 women from the same village. They are neighbors and fiends who organized a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of TouB. Gueye.

Mrs. Bigue D. (standing to the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group’s leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She has been a member of the solidarity group since the group’s creation on the day when Banc Villageois was inaugurated. She retails various products, such as millet, rice, peanuts and cashew nuts. She has been in this line of business for over ten years.

Her loan will allow her to increase her level of stock in buying more of the merchandises mentioned above. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family needs, for example, the cost of food, education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase millet, peantus, rice and cashew nuts

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a young man from Jabalia Refugee camp. Ibrahim lives with his parents and helps his father take care of the household.

Ibrahim has a small barber shop where he works with his brother. Ibrahim uses only half the space in the shop and he took out a loan from FATEN to prepare the rest of it as a waiting area for customers.

Ibrahim appears in the picture here in his shop.

loans.use: to prepare a waiting area for the barber shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy está casada con el Sr. Agustín y tienen 1 hija que está cursando la escuela primaria.
Nancy tiene una farmacia en su casa desde hace varios años. Ella es muy conocida en su barrio por sus conocimientos hacia los medicamentos, ya que también realiza primeros auxilios.
Ella se inició en otro trabajo donde trabajó como farmacéutica y con el correr de los años decidió abrir su propio negocio.
Su marido es camionero y con los ingresos de su profesión le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Hemos confiado en Nancy en otros créditos anteriores y ha cumplido con total cabalidad con sus compromisos.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor, por eso solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de medicamentos que puedan abastecer la demanda.
texts.en:
Nancy is married to Agustín and they have 1 daughter who is in primary school. Nancy has had a pharmacy in her house for several years. She is very well known in her neighborhood for her knowledge about medications, since she also does first aid. She started at another job where she worked as a pharmacist and after a few years decided to open her own business. Her husband is a truck driver and the income from his profession help with the household expenses.  

We have trusted Nancy with other previous loans and she has totally met her committments. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and enterprising spirit and that is why she is asking for a new loan to buy medications to meet demands.

loans.use: to buy various medications.

loans.name: Aniss

texts.ar: انيس اعزب عمره 29 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع الحلويات له في عمله 6 سنوات يمتلك خبرة كبيرة في هذا العمل حيث انه ورثه من ولاده يتميز بحبه للعمل وابتكاره فيه اصناف جديدة لكن ما يعيق تطوره هي المادة حيث انه يريد ان يطور العمل وان يدخل ماكنات ومواد اولية جديدة ليزيد من مدخول العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية وتسجيل سيارته التي سيتخدمها في العمل فهو طموح ولكن له السمعة الجيدة من القرض السابق من المجموعة حيث ساهم في دعم عمله له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Aniss is 29 years old and unmarried. He works in a pastry shop, and he has six years of experience in this line of work. He is very knowledgeable of this business because inherited it from his father. He stands out in his work due to his love for his work, and due to his innovation. He has created several new types of sweets. However, material concerns are preventing his continued progress. He would like to improve his business and increase his income by bringing in new equipment into his shop, as well as by obtaining more supplies. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy these supplies, and in addition, he would like to register his car, which he plans to start using in his work. He is ambitious, and he has a good reputation with al-Majmoua, as his previous experience taking out a loan was good. He used his previous loan to support his business. He has customers from his community, and from among his neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar and honey for his pastry/sweet shop, and to register his car so that he can use it in his business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco se dedica a la elaboración de calzados y su esposa es comerciante y realiza viajes al oriente del país. El crédito lo requiere para comprar: cuerinas, pegamentos, plantillas. Vive en casa propia la misma esta ubicada en la zona 16 De Julio en la ciudad de El Alto,  es casado y tiene un hijo. El cliente esta satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo y ampliar su negocio. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Francisco works making shoes and his wife is a merchant and takes trips to the west of the country. He needs the loan to buy: color samples, glues, and insoles. He lives in his own house, which is in the area called 16 De Julio in the city of El Alto. He is married and has one son. This client is satisfied with the loans that have been awarded to him as he was able to increase his business capital and grow his business. He has been a client of ours since 2005.

loans.use: To buy materials like color samples, glue, insoles, for his shoe making business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a sari-sari (variety) retail store in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her store.

Ana has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 3 est constitué de 9 femmes mariées du village de MORIBILA KAFONO de la sous préfecture de KIMPARANA  région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 36 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les 3 prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne
DJELIKA, la première assise, enfant les pieds,I compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 50 000 à 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: The group Benkadi 3 is made up of 9 married women from Moribila Kafono of the Kimparana sub-prefecture in the Segou region, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They live in large traditional families and are 36 years old on average and have at least 7 children.  For the most part, they raise peanuts.  With the intention of making their agricultural concerns profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program four years ago.  After having fully repaid their 3 previous loans, they are on their fourth country loan.  Djelika, the first seated with a child in her lap, she expects to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, some light equipment, and agricultural fertilizers at the big market in Kimparana.  After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they gain value before being sold at the big market in Kimparana and at surrounding markets at retail (or often wholesale) for cash to a customer base generally coming from the big cities.  The members of the group expect to each make a profit of 50,000 to 60,000 FCFA after the harvest of their agricultural products, which will be used to pay the interest on their loans and their families' current expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and light equipment.

loans.name: Fresas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Fresas"  que se integra de tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad y está ubicado en la lo calidad de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas.
     Las señora quien se le tomo la  entrevista es la señora Candelaria, ella es casada con el señor  Alfonzo y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: María Adriana  de ocho años de edad, Sandra Guadalupe de cinco años de edad y el  más pequeño es  Luis Alfonso de un año de edad.
     Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tamales y solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: carne, masa, pasas, hoja de guineo,  entre otros,  y así poder elaborar su actividad en donde lleva un año y dos  meses en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado de ingreso en su hogar.
    Comenzó con esta actividad por su propia creatividad ya que  por un tiempo estuvo apoyando a una compañera hacer tamales y vio que le dejaba ingresos, por eso ella decidió trabajar la misma actividad y nos platica que le va bien.
     Su más grande deseo  es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda  tener sus propios ahorros y  con el préstamo lograr trabajar para salir adelante con su familia.
     Las señoras que integran en el grupo son: Consuelo, quien se dedica a la  compra i venta de marranos y la señora Isabel se dedica a la compra y venta de sandalias.
texts.en:
The group is called “Fresas” (Strawberries) and is composed of three women.  Each of them has a different activity and it’s located in the town of Coapilla, State of Chiapas.

The woman who was interviewed is Candelaria.  She is married to Alfonzo and they have three children still in their care:  María Adriana, 8, Sandra Guadalupe, 5 and the youngest, Luis Alfonso, 1.

She works making tamales and asked for the loan to buy ingredients like: meat, dough, raisins and banana leaves, among others to continue with her activity that she’s been doing for a year and two months.  She comments that she does well since she’s had good results with respect to household income.

She started this activity due to her own creativity because for a time she had been helping a friend make tamales and she noticed that it was profitable.  She, therefore, decided to go into the same occupation and she tells us that she does well.

Her greatest wish is that this small activity will allow her to have her own savings and that the loan will allow her to work to get ahead with her family.

The other women who are members of the group are: Consuelo, who is a pig merchant and Isabel who is a sandals merchant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Cristelene

texts.en:
Cristelene is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Cristelene is in the business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed one loan in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Cristelene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

In the future, Cristelene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, todos mayores, quienes ayudan a trabajar, Gilberto es agricultor en pequeño, sembrando maíz para el sostenimiento del hogar, trabaja todos los días en compañía de sus hijos, él inicio desde joven a realizar la siembra.
Actualmente se encuentra con sus hijos trabajando en el nuevo cultivo, por lo tanto necesita un financiamiento para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, estos insumos por lo general se utilizan para ayudar a la milpa a crecer y fortalecerla para la producción, por lo que representa para él una gran ayuda que le permite dar los cuidos necesarios a su trabajo.
Su aspiración es trabajar al lado de sus hijos para enseñarles como defenderse, también con el actual cultivo desea obtener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives with his wife and their four children. They are all grown and they help with the work. Gilberto is a small-scale agriculturist who plants corn to support the household. He works every day with the company of his children. He started out in agriculture when he was young.

Today he works together with his children in the new cultivation. He needs a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers. These products are generally used to help the plantation grow and strengthen production. This represents a great source of help for him, permitting him provide the necessary care on his work. His aspiration is to work alongside his children to show them how to defend themselves. He also wants to obtain good results from their current cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers for his corn plantation.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a "chop bar" (a place for eating different types of food) at Elmina. Efua has five children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy cassava, plantains, palm fruits and other food items to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, palm fruits and other food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 53-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked in selling home products since 14 years ago. He is a hardworking man with a good reputation. He has improved his business in a very professional way, depending on his customers' needs and requests.

This is Hassan's second loan cycle with Al Majmoua. Just like with his previous loan, Hassan will invest this requested loan in increasing his capital through buying new merchandise requested by his customers. This will have a good benefit for him.

Hassan had cash flow  problems at the beginning, but now he's more organized and aware of every step he makes, and that's all because he has a loving family he has to take care of.

Hassan hopes to improve his business through expanding his shop and adding new products.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and household products.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Donna has been farming vegetables for 15 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Veronica Vanessa

texts.es: Verónica Vanessa tiene 35 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este medio de vida, ella ha logrado obtener con mucho sacrificio este negocio, pues no ha sido fácil sobrellevar todos los problemas que a diario se le presentan, a pesar de estos obstáculos Verónica ha sabido salir adelante. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, cremas, ropa en general, ropa interior, electrodomésticos, entre otros.
texts.en: Verónica Vanessa is 35. She has sold general merchandise for two years. With a great deal of sacrifice, she was able to obtain her business; it hasn't been easy to deal with all of the problems that present themselves daily. However, in spite of these difficulties, Veronica has been able to get ahead. This loan is for the purchase of sheets, creams, general clothing, underwear, home electronics, and other items.

loans.use: to buy sheets, creams, general clothing, underwear, home electronics, and other items.

loans.name: Nalukesi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nalukesi Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Dickson is the facilitator of the Nalukesi SHG group. He takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access farm inputs on credit, and receive agricultural education relevant to maize farming. In the recent 2011 season, Dickson had an excellent maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dickson was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dickson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Dickson will buy food for his family, and invest in assets such as livestock.
In 2012, the members of Nalukesi SHG group will each plant  between half and three-quarters of an acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis used his previous loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients for preparing food in his cafeteria. His business has grown since he received the loan, and he has six employees. His desire is to expand his business and get enough capital to open other outlets of his business.

He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en: Hagie is 32 years old and married with three kids living in Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She sells corn to earn a living and she earns PHP 15,000 each month. Hagie requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. She's been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for five years. In the future, she plans to improve their house and to live in convenience.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: William Heriberto

texts.es:
William, necesita otro crédito nuevamente, porque lo invertirá en gastos de educación de una sobrina, el objetivo de él es que su sobrina salga a delante con sus estudios y que en el futuro sea profesional. El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho solventar los gastos de estudio y de esa forma tiene los recursos para ayudarles a su familia en lo que necesitan.
Este nuevo prestamo es para pagar las ultimas colegiaturas de la secundaria, de su sobrina.
texts.en: William needs another loan again because he’ll use it to pay educational costs for a niece.  His goal is that she gets ahead with her studies and becomes a professional in the future.  The previous loan helped him a lot to cover schooling costs and to have resources available to help his family with what they need.  This new loan is to pay the final secondary school tuition fees for his niece.

loans.use: to pay her niece's tuition fees.

loans.name: Faith Wanjira

texts.en:
Faith is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children aged between 14 and 26. She describes herself as an ambitious and aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clutches, coil springs, shafts, etc. She has been involved in this business for nine years. 
Faith describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy more spare parts. She will use her loan of 50,000 KES to buy coil springs, shafts, and clutches. Her business goal is to run the same kind of business in major towns, like Nairobi, within five years.

loans.use: to buy clutches, coil springs, and shafts.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en: Dorothea is 47 years old and has two children who are 21 and 23 years old. She earns a living by running a store where she sells items such as rice, sugar and salt. She has been in this business for the last five years, and is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to begin building a house and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La señora Zenobia solicita un préstamo para los acabados del exterior de su casa que son los enjarres (cemento y pintura especial). Ya que le preocupa la salud de su familia, con la época de invierno que se acerca estaban propensos a los cambios bruscos de temperatura tanto a las lluvias como al fríos y en la comunidad que ellos viven hay pocas habitantes por tal motivos se encuentran mas propensos pero con el enjarre de sus paredes tendrán mayor protección para estos cambios. 
Doña Zenobia es empleada de una maquiladora desde hace seis años, como operaria en producción y cuenta con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañil. Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus tres hijo y que su patrimonio este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Señora Zenobia is requesting a loan for the external finishes of her home, which are in bad shape (the cement and paint especially).  She is concerned for the health of her family, as with the coming winter season they tend to have severe changes in temperature with both rain and cold, and as the community where they live has few people, these effects are even more likely.  However, fixing up her walls will give them better protection against these changes.

Doña Zenobia has been working in a factory for the last six years as a production operator.  She also has a small grocery business.  Her husband works in construction.  They want to improve the quality of life for their three children, and make sure that the property they will inherit is in good condition.

loans.use: improve the exterior finish of her walls which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is a 41-year-old divorced woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan. Nidaa started her business by packaging Dead Sea clay and minerals in amazing packages made by her. Dead Sea is the lowest area in the world and the sea is full of minerals and clay which help in healing many skin and bone issues. Then Nidaa expanded her business to include making mosaics to meet the demand of the market.

Nidaa is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase materials needed for her packaging and mosaics business, such as 
clay, fabrics, etc. Nidaa is looking to customize a room in her home so that she can display all her products together. She hopes to then open a shop as a second step.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 31 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and feeds.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to support her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feeds

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Karina tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Karina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora  que trabaja en una casa haciendo limpieza. En esta oportunidad Karina requiere el préstamo para uso personal para compra comestibles para la casa.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) community bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and this is where they carry out their business activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world - Machu Picchu.

Karina is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She was born in Cusco province, in Cusco department, and lives in the beautiful city in which she was born.  Karina is an enterprising and hard-working woman who works in a house, providing cleaning services.  On this occasion, Karina needs a loan for personal use (to buy food for her household).

loans.use: to buy food for her household

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel de sesenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercana a su residencia; comercia en todos los alrededores y ya tiene mucha clientela, las personas lo prefieren por la calidad de sus producto, los buenos precios y sobre todo el excelente servicio; Juan es un hombre entregado a su trabajo siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y alcanzar el éxito, en la última cosecha tuvo pequeñas perdidas que provocaron que sus ganancias bajaran por eso en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Juan Manuel es responsable y con buenas referencias de pago sabe que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Suharno

texts.en:
Suharno is one of the most respected corn farmer in Srimulyo Village. He is one of the most experienced farmer there. He is very active in empowering and motivating other farmers to work harder.

Even though he is an old man, he works like strong young man. Other than farming, he is doing construction work in his spare time to get more money.

"Money that I get from farming usually I spend it on houshold and medication. I am an old man hence I get sick easily" said Suharno.

Lets help Mr. Suharno with loans that he can use to buy a good quality farm input to increase his yield. Vasham. Kiva's field partner, will also provide Suharno with training and market access that enable him to get increase in income.

loans.use: to buy good quality farm inputs to increase his yield

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia is a very enterprising person. She started her business 2 years ago, and sells school and sports shoes for children. The business is running very well and she would like to include a larger number of models of shoes, so she will get a greater number of customers and greater sales.

Mrs. Lydia requests a loan of $1500.00 to be able to buy more kinds of shoes. She plans to pay back the loan in one year.

Español

La Sra. Lydia es una persona muy emprendedora, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de zapato escolar y deportivo para niño, el negocio a funcionado muy bien y le gustaria incluir una mayor cantidad de modelos, con lo cual obtendria mayor numero de clientes y mayores ventas.

La Sra. Lydia Solicita un prestamo de $1,500.00 dllrs para poder comprar mas modelos de zapatos. Ella planea pagar el prestamo en un año.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Alei

texts.en: Alei is a married woman with three kids. Her husband fishes everyday and she helps sell the fish at the market twice a week. Alei sells about 3-4 coolers of fish and earns $300-$400 a day. Money they earn from the sale of fish is used to buy more equipment for their business and to help with the payment of their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv M. is 43 years old and a father of four children, who live with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Iv is a mechanic and typically earns around $3/day in revenue. His wife stays at home to cook meals and look after the children. Two of his children work at the local garment factory, another is a teacher, and the last is a student.

Iv hopes to use the loan of USD 600 to purchase some mechanical tools to operate his business. In the future, he hopes that he is able to purchase vehicle oil, gasoline, tires and other products to sell due to the great demand of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase some mechanical tools to generate a business.

loans.name: Nelsón

texts.es:
Nelson is single and 26 years old. He lives in the downtown area of the city of Caaguazú, and he is the owner of a barber shop called "Peluquería Emmanuel". He started his own business 5 years ago and it is going very well. He has a good clientèle, and his shop is in a very busy commercial district. He studied to become a barber for a year in the country's capital, Asunción, and then came back to Caaguazú to exercise his profession.

A few months ago, he started selling cellphones, which generate some good extra income. He considers himself a good salesman, and the demand for cellphones has risen substantially. He only had a few phones in stock to try out the market for them, but now he needs to buy a larger quantity because the demand has increased substantially.

Nelson is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a larger quantity of cellphones. He commits to repay this amount monthly and on time.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Nelson es soltero y tiene 26 años de edad, se encuentra viviendo en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caaguazú, y es propietario de una peluquería llamada “Peluquería Emmanuel”. El monto su propio negocio hace 5 años, y le va bastante bien, posee una buena clientela, pues se encuentra en una zona comercial y de bastante movimiento. El estudio peluquería en la ciudad capital, Asunción, durante un año; luego volvió a Caaguazú para ejercer su profesión.

Hace unos meses empezó a vender celulares, que le generan un buen ingreso extra, él se considera buen comerciante, y la demanda de sus teléfonos ha aumentado bastante. Como el solo contaba con poco stock de teléfonos, pues solo compró unos cuantos para hacer una prueba de aceptación, el necesita adquirir ahora en mayor cantidad, ya que la demanda ha aumentado significativamente.

Nelson solicita un crédito de $ 200 para comprar mayor cantidad de teléfonos celulares, y se compromete a devolverlos mensual y puntualmente.

loans.use: to buy cellphones

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Herbierto is 67 years old and has been married for 41 years to his wife, Teófila, with whom he has 5 children. All of his children are grown, married, and working in various professions.

He lived in the neighboring country of Argentina for 11 years where he worked as a contruction worker until he decided to return to Paraguay. Currently he owns a large piece of land from which he cultivates tapioca, lettuce, sugar cane, and his primary product, strawberries. He also owns a small store which he runs out of his home and sells pre-cooked chickens on weekends and weeknights.

Herbierto has worked hard his whole life and has been successful in his endeavors. He is requesting a loan to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to cultivate his strawberry crop.

loans.use: Purchase of insecticides, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Zulema

texts.es:
Mercedes R., aged 28, and her husband Héctor Alberto, aged 28, are a young married couple. Together, they have a 3 year old daughter and a tremendous desire to build a solid home and fill it with harmony.

Similarly, in the midst of their agricultural jobs they show a great deal of optimism and confidence, putting all their effort in the farming of vegetables and tuber crops, which they later offer to wholesalers.

All this effort is paying off since they have recently started the construction of their own house. This has been a great source of motivation for them and therefor wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan for 275 USD which will help them in their undertaking to finish the construction of their yearned dream.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mercedes R. de 28 años y su esposo Héctor Alberto de 27 años, son una joven pareja de esposos que poseen una pequeña hija de tres años y tienen el anhelo inmenso de forjar en su compañía un hogar sólido lleno de armonía.Así sumergidos en las labores agrícolas, muestran gran optimismo y confianza, poniendo todo su empeño en el cultivo de hortalizas y tubérculos, los cuales ofertan a los comerciantes mayoristas del lugar. Todo este esfuerzo está dando frutos ya que han iniciado hace poco la construcción de su propia casa.Esto ha sido una fuente inmensa de motivación para ellos y por eso desean mejorar la calidad de sus productos a través de una mejor utilización de insumos y semillas, por lo cual solicitan un préstamo de 275 dólares que los ayudará en sus propósitos para concluir la construcción de su anhelado sueño.

loans.use: Capital investment to purchase raw materials and seeds in order to optimize production / Inversión de capital para adquirir más insumos y semillas a fin de optimizar su producción.

loans.name: Ugilkhon

texts.en: Ugilkhon A. is married and ives with her family in Spitamen. She has worked in the bazaar for five years. During her experience in materials sales, she has showed herself as capable of making new and profitable business. Her clients enjoy her expanding assortment of materials as her turnover is fast. She is seeking extra capital to expand her materials in order to satisfy customer demands, and to help improve her income.

loans.use: Business expansion and variety of goods

loans.name: Zenovia's Group

texts.en:
Zenovia and Lourdes are new members of the community bank “Palmeras”.  Zenovia is 55 years old, is married and has six children, three of which are boys and three girls.  The youngest three are still in high school.  For the last two years Zenovia has had a grocery store where she sells potatoes and meat in the small town of Mollepata.
On the other hand, Lourdes is 20 years old and lives with her partner and eight month old baby.  She has sold food from her house in the town of Wari Accopampa for the last year.
Zenovia and Lourdes need loans of 200 and 400 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying potatoes from local farmers, improving their houses, and buying supplies for their businesses.
Zenovia is very happy to be part of the community bank.  They have taught her how to run her business more efficiently.  She has learned the importance of saving.  Furthermore, Lourdes has learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to communicate effectively.  She is much less timid and has learned how to make connections with the people around her.  Zenovia’s dream is to make her business constantly more profitable.  Lourdes dreams of opening a large restaurant in Huamanga

loans.use: Zenovia and Lourdes need loans of 200 and 400 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying potatoes from local farmers, improving their houses, and buying supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: M. Amon, 46, is married and has 7 children -  1 has finished college and is now working, while the rest are still in high school. Amon owns a furniture business where he makes chairs and desks for sale. His previous loans from the organization have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. Currently, Amon needs another loan which he intends to use to buy more timber for business. Additionally, he will spend part of the money to purchase a generator to run his two maize milling machines.

loans.use: Purchase of timber for a carpentry business and of a generator for maize milling machines

loans.name: Busanzi South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Janet K.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to purchase more matooke from the surrounding villages. Janet is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 18 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Janet makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a goat. Janet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Janet is joined in her small group by Beatrice M., Edith N., Joy N., and Fatuma M.. Beatrice M. has a business trading produce and wants to boost business. Edith N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Joy N. operates a business of produce sales and wants to invest in her business. Fatuma M. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To boost matooke selling business

loans.name: María Bernalda

texts.en:
María Bernalda is 45 years old, and she and her husband have two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Her husband is an accountant and works for a private company. María Bernalda has been running a clothing store for 16 years. She says that her business helps her supplement the family's income, and she helps her husband support the children's studies. Bernalda also explains that through her business, she has been able to contribute to repairing her house.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy a large range of products to add to her stock. That way, she'll be able to increase her sales volume and thus her income.

loans.use: To supply a small clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice for his store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a businesswoman and she works at the city market, selling potatoes. She has been doing this for more than four years and thanks to her land, she is able to meet the demand from the market. We came across her working at the market very cheerfully and in the company of her friends she is able to enjoy herself and combat the stress which other people give her. Due to her ability to sell, she can cope very well, and is an example to everyone. So she can continue working at this same pace, she needs financial capital so that she can expand her product range and she is applying for a loan so that she can transport her products.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

BERTHA, es comerciante y trabaja en el mercado de su ciudad, vende en el sector de papas y esta actividad la realiza hace más de 4 años y gracias a sus terrenos de cultivo puede abastecer la demanda del mercado.La encontramos en el mercado trabajando muy alegremente y en compañía de sus amigas puede hacer de su trabajo una diversión y combatir el estrés que a otras personas les produce el trabajo.Debido a su capacidad para las ventas, ella puede desenvolverse muy efectivamente siendo un ejemplo para todas las personas. Para que ella siga con el mismo ritmo de trabajo necesita de un capital de dinero para aumentar sus productos y solicita un préstamo para el transporte de sus productos.

loans.use: To rent a vehicle for transporting her goods.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa F., 29, is married and has 3 children. For 3 years, she has had a farm growing vegetables. She sells vegetables to the villagers 3 days a week. She expects to make a profit of 250 Tala (about 104 USD) per week.

The is Luisa's first loan request. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Luisa plans to use the loan to buy equipment and supplies for her business.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, barbed wire, nails, chemical, and knives

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Before joining the TYM Fund, Mrs. T. Thi Ly's family relied only on farming and raised a small number of livestock which took advantage of scrap food and side products of farming. Her family's economy at that point of time was only the average in Tan Trai village. In 1995, Mrs. Ly joined the TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan of 500,000VND (about 33USD), which she used to purchase a female pig to breed. It brought about a profit of more than 1,000,000VND (about 66USD). As a creative and active woman, Mrs. Ly had tried many businesses such as buying and selling general goods and opening an eatery in Phu Cuong market, which all yielded good profit. However, she realised that raising livestock in large scale would return higher profit. Therefore, she discussed with her husband and moved into raising a large number of livestock. Her subsequent loans were all large in amount, from 16,000,000VND to 19,000,000VND. She bought 25-30 pigs each time and each year she raised and bred them 3 times, gaining profit from 10 millions to 15 millions VND. Currently, she has 2 female pigs to breed and 30 pigs to sell, along with hundreds of chickens. Thus, her family's monthly income reaches 7 millions VND (about 466USD). This time, she would like to borrow 18 millions VND (1,100.00USD) to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

 Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy Tình Thương, gia đình chị Trần Thị Lý chỉ làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi nhỏ nhằm tận dụng thức ăn dư thừa và các sản phẩm phụ từ nông nghiệp, kinh tế gia đình chị khi đó vào loại trung bình của thôn Tân Trại. Năm 1995 chị tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn vòng 1 là 500.000đ, chị mua ngay một con lợn nái và trong năm đó cho thu nhập hơn 1.000.00đ. Bản thân chị Lý là một phụ nữ năng động tháo vát, chị đã trải qua rất nhiều công việc như đi chợ , mở cửa hàng ăn tại chợ Phú Cường và cho thu nhập khá. Tuy nhiên chị thấy nếu chăn nuôi với qui mô lớn sẽ cho thu nhập cao hơn buôn bán. Sau đó chị bàn bạc với anh và chuyển sang chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn, các vòng vốn sau này chị đều vay mức cao từ 16.000.000-19.000.000đ và mua từ 25-30 con lợn / lứa, một năm chị nuôi 3 lứa lợn và cho thu nhập từ 10.000.000-15.000.000đ tiền lãi. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 2 con lợn nái và 30 con lợn thịt cùng hàng trăm con gà thịt, mỗi tháng cho thu nhập 7.000.000 đồng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 37 años, convive con Jorge, de 36, que se dedica a la confección de prendas; y con sus tres hijos: 11, 10 y  7  años, quienes están estudiando en la escuela.
Con el apoyo de su pareja, ha logrado poner un pequeño taller de confección de poleras, con el cual les va muy bien, el negocio viene prosperando y abastece a esta familia para mantener a sus tres hijos, ellos se dedican a la producción durante las tardes y noches, ya que en el día atienden otras labores, como la de cuidar a sus hijos.Lo que más le gusta a Nilda de su trabajo es poder tener a su pareja trabajando dentro de la casa y apoyándola en el cuidado de sus tres hijos, lo difícil es confeccionar las cantidades necesarias para abastecer los pedidos que les hacen.  
Nilda  trabaja para prosperar en su negocio y brindarles a sus hijos un futuro más estable.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprará una máquina de coser, para lograr abastecerse en los pedidos de los clientes y con el tiempo, hacer que su negocio sea mucho más grande y tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Nilda is 37 years old, lives with Jorge, 36, who makes clothing, and with their three children; 11, 10 and 7 years old, who are in school. With the support of her partner, she has been able to put a small workshop in her house, which has gone very well for them. The business is coming along prospering and restocking, allowing this family to support their three children, who work on production during the afternoons and nights, since during the day they attend to other work, like raising their children. What Nilda likes most about his work is that she can have her partner working inside the house and supporting her in the care of their three children, the difficult part is making the quantities necesary to restock the orders that they have. Nilda works to succeed in her business and give her children a more stable future. With the money from the loan, she will buy a sewing machine, to be able to restock for her customer's orders, and with time, make her business much larger and have a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine to make the clothing in much greater quantity and faster.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa esta tiene 53 años esta casada, su esposo tiene una jubilación con la ayuda, la señora retira las gallinas y las reparte entre sus vendedores, es un trabajo muy cansador pero con el mismo ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Actualmente tiene un salón en frente a su casa donde a parte de vender sus gallinas también venden frutas y helado.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de frutas y helados de diferentes sabores, ya que en esta época de primavera la gente consume mucho estos productos.
texts.en:
Ms Maria Luisa is a 53 year old married woman. Her husband is retired and with his help she picks up and distributes chickens to salespeople. This is a tiresome job, but it has allowed the family to progress.

She currently has a stand in front of her house where she also sells fruit and ice cream.

This loan will be used to purchase fruit and different flavors of ice cream as spring is beginning and sales of these items is increasing.


Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and ice cream

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran Baji is married to R. M. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 25 years. Sugran Baji has five children: a son and four daughters. Her eldest daughter has completed five years of education and is now working in a factory. The other children stay at home and help with household work. Sugran Baji’s husband owns a brick-sales business, while Sugran Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional amount of bricks for her husband’s brick-sales business.

She is borrowing together with a group of other women: Irshad Baji, Shabnam Baji, and Nazia Baji each need a loan to buy bricks for re-sale; Rashida Baji is borrowing to buy groceries for her grocery store, while Safia Baji and Majidan Baji each need a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-sales businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are equally responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add new clothing to her inventory.

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang K., 44 years old, is the leader of a group loan from Ratanak Commune in Battambang Province. She is a baker who makes banana cakes and sells them from her home. For over three years, she has earned approximately $3 a day from this business. Out of her four children, her first son is a security guard for a company and her second son is a construction worker. K. is applying for a loan to buy more cake ingredients for her business. 

There are two other members of this group loan. Mrs. Touch N., age 44, is a fritter seller who needs a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband's business. Mrs. Lun P. is 35 years old, earns an income by selling dessert. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cake ingredients

loans.name: Tania Elena

texts.es:
