La señora Tania V. es originaria de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar en el mercado central vendiendo variedad de productos y granos básicos los cuales los ha venido comercializando desde hace treinta largos años y habiendo sido este el sustento de su hogar de habitación por todo este período.

Hoy en día es importante destacar que ella ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel por lo que ha realizado 54 créditos habiéndolos cancelado en tiempo y forma. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el préstamo número 55 el cual lo ocupará para la compra de los granos básico y de esta forma continuar en el mejoramiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tania V. is originally from the city of León, Nicaragua, where she works in the central market selling a variety of products and basic grains. Tania has been selling goods for thirty years, which has sustained her home throughout this period. Today, it is important to note that Tania has been a loyal Ceprodel customer, which has made 54 loans to Tania that were repaid in a timely manner. Tania is currently seeking support for her 55th loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to purchase basic grains and thus continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
M., 46 years old, is a food vendor. Every day she cooks food in her small restaurant to earn a bigger income for the family. Her business is close to the school and that gives her regular customers. As a former manicurist, she offered manicures and pedicures to people and was paid Php 60 for her service. But by doing so, she thought she wouldn’t achieve her dream so she started a food business and wants to make it grow. The restaurant business is easy for her because she knows how to cook. She started her business in 2000 with Php 10,000 capital.

She is asking a loan from CEVI to purchase vegetables for her small restaurant. Her husband, Nador M., helps her run their business.

CEVI helps Elizabeth achieve her dreams. She is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other ingredients in her food business.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les   femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne  45 ans,  5 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de kouroubadougou  dans la sous préfecture de Kimparana (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent une activité qui est rare, la vente de feuilles de baobab séchées et la poudre de son  fruit qu’elles achètent avec celles qui  les cueillent. Elles fabriquent également  à base   de beurre  de karité et de la potasse du savon. Elles sont très sollicitées dans leurs  activités.  
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des sacs de feuilles et de la   poudre de  baobab. Ses condiments sont vendus au marché de kimparana   en détail, et  au comptant. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie. Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un prêt élevé afin de diversifier leur activité  en vendant des pagnes provenant de Bobo.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi (meaning "agreement" or "harmony") are all married. Averaging 45 years of age and 5 children each, they live in large traditional extended families in the village of Kouroubadougou in Kimparana sub-prefecture (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and family. They are in a rare business, selling dried baobab leaves and powdered fruit from the same tree. They buy these goods from women who gather them. The group members also make soap from karité butter (from the shea nut) and potash. The members are in high demand in their businesses.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

With this loan, they want to buy sacks of leaves and baobab powder. These condiments are sold retail and in cash transactions at the Kimparana marketplace.

They hope to realize an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest and to provide for the extended family. Their ambition is to obtain a larger loan in order to diversify their work by selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) from Bobo.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio memorial sandino con dos hijos de 9 y 18 años de edad,  su esposo es conductor. Ella se dedica ala cocina en un centro de comida rápidas como los tacos charros, también comercializa ropa y zapatos y productos de cosméticos a sus compañeros de trabajo, tiene de vender ropa mas de ocho años y como cocinera dos años,  anteriormente solo vendía ropa y variedades, pero como a veces el negocio se ponía malo en las ventas opto por tener un ingreso fijo y vender la ropa el tiempo libre y así generando mas ingresos, con este crédito que esta solicitando es para incrementar el volumen de las ventas comprando ropa variada, zapatos y cosméticos que son útiles cada día de la semana en nuestra vida cotidiana. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa, captar clientes y vender otros productos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 42 years old and lives in the memorial sandino neighborhood. She has two children, 9 and 18 year old, and her husband is a driver. She works making fast food like tacos and she also sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics to her colleagues. She has sold clothes for 8 years and has cooked for 2 years. She used to only sell clothing, but sometimes business was not good so she decided to have a more fixed income by only selling clothes part-time in order to generate extra income. With this loan she will increase her inventory of clothes, shoes and cosmetics that are useful for everyday life. She hopes to continue improving her house, gain more clients and sell other types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothes, shoes, cosmetics

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Anelyn K. is 36 years old and married to Mynard K.. She raises pigs. She is requesting a loan of  10,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anelyn dreams of having more pigs and a pig pen extension one day. She also hopes to have a concrete house for her family and a good life ahead. She is a member in good standing in the PDP-LP program of Paglaum Coop.

loans.use: feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Zouher

texts.en:
Zouher is a fifty-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Zouher has owned a home product shop since 2002. He requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua, one of Kiva's field partners, in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve both his business and his financial situation. Zouher's shop is well-known because he has a wide variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had only a small amount of capital. He decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Ái Đặng Thị is a 30 year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Ái owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from services. Ái has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Ái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Ái is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Ái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en: Pascacio (pictured above, on a bike) has a joyful personality. He is a young father of two who strives for success. He lives in Consuelo, an agricultural community of sugar cane farmers. In this particular community, the sugar cane plantation owners pay their daily workers in tickets. Those tickets can be later cashed in at the end of the month. Pascacio, learning from microfinance, plans to finance some of those tickets for people who cannot wait until the end of the month, and charge interest. With the profits, he hopes to one day open his own store and have his own truck.

loans.use: To finance sugar cane tickets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for various services

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: For 10 years now, Perlita R. has been supporting her family through her sari-sari store. According to her, maintaining a sari-sari store that long is such an achievement. However, in those ten years only a little improvement took place. Thus, she decided to avail a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP5,000 for her additional capital. She is very positive that through her loan, her business will progress. She also says that her loan will be used for purchasing other products for her store, so her customers will have more choices.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 37-year-old trader. He is married with three children. He has sold used clothes like shirts for men in the local market for 12 years. His major business challenge over the years has been obtaining funds to scale up the business. He has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used shirts and add the sale of used trousers to serve his customers. He hopes to save enough to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy bales of used shirts

loans.name: Chapo Manuel

texts.pt:
Chapo Manuel M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 69 anos de idade e pai de 5 filhos maiores de 18 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado devido à factores políticos no tempo colonial português.
Vivem com sua família e mais duas netas e dois sobrinhos sob sua responsabilidade na casa própria no mesmo distrito de boane.

Chapo participou movimento independentista contra o regime colonial português desde o ano de 1954 que culminou com a independência do pais no ano de 1975 sob liderança do partido ainda no poder em Moçambique. Em 1994 depois das primeiras eleições gerais no pais, passou a reforma. Ganha mensalmente 3.500,00MT no Ministério da defesa Nacional. Para alem da pensão, recebe 3.000,00MT de aluguer de casa que construiu com o dinheiro obtido a quando da sua desmobilização.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através do seu secretario do bairro tendo aproximado e desembolsado o primeiro credito no valor de 16.000,00MT que se destinava a compra de material de construção.

Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00MT pretende continuar com a actividade de construção de mais uma casa para aluguer, comprando material de construção.
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos com o mesmo propósito. Depois de terminar com a sua obra, sonha comprar uma viatura para os filhos.
texts.en:
Chapo Manuel M. was born in the city of Maputo. He is 69 years old and is the father of 5 grown children. He studied until the 4th grade but he stopped his studies due to political factors during the Portuguese colonial rule. He lives with his family and two granddaughters and two nephews whom he cares for in his own home in the Boane district.

Chapo participated in the independence movement against the colonial Portuguese regime, beginning in 1954 and which ended in 1975 under the leadership of the party then in power in Mozambique. In 1994 after the first general elections of the country, reform came.

He earns 3.500,00MT monthly in the national defense ministry. Aside from this, he receives 3.000,00MT for the lease of a house that he constructed with money obtained after the end of his military service.

He never has taken a loan with another bank. He came to know Hluvuku-Adsema through his neighborhood secretary having taken a loan for 16.000,00MT which he used to buy construction materials.

With this new loan of 20.000,00MT he hopes to continue the construction of more than one house to rent, purchasing construction materials. He hopes to pay back the loan without problems in order to be able to have access to future loans for the same purpose. After finishing his current project, he dreams of buying a vehicle for his children.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo gracias a Dios es originario de la Comarca Pilas orientales, ubicado en la Ciudad de Masaya. Está formado por Lolita del Socorro U. D., José Luis D. S. y Bruna M. M.. 

Lolita U. es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la Producción y venta de sandía desde hace 4 años. Su punto de venta es en la carretera a Tipitapa. Un buen punto para el comercio ya que por esta carretera transitan los vehículos que vienen de honduras y demás países centroamericanos, por tanto es muy apetecible la compra de una Sandía fresca. 

Además, aprovecha la oportunidad para vender otro tipo de frutas como naranja banano y jocotes. Todo esto con la ayuda de su esposo. Su crédito lo requiere para invertir a mayor cantidad y poder abastecer la demanda.

El grupo Gracias a Dios tiene 11 ciclos de crédito, gran record para un grupo. Los demás miembros son José D. quien trabaja en la venta de Ropa y perfumes desde hace 2 años y ½  y Bruna M. que vende comida en su casa desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Group “Gracias a Dios” (Thanks to God) is from the eastern region of Pilas, which is located in the city of Masaya. The members of the group are Lolita del Socorro U. D., José Luis D. S., and Bruna M. M..

Lolita U. is the group coordinator. She is 32 years old and has been growing and selling watermelons for the past 4 years. Lolita decided to sell her products from the side of the highway leading to Tipitapa. She thought this would be a good place to set up her post because of the passing vehicles coming from Honduras and other Central American countries, so it would be very tempting to buy a fresh watermelon. She also sells other fruits such as oranges, bananas, and plums. Lolita has the help of her husband in running her business. She plans to invest her loan so that she can produce and purchase fruit in larger quantities and meet demand.

The group has participated in 11 loan cycles and has an outstanding record. José D. has been selling clothing and perfumes for 2½ years. Bruna M. has been selling food out of her home for 2 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in watermelon production & buy larger quantities of other fruits

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate sells fish like crayfish and smoked fish. She also sells vegetables. She is 40 years old and married with two children. She is from Edo State.

Kate hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for business

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en:
Amarsaikhan is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 14 and 11, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of her sons attend a local secondary school.

Amarsaikhan operates a used clothing retail business. She began her business in 1999 with a working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD). After years of hard work, determination and good business sense, her working capital now exceeds 450,000 tugrug (~316 USD). She is known to provide a wide variety of quality clothing to her customers and has a large customer base in her local market.

Amarsaikhan is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan in order to purchase more quality used clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more quality used clothing for her business

loans.name: Johanna Lucia

texts.es: La joven Johanna Lucia García , tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio San Juan, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos varones de diez y un bebé de tres meses de nacido , doña Johana desde hace seis años se dedica a los trabajos agrícola y tiene el apoyo de su suegra , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la vivienda ya que le quiere cambiar el techo , por que en tiempo de invierno el agua le afecta ya que tienes mucho orificios por ser muy viejo.  Agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su sexto crédito, el cual lo va a invertir en insumos agrícolas, para mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
Johanna Lucia García, 24, lives in the San Juan neighborhood with her husband, who works as a security guard in a private company to help her with household expenses. They have two sons, a 10-year-old and a three-month-old newborn. Johana has been a farmer for the past 6 years and she counts on her mother-in-law's support. Her plan for the future is to improve her house because she needs to replace the roof which is heavily damaged and has many holes which in the Winter allow water to come in and do a lot of damage. She is grateful to Afodenic for approving her 6th loan which she will use to buy raw materials to improve her crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Mrs. Anita T. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and is blessed with two adult children. Anita owns and operates a business harvesting and selling rice in the local community. She has been in this business for more than ten years and earns 4,000 PHP monthly. In 2004, Anita joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her rice production. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Lola Maqueda

texts.es:
La señora LOLA MAQUEDA, tiene  43 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal FUENTE DE VIDA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. La socia se dedica  a la venta de gas.
Con sus primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró balones de gas al por mayor.
Con su próximo crédito de 2,800 nuevos soles comprará gas y una parte la utilizará para sembrar alfalfa en las chacras que tiene en la sierra.
La señora Lola sueña con aumentar sus ventas de gas.
texts.en:
Lola Maqueda is 43 years old and lives in the village of Huanchaco in Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. Lola is member of the community bank Fuente de Vida. She is educated to fifth grade of secondary school. Lola sells gas cylinders.

Lola used her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles to buy gas cylinders in bulk.

With her next loan of 2,800 Peruvian soles, Lola wants to buy more gas, some of which she'll use to sow alfalfa in the small allotments she has in the mountains.

Lola dreams of growing her gas selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tanks of gas wholesale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, who is 59-years-old and married with ten children, sells groceries such as milk, soaps and drinks. A friendly woman whose personality attracts many customers to her stall, Rose loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. A client of LAPO, an organization committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa, she is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Rose says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is fifty-two years old. He is a married man and has six children, all of whom are in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Idi is a hard working man. He trades in all types and sizes of wood. He buys sawn wood from sawmills in surrounding communities and supplies it to retailers and other communities. Idi has been in business for ten years and requests the loan in order to buy wood in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es: Rayito de Luz es un grupo que está empezando este es su primer crédito en la institución. A este lo integran tres personas muy trabajadoras que comercializan principalmente ropa  ellos son Víctor Manuel A. O.  quien desde hace dos años vende ropa, Karen Patricia M. R. comercializa de manera ambulante ropa y  Mercedes Francisca Benavides Vargas quien vende ropa, realiza recargas  y alquiler de teléfono.
texts.en:
Rayito de Luz is a group starting their first loan in the institution. This group is made up of three very hardworking people who sell primarily clothing. They are Víctor Manuel A. O., who has sold clothing for two years; Karen Patricia M. R., who is a traveling clothing saleswoman; and Mercedes Francisca Benavides Vargas, who sells clothing and also recharges and rents telephones.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz M. G. tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos.  Tiene 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales ya se casaron y se fueron de la casa de sus padres.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura como su principal fuente de ingresos.  Siembra maiz, papas, mora, habas, y a veces cebadas.  Tiene toda su vida en esta actividad, antes ayudaba a sus padres con los cultivos.  También tiene cuyes y ganado que vende con los cultivos en las ferias en San Miguel los días miércoles, jueves, y domingo.  Es dificil sacar los productos a la venta porque actualmente los precios son muy bajos.  Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maiz.

Su sueño es ayudarles a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean profesionales en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Luz M. G., 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children. She has 5 children, but two of them are married and no longer live with their parents. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are potato and corn farmers. Luz's main source of income is corn, potato, blackberry and, occasionally, barley farming. She has been a farmer all her life; she used to help her parents with their farming. She also raises guinea pigs and cattle which she sells in the San Miguel markets on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. It's difficult to sell right now because prices are very low. She is asking for funding for her corn crops. Her dream is to help her children with their schooling so that they will become professionals in the field of agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Lilibeth is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business providing transport service to local community members. Lilibeth owns a "motorela". (A motorela is a motorcycle that is encased in a carriage with tworows of seats facing each other.) She has been in operation for over nine years and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her service

loans.name: Ngoma

texts.fr: Ngoma D. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et a la charge de 2 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre fondatrice du Banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis mars 1995 et a eu 27 fois de suite été bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée pendant plus de 2O ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, son mari le soutien dans l'entretien et la vente du bétail. Elle participe dans la prise en charge de la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ngoma D. is 44 years old, married and mother of seven children. She also takes care of two other children that were entrusted to her. She is a founding member of the DIONGO credit loan group since March 1995, and has benefited from 27 successive loans. In over 20 years of activity, she has developed a great deal of experience in the fattening of sheep and cattle. Her husband assists her in taking care of and selling the livestock. She participates in the handling of food expenses, healthcare and the children’s schooling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Gary Francisco

texts.es:
Gary B. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa es comerciante informal ellos tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años. 

Hace años atrás el padre de Gary tenia una furgoneta y hacia expreso a una escuela, desde pequeño Gary quiso hacer la misma actividad y ser como su padre. Cuando el creció y su padre falleció decidió retomar la actividad de chofer. 

Ahora el tiene una furgoneta expreso trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 11:00 am de lunes a viernes el colegio que hace expreso se llama “Juan Montalvo”. En ocasiones hace viajes para la playa o ciudades del Ecuador. Los caminos no pavimentados son de dificultad para que siga laborando. 

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para el arreglo de la furgoneta y así poderles dar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. En el futuro quiere afiliarse a una cooperativa de buses.
texts.en:
Gary B., 35, lives in a suburban area in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and is equipped with all basic services. His wife is an informal shopkeeper and together they have to children who are 7 and 5. Years ago, Gary's father had a bus and would drive it express to school. Since he was small, Gary wanted to have the same livelihood and be like his father. When he was grown and his father had passed away, he decided to take over his father's job as a driver.

Now Gary has an express bus that he drives from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 am, Monday through Friday. The school that he drives to is called Juan Montalvo. He also occasionally makes trips to the beach or to other cities in Ecuador. The unpaved roads make it difficult for him to continue working. The loan will be used to fix his bus so that he can provide better service to his passengers. In the future he wants to join a bus cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix his bus

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkola sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fougani, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Elles font le commerce de céréales et de charbon de bois en vue de prendre en charges une partie des dépenses de leur famille. Oumou D. qui est un des membres du groupe Benkola s’est spécialisée dans l’achat vente du charbon de bois depuis maintenant quelques années.
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités.
 Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents se sont bien  dénoués. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, Oumou D. envisage utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de sacs de charbon de bois avec les fournisseurs et  revend sur place à  une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune à l’instar de Oumou, un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA  par mois. 
Les bénéfices seront investis dans la nourriture, dans la santé et dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkola are married women who average 35 years of age and three children each. Along with their husband and children, they live in large traditional families and reside in the village of Fougani, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another by ties of community and kinship. They do commerce in grains and charcoal with the aim of covering a portion of their family expenses. Oumou D., one of the group members, became specialized in buying and selling charcoal a few years ago. The women of the group are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, since they were concerned about having constant financial support for their businesses. They are now on their fourth solidarity loan. The preceding loans have all been settled. As for using the new loan, Oumou D. envisions using her loan to buy a large number of sacks of charcoal from suppliers and to resell them locally to a customer base composed of women and men. Just like Oumou, the group members each hope to make an average profit of 20,000 francs CFA per month. The profits will be invested in food, health care, and their work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Ana  Joaquina

texts.es:
Ana Joaquina T. es una señora de 22 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años ella y su familia se han dedicado a la ganadería. Y hace poco tiempo adquirieron un nuevo terreno en el cual piensan seguir desarrollando su negocio.

En estos momentos doña  Ana desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢605.000 (seiscientos cinco  mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto y los materiales necesarios para darle al terreno las condiciones aptas para cuidar su ganado . Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y generar los ingresos necesarios y así  construir su propia casa


Doña Ana es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Ella está muy agradecida por el acceso al crédito brindado por este tipo de empresas.
texts.en:
Ana Joaquina T. is a 22 year-old woman who lives with her husband in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous area, located very close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities there are agriculture and livestock production, particularly the cultivation of staple grains, sugarcane and oranges. For a number of years her family has worked in livestock production. A short time ago they acquired some new land, which they are thinking of developing for their business. Now Ana wishes to take a loan of ¢605.000 (six hundred five thousand colones), to buy seeds for pasture grass and the materials necessary to condition the land optimally for use in livestock production. This will help her to improve her business and generate the income needed so that they can build their own house. Ana is a member of the communal bank "Manantial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are part of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be their first loan, and with it they hope to see growth at the personal and economic levels. She is very grateful for the access to credit provided through these types of organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seed for pasture grass, and and wire fencing

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Gelgi es madre de familia de tres hijos, muy trabajadora ya que le ha tocado sola criarlo. Es difícil pero el amor a sus hijos se ha propuesto sobresalir para que no falte la alimentación y educación. Trabaja en la costura  desde hace varios años, y ha tomado mucha experiencia y rapidez en su trabajo. También invertirá en un taller de servicios de soldadura en sociedad con su hermano para mejorar sus ingresos, con el financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción para reparar portón y poner techo en el taller ya que es enfrente de su casa que se hará el negocio poniendo local y su hermano las herramientas lo que espera captar clientes y que funcione bien el taller ya que serán mejores las entradas económicas lo que vendrá a beneficiar su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
Ms Gelgi is mother of three children and very hard working as she raises her children alone. It's difficult but the love of her children helps her to excel so that they are not for want of food or education. She has been working in sewing for several years and has gained experience and speed in her work. She also invests in a welding services shop in partnership with her brother to improve their income. With the loan, they would buy construction materials to repair the door and add a roof for the workshop as it is in front of their home. They will do better business with this new shop front along with the the tools her brother wants. They hope to attract customers with the new shop and improve the economic situation for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tin to put a roof on the new welding shop

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu A. is 49 and married with four children. She owns a business providing men's tailoring services to local community members and has many years of experience in this business. Faatupu needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 700 talas (approximately USD 280) per week, to improve and expand her business. This is Faatupu’s 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Emma Leticia

texts.es:
Emma de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad habían muchas flores orquídeas)  de Guayaquil,  esta separada de su esposo con el tiene dos hijos, ella tiene una tienda desde hace seis años atrás. 

Ha trabajado por 6 años desde que se separo de su esposo para mantener a sus hijos y dales una buena educación, invirtió sus ahorros comprando víveres y readecuo su sala para hacer un local. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Para tener mas ingresos quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y bebidas. 

Pero en el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda y así darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called “las Orquídeas” (the Orchids), which takes its name from the era of its first beginnings when there were many orchid flowers in the area. She is separated from her husband with whom she had two children. Emma has a shop which she has run for six years. In the six years that she has been separated she has worked to bring up her children and give them a good education. She invested her savings in the purchase of supplies and renovated a room in her house to create a shop. Since then she has been working from 6am to 9pm every day. Emma wants to use this loan to buy rice, oil and beverages to increase her income. However, in the future she wants to buy even more supplies for her shop to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, beverages

loans.name: Lav

texts.en: Mrs. Lav P., 53 years old, lives in Prey Khvav village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder at home and a congee seller at the local market while her husband, Mr. Sim Paen, is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. With these businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To support her pig business, Mrs. Lav P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has six children; four are soldiers and two are students who also help out with their parents' businesses. Mrs. Lav P.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has spent all her life in Borewala, which is a small city of Pakistan famous for its shrines. Her husband has a business of selling timber. She helps her husband financially by selling clothes. 

She has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. Her son had to leave his education after 8th class and started to work to support his family. He works in a carpet shop, where he deals with the customers and sells carpets to them. 

Nasreen bibi has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah to financially support her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy more timber for his timber-selling business. 

In the previous year, she has maintained good credit behavior and never gave Asasah any trouble regarding attending recovery meetings and paying back installments. She hopes that her husband will increase his income this time and also provide better facilities of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchase timber for timber-selling business

loans.name: Eben Ezer De Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es: El grupo esta conformado por 3 socias originarias de Aldea Cruz Blanca, municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, son pequeñas comenrciantes entre sus negocios como venta de comida y venta de útiles escolares, este grupo ha designado ser representado por la señora Rufina T., quien es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares de hace 8 años negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado cerca de la escuela de la localidad, solicitan un crédito para poder invertir mas en los negocios de cada una, por ejemplo doña Rufina desea iniciar a vender zapatos de puerta en puerta mientras su hija se hace cargo de la venta de útiles escolares.
texts.en:
The group comprises three members from Aldea Blanca Cruz in the Municipality of San Juan Sacatepequez. They are small traders with businesses such as selling food or school supplies. The group is represented by Rufina T., who is a single mother and has been selling school supplies for the past 8 years. Her business is located near the local school. They are applying for a loan to invest more in their businesses; for example, Rufina wants to start selling shoes door to door while her daughter takes over the sale of school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is very determined and cool, and trades in used clothing and food items.  Her stall is located at Savage Square Makeni, and she has ten years experience in business. She is married to a trader and they have two children. She initially accessed funds from her husband to kick start her business.

She needs a loan to buy more used clothing and food items, and hopes to use her proceeds to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and food items.

loans.name: Mario Esteven

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Esteven C. T. el es trabajador de la empresa “Walter Zamora Estrada” desempeñándose como conductor de camión, tiene  cuatro  año de trabajarle a esta empresa, es acompañado actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para compra de materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de repuestos para el motor de un carro y cambiarle el techo a su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Esteven C. T. is employed by a firm called “Walter Zamora Estrada” as a truck driver. He has been thus employed for four years. He has a school age son. He has had two CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvement. This loan will be used to buy vehicle engine replacement parts and to replace the roof on his house. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi replacement parts and to buy zinc metal sheeting and tubing.

loans.name: Veoun

texts.en:
Veoun S., 59, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. S. sells groceries for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 5 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Punta, Brgy. Hilutongan, Bantayan, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: fishing, running a sari-sari (general) store and a barbecue stand businesses. Her husband Redempto V., who is 28 years old, works as a fisherman. They have one five-year-old child. Rubelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rubelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase a fishing net and use as additional capital for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and improve the family's living conditions. Rubelyn V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yvonne Paola

texts.es:
Yvone de 29 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  aunque esta divorciada ella sigue trabajando para sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años. 

Ahorro dinero para poder comprar productos y venderlos con un precio adecuado y así mantener a sus dos hijos. Realiza su trabajo sola, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar los estudios de enfermería y ampliar su negocio con un local.
texts.en:
Yvone is 29 years old and sells Yambal products (a business that offers entrepreneurial women the opportunity to begin their own business as independent saleswomen); though she is divorced, she works hard to support her 2 children who are 2 and 7.

She saved money to buy products and sell them at a good price to support her children.  She runs her business by her self and works from very early each morning offering her products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfumes that range in price from $20 to $75 each.

She will use this loan to buy more Yambal products like perfumes, creams, lotions, and deodorants.  In the future, she would like to finish her nursing degree and expand her business with a storefront.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams and lotions, and deodorant

loans.name: Belkis Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Joven Belkis C. Hernández, es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempaña como Operaria de Limpieza Publica en el Mercado El Bisne, es soltera sin hijos y aun vive con sus padres.
Belkis C. Habita en el Barrio la Resistencia lleva ya 02 créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Belkis C. Hernández is a young woman who is employed by the City of Chinandega. She works as a public sanitation engineer at the Bisne Market. Belkis is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents in the neighborhood of La Resistencia.

She has already received two loans with CEPRODEL and demonstrated that she is a responsible person with her obligations.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For over ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. In addition she also sells fresh water which contributes to her other source of income. She sells from a shop and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Nzingo faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a poultry business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Y. is from the village of Lumad, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Susan is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies, like banana and camote cues (deep-fried, caramelized sweet potatoes) in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena B. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 62 years old. Nena is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as snack foods, candies & biscuits in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods & candies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, 45 años, casada con Herminio, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas Merly, de 14 años. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La hermosa sonrisa de Carmen, muestra la vitalidad que posee, pues cuenta que hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura; donde sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátanos, y palta. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder sacar el quillo (tipo de maleza que crece entre los cultivos) que crece constantemente, pues así asegura que sus cultivos crecerán sin mayores inconvenientes. El trabajo esforzado que diariamente proporciona a sus cultivos principalmente de plátanos, hace que 2 veces al mes viaje a las ciudades de La Merced y Villa Rica, donde vende sus frutos. Pero como sabe que las épocas de cosecha de café son una vez al año, ella desea mejorar e incrementar la siembra de diferentes frutas, así está segura que no tendrá inconvenientes en su economía. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera que muy pronto puedan lograr sus objetivos como un banco comunal independiente.Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, y si el dinero le alcanza comenzará a realizar un vivero de café de un promedio de 4 mil plantas.
texts.en: Carmen is 45 years old. She is married to Herminio, who is 44. They have 4 children, but only one, 14 year old Marly, lives with them. The three of them live as a family in their own home, located in the community of Unión Palomar (Central Peruvian jungle). Carmen's beautiful smile shows off her vitality. She has been farming for 8 years. Her main crops are coffee, plantains, and avocado. What she likes the most is being able to take out the quillo (a type of weed that grows between the plantings) that grows constantly. Thus, she ensures that her crops will grow without big problems. The hard work that she does every day for her crops, mainly the plantains, results in her travelling twice a month to the cities of La Merced and Villa Rica, where she sells her products. But since she knows that the harvest for coffee is once a year, she wants to improve and increase the plantings of different products. In this way, she will ensure herself against financial problems. This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP and she hopes that they can acheive their goals as an independent communal bank.  With the loan she is asking for, she plans on buying various sacks of organic fertilizer. If there is enough money, she will start a coffee nurery with an average of 4 thousand plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and make a nursery with 4 thousand coffee plants.

loans.name: Hassan T.

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Hassan T. C.. He is married and has four children ages 3, 6, 10 and 12. In 2007, Hassan established his essential drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-employed. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.

Hassan has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more essential drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Hassan plans to open a big store and sell in wholesale to other traders. He would also like to educate his children to university level and construct a home for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more essential drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es:
Don Hilario tiene 46 años de edad, reside en Arambala, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra y producción de hortalizas, él vive con esposa de 42 años de edad y tres hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años de edad, el señor Hilario se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como chile, pepino, ejotes, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el trabajo, este oficio lo aprendió de sus hermanos mayores.
Él necesita invertir un préstamo en semillas y pago de jornales para comenzar la siembra de hortalizas, son dos personas que le ayudan a desarrollar el trabajo en un área grande de terreno.
Su objetivo es aumentar el cultivo para que su producción sea mayor, también que sus hijos obtengan una mejor calidad de vida y accecen a una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Hilario is 46 years old.  He lives in Arambala, in Morazán department, with his 42 year-old wife and three children aged 18, 17 and 14.  Hilario grows vegetables such as chili peppers, cucumbers and green beans.  He has 4 years experience in this business which he learned from his older siblings.

Hilario needs a loan so that he can invest in buying seeds and paying laborers to start sowing his vegetables.  He has two people who help him in his work as he sows his crops over a large area of land.  His goal is to increase his crops and production.  He also wants to achieve a better quality of life for his children and for them to study at university.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay laborers

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 58-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and buying & selling rice.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. Rosalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to buy stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Rosalia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Lucidy

texts.en:
Lucidy is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a ready-to-wear clothes business. She lives in La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000.  Lucidy is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lucidy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is 43 years old and is blessed with two children, aged 5 and 10.  His wife assists him in running his retail shop and grocery store. Kenneth has operated the business for nearly five years but was previously employed. He started pig farming after he got his first loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to own a wholesale business in the future. Kenneth plans to use this 50,000 KES loan to open another retail shop to get more customers.

loans.use: to open another retail shop

loans.name: Cleofa Casilda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Cleolfa, tiene 49 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tuvo cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad y  comprometidos, solo el menor que es soltero vive con ella.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa  en la que vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y más artículos de primera necesidad, en ella  trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado, los productos los compra en Manta y algunos  los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva en su tienda ya 7 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gustan las reuniones y la unión del grupo.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y crecer cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found Cleofa, 49.  She is currently separated but from the relationship she was in several years ago she had four children, all committed adults now; only the youngest, who is still single, lives with her.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cured meats and other first need items.  She works daily from 5am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her son helps her when he’s not busy.  She buys her products in Manta and some are delivered to her locale.  She tells us that she’s had her store for 7 years.

This loan will be used to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other first need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes the meetings and the group’s unity.

Her goal is to stay in business and grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: David Njoroge

texts.en:
David has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 54 years old married to Jane Wambui and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid for his first loan of KES. 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruit and vegetables for sale.

In the future, David hopes to try farming and become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Kashumpai Kirmusoi

texts.en:
Kashumpai has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 32 years old and married to Edward K.. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Kashumpai hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda de 27 años es madre de familia, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, cuenta con todos los servicio básicos,  ubicada en el distrito de Chepen, que se encuentra a unas 2 horas de distancia del departamento de la Libertad (Trujillo)y a una hora de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Todas éstas zonas  se caracterizan por la actividad agricola, ganadera y turismo.

Hilda se dedica a la venta de ropa en forma ambulatoria, desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca al mercado de la ciudad de Chepen, lugar donde existe mayor afluencia de personas y así su negocio tiene mayor acogida de clientes, permitiéndole tener ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

A observado Hilda que su negocio cada día va creciendo y ha solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadría y más surtida, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, de una manera responsable  con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 27 year- old mother who lives in her own home with her children.  Her home has all the basic services and is located in Chepen district, two hours from La Libertad (Trujillo) department and one hour from Chiclayo province.  All of these areas are noted for the fact that their residents work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

Hilda sells clothes as an itinerant vendor.  She has been in this business for four years and her business is located near Chepen town market.  This is a very busy place and so her business has a lot of customers.  This allows her to make income with which to cover her family expenses.

Hilda has noticed that her business is increasing every day and so she has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy a larger quantity and variety of merchandise so that her customer numbers continue to grow.  This will enable her to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life in a responsible way, with a lot of effort and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and stock her business

loans.name: Ma. Hanel-Len

texts.en:
Ma. Hanel-len works hard to support her family. Ma. Hanel-len is single and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Ma. Hanel-len requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a manicure tool kit.

Ma. Hanel-len has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Hanel-len would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a manicure tool kit

loans.name: Tiemprokotie Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIEMPROKOTIE II   est un regroupement de l’Association  des femmes mariées du village de MORIBILA MANKAN  de l'ex cercle de San, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe TIEMPROKOTIE II ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de SORO Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
SALIMATA, assise au milieu, achètera une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture,  au grand marché de SAN ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de KIMPARANA  SAN,  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 47500 à 95000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Tiemprokotie II is a part of the Married Women Association of the village of Moribila Mankan, in the former San district, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families. They are on average 39 years old with at least five children. They cultivate groundnuts.
In order to make their farms more profitable, the members of the Tiemprokotie II group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, they are now on their fourth agricultural loan.
Salimata, who sits in the middle, will purchase a sufficient quantity of groundnut seeds, small equipment and agricultural cultivation inputs at the great market in the city of San. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain time to gain value before being sold at the great market of Kimparana San and in neighboring markets, either retail or (often) wholesale, to customers generally coming from big cities.
After selling their agricultural products, the group's members hope to each make a profit of 47,500 to 95,000 FCFA; it will be used to pay back the loan and for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana con sus 68 años de edad aun se siente útil es por ello que  trabaja con una sobrina que exporta joyas al extranjero este trabajo que realiza  la ayuda a estar ocupada lo que ella hace es buscar buenos precios  con joyeros y artesanos para que le puedan preparar la mercadería como pulseras, aretes, collares etc. Esto a su vez las envía a su sobrina que las vende a buen precio,  Por su lado ella también ofrece algunas joyas a sus amigos y familiares este negocio le permite tener  un dinero extra que le sirve para cubrir algunos gastos personales, ahora esta muy deseosa de invertir su préstamo en la compra de mas joyas debido a que se avecinan un mes de mucha demanda, ella pertenece al grupo SANTA ROSA del cual es socia.

  *La Sra. Ana esta con blusa blanca, tambien aparecen 2 Sras que son pasivas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana in spite of being 68 years old feels competent enough to work which is why she exports jewelry with her niece. This job helps her become occupied. She goes out and looks for jewelry at low prices with jewelers and artisans and they can prepare the merchandise such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, etc. Once they are ready she sends them to her niece to be sold at good prices. She also offers some pieces of jewelry to friends and family. This job helps her have extra income to cover personal costs. Now she wants to use her loan in buying mO. jewelry  since a lot of demand approaches in a month. She belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa.

* Mrs. Rosa is wearing a white blouse, two women are attending as passive members.

loans.use: buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Gemma has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothes to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 6 years, and also earns additional income from manicure services.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rooss Merlyp

texts.es:
La señorita Rooss es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera.
Con su primer préstamo compró los accesorios que le faltaba para iniciar su negocio de repostería, trabajo que lo realiza en la casa de su mamá.
Son tres ciclos que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la preparación de tortas, y todo lo que tiene que ver con repostería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará:4 moldes de keke, 2 pisos para tortas, 1 batidora, 1 tazón grande.
Estas son herramientas muy necesarias en su trabajo y las tiene que comprar para poder seguir atendiendo los pedidos.  A pesar de ser tan joven ya está trabajando porque le agrada lo que hace, es un arte.

De esta manera podrá pagar sus estudios sin dar más preocupaciones a su mamá, que también trabaja sin descanso.  Está muy agradecida por todo a Manuela Ramos,  por las charlas educativas que imparten las promotoras.
texts.en:
Rooss is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and she is single.

With her first loan she was able to purchase the accessories that she needed to start up a pastry business. She carries out her work in her mother's house.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three loan cycles. She makes cakes and anything else related to pastries.

With her new loan, amounting to S/.1200 nuevos soles, she will purchase 4 cake pans, 2 cake trays, 1 mixer, 1 large bowl.

These tools are very necessary for her work and she needs to purchase them to be able to keep filling orders. Despite her young age she is already working because she enjoys what she does. It is an art.

This way she will be able to cover her school tuition without having to depend on her mother, who also works tirelessly. She is very thankful for everything to Manuela Ramos, especially for the educational presentations given by the representatives.

loans.use: to purchase cake pans.

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisela es comerciante en venta de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos, inicio hace cuatro años, con dinero de su liquidacion de su trabajo anterior, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años, lo que al tener su negocio, le ayudado a cuidar mas tiempo a su hijo, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su mama que es donde vive.
Sus ventas las hace al credito y al contado, tiene mucha demanda con lo encargos, de sus clientes, lo que con este nuevo prestamo invertira en ropa de dama y caballero variada como ropa interior, cosmeticos, logrando aumentar las ventas, al comprar variedad para sus clientes.  A si como cubrir sus gastos personales, como sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Marisela is a clothing, shoes and cosmetics merchant.  She started four years ago with money from her severance pay at her previous job.  She’s a single mother of a two-year-old son.  Having her own business has allowed her to care for her son for a longer time.  She gets help from her mother and lives with her.

She sells both for cash and on credit.  She has a high demand for pending orders from customers so will use this new loan to buy assorted women’s and men’s clothing, like underwear and cosmetics to increase sales by having a variety of goods available for customers as well as covering her personal expenses, like payment obligations.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guiller

texts.en: Guiller is an industrious person.He has been a farmer in the Philippines for 18 years. He is 33 years old,  married to a simple housewife, and is blessed with three children. He is requesting a loan amount of P25,000  to buy insecticides and fertilizers for his farm.He manages it carefully because this is the main source of income for his family. He usually earns P50,000 during the seasons of April and October.He saves some of the income for security purposes in emergencies when he gets weak and to be able to give his children a higher level of education.

loans.use: buy insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Marivic has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, bread & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Duo Solidario El Mañana Group

texts.es: Duo el Mañana: La señora Telma D. 24 años casada y tiene una hija, representante del duo el mañana, tiene su negocio D. vente D. tortillas los tres tiempos. Tiene su negocio desD. hace tres años y empezó vendiendo un pequeño monto D. Q 50.00 diarios que ahora se han convertido en Q 200.00 ahora desea comprar un comal industrial para poder vender un poco mas esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. maiz para la elavoracion D. tortillas y compra D. un comal industrial, su hermana menor trabaja con ella ya que sola no pueD. darse abasto, doña Guadalupe también tiene una tortillería, casa con cuatro hijos aun a su cargo, tres aun estudian, vive con su esposo quien la ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar, empezó con su tortillería hace cuatro años con la intención D. ayudara a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar. Con el crédito desea comprar maíz por mayor para que sea mas comodo el monto, también comprar pollos para criar, y asi lograr sacar a sus hijos adelante y puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Telma is 24 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is the representative for the group “El Mañana” (The Morning). Telma has a business selling tortillas three times a day. She has been in business for three years and started out selling a small amount each day worth 50 GTQ. Now she earns 200 GTQ.
