Telma wants to buy an industrial griddle so that she can sell a little more. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy corn for making tortillas as well as an industrial griddle. Her younger sister works with her, so does not have to cope with all of the work by herself.

Doña Guadalupe also has a tortilla business. Her household includes four dependent children, three of whom are in school. She lives with her husband, who helps with the household expenses. Guadalupe started her tortilla business four years ago with the intention of helping her husband with the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy corn in bulk so that she can get an affordable price. She will also buy chickens to raise, thereby helping her children to get ahead so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas and an industrial griddle.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: El Sr. Nicanor  agricultor nacido  en Chuquisaca, convive con la Sra. Severina,  ella es ama de casa y se dedica a l cuidado de los hijos, hace 20 años que la familia tiene su parcela de 60 hectáreas  en Pampa el Coscal, distante a 40 km de la localidad de el Torno, donde vive y trabaja, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, yuca, es el segundo crédito que tiene con la institución  ya que es la única entidad financiera que le ha dado una mano para mejorar su calidad de vida es por eso que se siente muy agradecido ya que esto le permite crecer económicamente, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, el Sr. Nicanor con la ayuda de su esposa comercializa los productos en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicanor is a farmer born in Chuquisaca. He lives with Ms. Severina. She is a homemaker, dedicated to caring for their children. This family has had their 60-hectare parcel of land for 20 years. It is located in Pampa el Coscal, 40 kilometers from the locality of El Torno, where they live and work.

Nicanor plants corn and yucca. This is his second loan through Emprender, as it is the only financial entity that has given him a hand to help improve his quality of life. For this reason, he feels very grateful, as this will allow him to grow economically. He will use the loan money to plant corn and prepare the land. Nicanor sells his products in the regional market with the help of his wife, directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to prepare his land and plant corn

loans.name: Ziyobek

texts.ru: Зиёбек житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 62 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Зиёбек десять лет как предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по городу Турсунзаде. Кредит берет для смены шин и приобретения необходимых запасных частей.
texts.en: Ziyobek lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  He is 62 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Ziyobek has been providing a taxi service for ten years.  He transports people within the Tursun-zoda.  Ziyobek is requesting this loan to replace tires and buy necessary spare parts.

loans.use: to replace tires and buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim (in the photo) now sells groceries at home. Her husband, Sim, is a security guard. He used to be a remoque taxi driver but he quit the business. A remoque taxi is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. Sarim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild the house where she lives because it’s old.

The couple has been married since 1970 and has two children - one son and a daughter. One is married and lives outside the family home, and the other child has full time employment. They live in a village about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: José, debido a la época de noviembre y diciembre se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere  mejorar su granja y comprar pollos de engorde pequeños para crecerlos y tenerlos listos para la época que mas se vende en la Navidad.El prestamo anterior le ayudo comprar un buen numero de pollo y alimentos, otro le sirvi para la compra de un horno con la idea de hacer pan para ir generando más ingresos, este avance le permitió que su familia mejore cada día económicamente.
texts.en:
José decided to request another loan for the season of November and December. He wants to improve his farm and buy young chickens for fattening so that they will be ready in time for Christmas, the season when he sells the most.

His previous loan helped him to buy a large number of chickens and enough feed. Another loan helped him to buy an oven so that he could make bread as a way of generating more income. This venture will help his family improve financially each day.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Brilyant

texts.en:
Brilyant is a 55-year-old woman who lives with her family in Saatli. She has two sons. Her elder son helps her to run her retail business. Brilyant sells women's and children's clothing at the market. She's been in this business for four years. She began with very little capital. 

She requested a loan of 800 AZN to expand her business and stock up on winter goods. This is her second loan, and she has a good client history. Brilyant hopes that you will support her and thanks you for your understanding.

loans.use: to stock up on winter goods.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou est une femme mariée de 45 ans. Elle habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle est mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 27 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et depuis 10 ans elle exerce la vente  de glace et d’encens. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par amour, son objectif étant de rechercher des gains financiers. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’encens  à revendre  car c’est un produit très demandé au Sénégal  surtout en cette période de froid qui approche. Elle souhaite accroitre ses bénéfices et contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aissatou lives in Senegal. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 7 children aged between 6 and 27. She is a small retailer and has been selling ice and incense for 10 years. She chose this line of work because she needed to find a way to earn a living and she had an affinity for sales.

Aissatou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since June 2011 and is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that she can buy some incense for resale. Incense is particularly in demand in Senegal, especially during the approaching cold season. Aissatou wants to increase her profits and improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some incense for resale.

loans.name: Yessica Beatriz

texts.es:
Yessica, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, inicio con el negocio por iniciativa propia, debido a la necesidad que enfrentaba en ese momento, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario fijo.
Ella esta solicitando un prestamo para la compra de cerdos para engordarlos, aumentando asi su granja y permitiendole crecer y mejorar la.
Su aspiracion es fortalecer cada dia el negocio, con la ayuda de prestamos, siendo puntual en los pagos.
texts.en:
Yessica lives with her children and her husband.  She started a business on her own because of problems that she faced and works by herself with no regular schedule.  She raises pigs.
She is requesting a loan to buy pigs to fatten and to enlarge her farm, allowing the pigs to grow and get healthier there.
Her aspiration is to make her business stronger each day with the help from the loans, and to be punctual with the payments.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania de 59 años, vive junto a Ignacio hace más de 27 años. Con él tiene 3 hijos que ya viven independientemente. Melania e Ignacio viven juntos en una casa propia en la localidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo. Hace 30 años que Melania se entregó al trabajo de campo. En todo este tiempo aprendió lo necesario para comercializar con éxito sus productos (café y plátanos). Pero ve que su sacrificio es recompensado, cuando vende a los mayoristas que visitan su zona constantemente, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien vende pescado a los pobladores de su localidad, realizando la venta de casa en casa. Y cuando termina de repartir la mercadería, apoya en las labores del campo. Producto de su intenso trabajo ha logrado ampliar su hogar con más cuartos para hospedar a sus hijos cuando vayan a visitarla. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que están creciendo sin mayores dificultades.
texts.en: 59 year old Melania has lived with Ignacio for more than 27 years. They have three children who live independently. Melania and Ignacio live together in their own house in Santa Rosa de Palomar in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, in the province of Chanchamayo. Melanie began working in the fields 30 years ago. In all this time she has learnt what she needs to know to successfully sell her produce (coffee and bananas). She sees her sacrifices pay-off when she sells her goods to the wholesalers, who visit the area all the time, and she makes a good profit. She also has the support of her husband, who sells fish to door-to-door in the town. And the goods that are sold in the market are a result of her labors in the field. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to extend her house, adding more rooms for her children to stay in when they go to visit. In time, she hopes to improve her fields and plant much more coffee. She belongs to the community bank "Aroma de Café" and this is her 5th loan from MFP. She promises once again to make her repayments on time, as she has done with earlier loans. She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united. When she receives her loan, Melania will use it to buy sacks of organic fertilizer so that her coffee plants will grow without any great difficulty.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 36 years old, married and has one child. 

Jessica is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Jessica has been buying and selling livestock for four years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive por el sector de los Eucaliptos en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, en Diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantienen la Cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 57 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, están casados y tres de ellos viven independientes, una de sus hijas casadas vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la venta de frutas, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo en un mercado de la ciudad sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para continuar con su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Las Cuencanitas” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Los Eucaliptos zone.  Cuenca, a city known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos, was designated in 1999 as a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Rosa is 57 years old and a single mother of four children who are married adults now.  Three of them live independently and one of her married daughters lives at home with her sharing expenses.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Rosa sells fruit, an activity she’s been in for 20 years.  She works Sunday to Sunday in a municipal market and has no fixed work schedule.

She’s in her third loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy fruit to continue with her business.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Akyljan

texts.ru: Акылжан 49 лет, вдова, имеет трех детей, младшая из которых школьница. В 2002 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Акылжан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 40,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акылжан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от хозяйства Акылжан  планирует вложить в оплату высшего образования для своей дочери.
texts.en: Akyljan is a 49-year-old widow and has three children.  Her youngest daughter is still a schoolgirl.  In 2002, in search of a source of income for her family, Akyljan started her own animal husbandry business with a starting sum of 40,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her tenacity and perseverance, her farming business now brings about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products.  In order to further expand her business, Akyljan has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to purchase additional head of cattle.  She plans to use her revenues to pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Kondokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ando Armelle (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 23 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Ando Armelle   est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfant. Ando Armelle vit seule et assure toutes ses divers besoins. Pour cette raison, Ando Armelle vend des chaussures da façon ambulante depuis, dix ans environ. Ando Armelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ando Armelle ensemble avec les membres du groupe KONDOKPO sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Mrs. Monica O. is 32 years old, a woman full of life to who does her business activities all days through. She hopes to get the above amount to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & Drinks for sale

loans.name: Hellinda

texts.en: I am widow, mother of 6. My husband died of HIV/AIDS. I am the main breadwinner. I will use the loan to expand my business and meet the basic needs of my dependents and be able to pay for their school fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married, and is a mother of five children. She was born in Pader, Kitgum. She left Kitgum due to political instability. When she came to Kampala, she settled at a camp for those who were internally displaced in Banda-Kireka. Life was not easy, and she had to look for means of survival. She entered the stone quarry business to earn sustenance for herself and the rest of the family. Her husband got a job with a security organization as a guard. Together, they has been able to increase their family's income.

In time she was introduced to the Life in Africa foundation. Since Sylvia knows other ladies involved in paper bead making, she found it very easy to learn how to make the beads. She is now a confident member, earning up to shsUG 150,000 per month from producing beads. She plans to build a family house at Pader where she can sleep when she visits her home district.

Sylvia's quarrying business involves paying labor for the digging of the stones, cracking them to the desired sizes, and then loading them to the customers' trucks. She used to produce two truckloads but now hopes to make three more per month with the increased capital from the loan. She will re-pay the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Breaking stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice Daniel would like to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Ni

texts.id:
K. T. is a widow who is responsible for all her family needs, including her children schooling, after her husband passed away. Therefore she has to work hard in today's very difficult economic's condition, and decided to be a pig farmer. K. T. started her business with one pig breeder that cost her Rp7000 (about 80 US cents) daily for feeding expenses. This one pig breeder she took care was able to produce 8 baby offsprings, and after she sold it, she was able to profit Rp 700,000 (about $75). From this profit K. T. finance her family living and her children's schooling. K. T. wishes that she could expand her business from the loan she hope to receive from DINARI.

K. T. adalah seorang janda yang harus menanggung semua kebutuhan keluarganya termasuk menyekolahkan anaknya setelah suaminya meninggal. Hal ini membuatnya harus bekerja keras dalam situasi ekonomi yang sulit seperti sekarang dengan mengambil keputusan menjadi peternak babi. K. T. memulai usahanya dengan memelihara 1 ekor penginduk yang setiap harinya memerlukan biaya pakan Rp. 7.000,- setiap harinya. Penginduk yang dipeliharanya itu mampu memproduksi 8 ekor anak dan setelah dijual K. T. mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. Rp. 700.000,-. Dari keuntungan yang diperolehnya inilah K. T. membiayai hidup keluarganya dan menyekolahkan anaknya. K. T. berharap keinginannya mengembangkan usahanya bisa terpenuhi lewat pinjaman yang diberikanoleh Yayasan DINARI.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal Food

Membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza #1 - Light And Hope #1 Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “ Luz y Esperanza” group—meaning light and hope. She is asking for this loan so that she can continue to buy shampoos, conditioners, and other hair treatment supplies for her beauty shop. She says that this loan will help ensure that she always has enough supplies for her customers, and will also help her to offer higher quality products to attract new customers.

Maria says that her dream is to one day build her own beauty shop where she can serve her clients. Right now she rents both her beauty shop and her house from someone else, and it’s hard to keep up with rent and savings. Maria is also very involved with her Catholic church.

She and her husband are both very thankful to everyone supporting them, they are very excited to take advantage of the opportunities this loan will give them to improve their lives, and their business.

NOTE: This $1000 loan will fund Maria's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy hair treatment supplies

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
“Mama Africa” is a favourite phrase of the locals here when they see a ‘mzungu’ (white person) wearing an African dress. Here is one of our suppliers, Nuru M.. She sells traditional (long, flowing and puffed-sleeved) and modern (tighter and sexier) African dresses of all styles and colours. She has operated the business since 2003 and requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock. She and her ten year-old daughter Hadija send their thanks.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase material and stock for her clothes shop

loans.name: Melih

texts.en: Melih T. is a 36-year-old woman who has a snack stall where she sells crispy chips, candies, snacks, etc. She earns US$8 a day and makes a small profit. She has to work hard to support her family because her husband, Atmaja, has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$75 to fill her stall with more goods. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her stall with more goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has always worked hard to give her son the best. He’s now 18 years old and is working so he can help out with household expenses. Ever since he was born, she was forced to take up the responsibilities of both mother and father and she did so by knitting sweaters and different pieces of clothing. With her sister, she was able to offer her services to different companies. As time went on, she perfected her skills, and now knits clothing for retail in the markets where she lives. Her big dream is to form an association of knitters so they can import what they produce. To continue progressing toward her goal, she’s asking for a loan to invest in guinea pigs, so she can begin raising them and selling them. Support this courageous woman so she and her family can continue forward.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria siempre ha trabajado arduamente porque desea conseguir lo mejor para su hijo que actualmente tiene 18 años y trabaja para ser también un sostén de los gastos de su hogar, ella desde que su hijo nació tuvo que desempeñar las responsabilidades de padre y madre y lo hizo dedicándose al tejido a mano de chompas y diferentes prendas de vestir, fue así que en compañía de su querida hermana ofreció sus servicios a diferentes fábricas y con el tiempo su técnica se ha ido perfeccionando y ahora teje prendas para comercializarlas en las ferias de su localidad. Su gran anhelo es formar una asociación de tejedoras para que puedan exportar lo que producen. Para seguir progresando y alcanzar su anhelada meta a mediano plazo solicita un préstamo, los cuales invertirá en la compra de cuyes para dedicarse también a la crianza de cuyes como un ingreso más para la encomia de los suyos. Apoya a esta mujer de gran coraje a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Establish a guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Nervina

texts.en: Nervina lives in Miričina, a small suburb of Gračanica. She is a 41 year old woman and she is married. Her husband is the owner of a small drug store and they can earn about 1000 KM. They have two children, 17 and 22 years old. This is not her first loan at MCO WWI. Nervina will use this loan in the amount of  1500 KM  for buying a cow. Her wish is to buy one more cow and improve her monthly income in order to improve education standards for her children.

loans.use: Buy one more cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The Mujeres Unidas de Ciudad del Este committee is comprised of enterprising women, who in addition to being homemakers, wives, and mothers, are also small business owners, working with the goal of offering their children a better future.

These women carry out several different types of activities in order to generate extra income for the household expenses. There are a total 15 members in the group. The group leader, or General Director as she is called in the program, is Mrs. María Antonieta Ávalos, who sells lottery tickets. The other members are Rafaela S., Carmen C., Marilina V., Maura E., Gregoria P., and Miryan López, who all work in food preparation and sales. Antonia E., Elizabeth B., Antonia Centurión, and Miryan G. sells shoes and apparel. Claudelina Álvarez, Florencia Gómez, and Elisa Cáceres have a general store and a drink shop, respectively. Liliana P. is a cleaning lady.

They are requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise and supplies that will be invested in their businesses, thus allowing them to expand their income through their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité Mujeres Unidas de Ciudad del Este esta compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras, que además de ser amas de casa, esposas y madres, también son microempresarias, llevando todo esto con la única finalidad de dar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir.

Estas mujeres realizan diversos tipos de actividades para poder generar un ingreso extra para el sustento familiar, en total son 15 las integrantes de la misma. La líder del grupo, o Directora General como el programa la llama, es la señora María Antonieta Ávalos, ella se dedica a la venta de loterías, sus demás integrantes son Rafaela S., Carmen C., Marilina V., Maura E., Gregoria P. y Miryan López que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comidas; Antonia E., Elizabeth B., Antonia Centurión, Miryan G. venden ropas y calzados, Claudelina Álvarez, Florencia Gómez, Elisa Cáceres tiene una despensa y una tienda de ventas de bebidas respectivamente y Liliana P. es limpiadora.

Ellas solicitan el crédito para poder adquirir mercaderías e insumos para invertirlos en sus negocios, de este modo poder expandir sus ingresos en las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing (t-shirts, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes for men/women), basic foodstuff (sugar, milk, eggs, flour, cooking oil, breads, drinks), and household cleaning supplies

loans.name: Neydi

texts.es:
Neydi is a mother of three daughters. Six years ago she divorced her husband after being overwhelmed by family problems, which forced her to look for a way to earn money and keep her occupied, so she decided to dedicate herself to selling cosmetics. Now not only does she sell perfumes, but also hammocks. Even though she has rebuilt her live, the business keeps going.

Neydi is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay in three months, to purchase her supplies. With your help she will keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Neydi es madre de tres mujeres, hace 6 años se divorcio agobiada por los problemas familiares, esto la motivo a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos y la mantuviera ocupada por lo que decidió dedicarse a las ventas de cosméticos, ahora no solo vende perfumes, sino también urde hamacas, y aunque rehizo su vida, el negocio lo continúa.

Solicta un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Ravshanoi

texts.en:
Ravshanoi N. lives in the high mountain Asht region of Tajikistan where she raises and sells livestock, like many other local people. Mrs. N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, and she has shown herself to be a serious entrepreneur. Mrs. N. works also on a collective farm. Her husband went to the Russian Federation for a well-paying job, so now Mrs. N. works to raise her child on her own.

Mrs. N. is asking KIVA for a business support loan of $625.00 US to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Fiataua

texts.en: Fiataua L., 45, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the plantation and livestock business. She sells her wares in the village three days each week. She has received two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be around 400 Tala (160 USD). SPBD loans are Fiataua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to use her loan to purchase supplies to help her run her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides,barbed wire, nails and other supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Binh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Binh Thi B., 48 year old, joined TYM in 2003 with the first loan of 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise pigs. Noticing the potential of live-stocks, next times, she borrowed money to diversify the farm with pigs, buffaloes, cows and for-egg chickens. Revenues from successful projects allow her to open a CDs/tapes rental store, creating a job for her son and increasing family income. Her husband is a retiree whose pension is 1,600,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Her daughter works in a district hospital. Therefore, the family’s income is secure. She plans to borrow the next loan of 19,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in the farm and the store.

The family’s income is 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Bình 48 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, với số vay vòng 1 là 1.000.000đ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Chị nhận thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi sẽ đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao nên các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đã vay mức vốn cao mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn, trâu, bò và gà đẻ trứng. Thu nhậph từ dự án gia đình chị đã tích lũy được số vốn mở 1 cửa hàng kinh doanh băng địa hình, tạo công ăn việc làm cho con trai chị và cũng có thu nhập thêm cho gia đình, chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu lương tháng 1.600.000đ. Con gái chị đang làm cán bộ y tế tại bệnh viện huyên nên thu nhập gia đình chị rất ổn định. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đầu tư vốn vào cửa hàng băng đĩa hình.

Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: to invest in farming and a CDs/tapes rental store

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
This is Issa S.. He is 38 years of age and married with four children. He is an agriculturist. He plants vegetables and has been in this business for the past ten years now.

Issa has never received a loan from SMT but he heard about SMT`s products and low interest rate from a friend and colleague. He thus approached SMT for a loan of Le 8,000,000.00 to buy tools, seeds, fertilizers, and employ labourers to assist him in carrying out his job.

loans.use: To buy tools, seeds, fertilizers, and employ labourers.

loans.name: Yuri Zulema

texts.es:
Yuri es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9 y 5 años. Inició el negocio para tener un trabajo y obtener ingresos; en las ventas encontró una actividad que le gusta hacer y además obtener ingresos. Comenzó hace tres años cuando le ofrecieron vender zapatos por catalogo y hasta la fecha realiza esta actividad exitosamente.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante
texts.en:
Yuri is married and has three children, all aged 9 or 5. She began her business in order to have a job and an income. In sales she found an activity that she liked to do and she also got an income. She began three years ago when she had an offer to sell shoes by catalogue, and until today she has done this activity successfully. She needs a loan of US $250 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise. With your help, she will improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Boeng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who currently owns 2 hectares for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her crop. Her husband, Mr. Choek Chorn, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Sao S. has two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker, while the younger one is a farmer. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant and fertilizers to support her crop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret O. is 36 years old and married to Mr. O.. They have five children. She has a store where she sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. Margaret is a LAPO client and needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosevida

texts.en:
Rosevida B. is a patient mother to her ten children.
	
In their barangay (Malamag East Tumauini, Isabela), Rosevida is an active leader at the moment. Their village is best described as a flat rural area with corn and tobacco as their main products in the village. Her family lives there happily, God-fearing and has a harmonious relationship with each other. 

In the village, Rosevida manages her small store where she sells basic commodities for the families who want to minimize their expenses in going to the market. Because of this reason, Rosevida wants to add varieties of products to sell in her store so she will be able to meet all the needs of her regular customers. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP8, 000 to be able to do this. 

"It is better to give than to receive” is her principle in life. Rosevida believes that giving without expecting in return is much acknowledged by God. At the moment, Rosevida gives her best towards the success of her business to support her family without being dependent to her children who now have their own jobs.

loans.use: buy additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Fredy Gustavo

texts.es:
Fredy O. se destaca en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León en su negocio de venta de refrescos como lo son  gaseosas, jugos y agua los cuales él mismo comercializa con mucho esfuerzo y con dedicación ambulantemente por las calles de dicho mercado y en su bicilceta.

La razón por la cual el señor Fredy O. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de las bebidas y por esto espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito sea otorgado y así bridar las condiciones de vida necesaria a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy O. is well known in the central market in León in his business selling drinks like sodas, juices, and water, which he markets with much effort and dedication as a street vendor and on his bike. The reason Fredy O. has looked for the support of Ceprodel, a Kiva partner, is to receive a loan which will allow him to buy these drinks. For this he hopes his loan will be granted so he can offer the quality of life necessary for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, juices, and water

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer T. is the treasurer of Kamwokya II development group in Kamwokya. She is a married lady and the mother of 4 children of whom two are still in school, a girl in her final year at Makerere University, while the boy is just beginning high school.

Jennifer has two businesses. She is a poultry farmer with layers. She recently sold off all her layers and has booked 500 more layers as well as a few broilers that she hopes will be ready during the Easter season. She also has a cosmetics shop where she sells ladies’ beauty products like Vaseline, lotions, weaves and braids. She is grateful that she is able to sell from her home; hence doesn't have to rent. Jennifer needs another loan to complete payment for her birds as well as stocking feed for those birds.

loans.use: paying the balance for her layer-chicks plus buying chicken feed in large quantity

loans.name: Cangallo Corazon Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cangallo Corazón, es parte del proyecto Wari I, Las socias son D. la provincia D. Cangallo, que esta ubicado a 110 kilómetros D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, tiene una población aproximada D. 600 habitantes, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la producción D. frutales como palto, tuna y la agricultura D. cereales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. Marlene que es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo D. 9 meses, Marlene venD. ropa en las ferias, inicio este negocio porque necesitaba generar ingresos para su hogar, desD. que empezó en el Banco Comunal su negocio esta mejorando, Marlene esta ahorrando para la educación D. su hijo e implementar su casa.
Por otro lado Celia es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 9 y 4 años, Celia venD. comida, negocio que inicio con la ayuda D. su esposo, Celia sueña con mejorar su negocio e implementar un restaurante, Celia esta ahorrando para comprar mesas, sillas para implementar su restaurante.
Mientras que Aldy es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Aldy vendía ropa y como no le generaba buenas ganancias decidió cambiar D. negocio por la venta D. combustible, sus ventas están mejorando, con el préstamo que obtendrá piensa invertir en la compra D. mas lubricantes. Aldy esta ahorrando para seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Cangallo Corazón is part of the Wari I project. The partners are from the Cangallo province, located 110 kilometers outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. The town has approximately 600 inhabitants, and the community's economy relies on growing fruits such as avocados and pears, as well as grains. The partners have various businesses. For example, Marlene lives with her partner and her son, who is nine months old. She sells clothing at markets, and began her business because she needed to generate income for her home. Since the Community Bank started, her business has been improving. Marlene is saving for her son's education and to build a home. Celia is married and has two children, who are nine and four years old, respectively. She sells food, and began her business with help from her husband. Celia dreams of improving her business and starting a restaurant. She is saving to buy tables and chairs for her future restaurant. Aldy is married and has four children. She previously sold clothing, but because she didn't generate good earnings she decided to change industries and sell fuel. Her sales are now improving. With this loan she's thinking of investing in lubricants. Aldy is saving to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, rice, sugar, oil, livestock, fuel, and grains.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es una joven muy alegre de 23 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, y ha visto en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos económicos, ya que no desea ser una carga en su hogar. Ella tiene un negocio “delicioso”, fabrica helados, que distribuye a las tiendas cercanas de su barrio, donde son vendidos rápidamente debido a lo agradable de su sabor. Decidió incursionar en este negocio a los 16 años, cuando observó que el dinero faltaba en su casa, actualmente lleva 7 años en esta actividad y espera poder continuar mucho tiempo más. Lo que más le gusta a Edith de su trabajo, es que puede comerse los helados que quiere mientras los prepara, ya que tiene que probar el sabor de su producto, piensa que en el futuro podría ponerle una marca a sus helados y así poder competir en el mercado juliaqueño, lo difícil es soportar el frío mientras los prepara, aun así está dispuesta a continuar con este negocio, con el único fin de mejorar su vida. Es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y siempre recibe consejos de las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para fabricar sus ricos helados y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is a very happy young woman of 23 years, lives in her parents' home, and has seen the need to help with economic costs, as she does not want to be a burden at home. She has a business, Delicious, to make ice cream, which she distributes to nearby stores in her neighborhood, where it is sold quickly due to its pleasant flavor. She decided to go into this business when she was 16, when she observed that there was not enough money in the home. She now has seven years in this activity and hopes to continue much longer. What Edith likes best about her work is that she can eat the ice cream she wants while preparing it, because she has to sample the flavor of her product. She thinks that in the future she could put a brand mark on her ice cream and so be able to compete in the Juliaca city market. The hard part is to bear the cold while preparing the ice cream, yet she is still ready to continue with this business, with the sole purpose of improving her life. This is the fifth loan she has with MFP. She has always been very punctual in her payments and expects to be punctual now also. She feels very comfortable in her community bank, and always gets advice from the other members. With the money she is seeking she will buy more ingredients to make her rich ice cream and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Mrs. Lourdes E. started buying and selling pigs and discovered that this business is a good way of earning income. Her husband is a farmer and she wanted to help him by bringing in additional income.  She buys pigs from her neighbors and sells them every Saturday at Dipolog City. Lourdes is 59 years old, married with 2 children, and presently resides in Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. She is applying for 6,000 PHP to support her business and hopes to make it a great success.

loans.use: To buy hogs to sell

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Houssam has owned a tire shop for seven years. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tires for his store. This is the first time that Houssam has requested a loan.

Houssam is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. Houssam decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Houssam will use the loan to purchase tires for his store

loans.name: Rianath

texts.fr:
A. Rianath est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Rianath est célibataire avec un enfant. Rianath a abandonné très tôt l’école pour apprendre la coiffure. La coiffure qu’elle n’a exercée que pour peu de temps. En effet, c’est le charbon et l'huile végétale que Rianath vend maintenant. Rianath a eu déjà de ALIDé deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé et qui l’ont aidés à augmenter le volume de son activité. Dans l’optique de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle Rianath demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé pour continuer de développer son activité.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Rianath A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rianath is unmarried and has one child. Rianath abandoned her studies very early on to train as a hairstylist. She worked as a hairstylist only for a little while. Indeed, it is the sale of coal and vegetable oil that Rianath is involved in currently. Rianath has already obtained two loans through Alidé, which she repaid well and which helped her increase the volume of her business. With the aim of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Rianath is seeking a third loan through Alidé to continue developing her business. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten bags of coal and five 25-litre cans of peanut oil

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Wilma C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa alquilada.
Su profesión es realizar trabajos de belleza, la misma que lo realiza en su mismo domicilio, pero “quisiera contar con mi propio salón de belleza y que de esta manera mejora mis ingresos para darles una mejor vida a mis niños” Dijo. 
Jacinta C..- vive en el km. 9 barrio el Triunfo, como cacera en la casa de una amiga. Se dedica a la venta d refrigerio (empanadas y refrescos), su esposo el Sr. Armando Rivarona es albañil, el préstamo que solicitaron fue para aumentar su capital de venta de refrigerios. Como objetivo es juntar un capital para comprar su propio lote y poder construir la casita de sus sueños, para poder vivir con toda su familia.
Teresa Eliana Q..- es una de las integrantes del banco comunal, vive en anticrítico por esta misma zona Barrio el Triunfo km.9, con su esposo el Sr. Julián flores y su hijo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa la misma que es realizado ambulando, su esposo es albañil. “Estoy acumulando  mi capital para poder contar de aquí a un tiempito con un puesto fijo ya que se me hace un poco difícil trajinar con mi mercadería y mi pequeño hijo”. Aclaró además que se siente muy agradecida con nuestra institución por haberle apoyado con un pequeño préstamo, con el que podrá aumentar su capital y de esta manera sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilma C. is the president of the communal bank, is 37 years old, a single mother, has 2 children, and lives in a rented house. She works in the beauty profession, a job that she carries out in her own home, however she mentioned that, “I would like to have my own beauty salon to be able to in this way improve my income and give my children a better life.” Jacinta C. lives in the Triunfo neighborhood while she takes care of a friend’s home. She dedicates herself to the sale of snacks and refreshments (empanadas and drinks); her husband Armando Rivarona is a mason. The loan that they are requesting is to increase their capital to invest in the sale of snacks and refreshments. Their objective is to acquire enough capital to purchase their own lot and build the small house of their dreams in which they will be able to live with the entire family. Teresa Eliana Q. is one of the communal bank members; she lives on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over) in the same Triunfo neighborhood with her husband Julián Flores and their son. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing as a street vendor and her husband is a mason. She mentioned that, “I am accumulating my capital to be able to in a while invest in a permanent sales stand given that it is difficult for me to bustle about with my merchandise and small son.” She also made clear that she feels very grateful for our institution having given her support with a small loan, with which she will be able to increase her capital and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Celia es conviviente, tiene 68 años,11 hijos todos mayores independientes.
Celia  es de Moquegua, estudio repostería, pero no la ejerció porque con su hijo empezaron un taller de metálica en su casa, ella recepción los pedidos, 
Desde que Celia esta en Finca, ha podido progresar en su economía.
Celia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de fieros, arreglo de su maquina soldadora.
El sueño de Celia es tener una tienda de venta de estructuras de fiero.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Avancemos Juntas Microfinance Institute.

She is a 68-year-old married mother with 11 children, all of whom are independent. She is from Moquegua. She studied pastrymaking, but has never practiced her profession because she and her son started a metal shop at home, where she takes in all the orders.

Ever since Celia has been a member of Finca, she has been able to get ahead financially. She needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan so that she can buy metal and have her soldering iron repaired.

Celia dreams of having a store in which she sells metal structures.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase metal and fix soldering iron

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie V. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Leslie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Leslie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Leslie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leslie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leslie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leslie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 58 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in clothes and lace materials. Adwoa sells at the market square and also hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. She has been in business for 25 years and wants a loan to buy more textiles to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing peanuts

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: A sus 65 años, Fortunato trabaja con una fuerza muy notable, vive en su casa propia, es casado y padre de 4 hijos, quienes viven fuera. Durante toda su vida se dedicó a la agricultura y tiene la satisfacción de que sus siembras nunca le fallaron. Es por eso que pudo educar a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien, sin depender económicamente de él. Pero a pesar de su edad, Fortunato no piensa dejar sus chacras, por el contrario, quiere seguir sembrando, porque cuando no lo hace; se llena de tristeza y se enferma. Por ello, sigue sembrando papa, olluco y arvejas, los que comercializa  en el mercado más importante de la ciudad de Tarma (conocido como “El mayorista”), donde los compradores le pagan por cada saco de producto entre 40 y 60 soles dependiendo del tamaño y la variedad. Una vez terminada la venta de todos sus sacos, acompañado de su esposa, a quien llama “su viejita adora” regresan a su casa. Fortunato se compromete a pagar puntualmente este cuarto crédito que solicita a MFP, donde siendo para de un banco comunal muestra su agradecimiento a todos sus compañeros por el apoyo que le brindas, pues todos se ayudan mutuamente. Con el dinero que ahora requiere comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
At 65 years of age, Fortunato works with remarkable energy. He is married, lives in his own home, and is the father of 4 children who live elsewhere. He has dedicated his entire life to agriculture and has the satisfaction of knowing that none of his crops have ever failed. This was how he was able to provide his children with an education that enabled them to develop into good people, and not become financially dependent on him.

Fortunato, despite his age, has no intentions to quit farming. To the contrary, he plans to keep on planting and harvesting his crops. The thought that he may not be able to continue farming fills him with sadness and makes him physically ill. He continues to plant potatoes, ulloco, and peas. His crops are sold at the wholesale market in Tarma, where buyers will pay between 40 to 60 soles per bag depending on the size and variety. After all the sacks of produce are sold, Fortunato and his wife (whom he affectionately calls “mi viejita adora”) return home.

Fortunato is taking his fourth loan with MFP and promises to make his payments on time. He is grateful for the opportunity to be part of a Communal Bank because all the members support and help one another. He will use the money he requested to purchase chemical fertilizers for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma S. G. tiene 45 años y está casada con el señor Maximiliano Wilson Ancieta Navia por mas de 25 años, ambos trabajan en la compra y venta de Turriles, Bidones y Baldes de plástico y metal en un mercado de Cochabamba conocido como el mercado “La Pampa”

La señora Irma vive en la zona de Villa Bush en Cochabamba, junto a sus dos hijos los cuales estudian Administración en la universidad pública “Universidad Mayor de San Simón”. Sus hijos estudian en la mañana y por las tardes ayudan en el puesto de venta que su mama tiene en el mercado.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de más Turriles, Bidones Y Baldes, puesto que la demanda subió en los últimos meses y lo que tiene no le es suficiente. La señora Irma tuvo un crédito anterior con nuestra institución para el mismo destino (compra de Turriles, Bidones y Baldes), y pago con responsabilidad y puntualidad por eso la consideramos para un segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Miss Irma S. G. is 45 years old and has been married to Mr. Maximiliano Wilson Ancieta Navia for more than 25 years. They both work in buying and selling barrels, cans, and buckets of plastic and metal in a market in Cochabamba known as “La Pampa” market.

Miss Irma lives in the Villa Bush area in Cochabamba, together with her two children who study Administration at the public university “Universidad Mayor de San Simón.” Her children study in the morning and in the afternoons they help at the sales stand that their mom has in the market.

The loan will be used for the purchase of more barrels, cans, and buckets since the demand increased in recent months and what she has is not enough. Miss Irma had a previous loan with our institution for the same purpose (purchase of barrels, cans, and buckets) and she paid responsibly and punctually and for this reason we are considering her for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital for business (purchase of barrels, cans, and buckets)

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline sells fish from her own fish pond in the village. She also sells vegetables for a larger income to support their needs. She is 38 years old, married to Robinson, who manages their farm lot and their man-made fish pond. The couple is blessed with three children: Genalyn (20 years old, high school graduate), Jinky (17 years old, also a high school graduate) and Janette (10 years old, presently studying in the elementary school located in their village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela). Evangeline dreams of having an improved business to be able to secure the future of her children.

Evangeline would like to request additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 pesos for the improvement of her vending business and also to meet their farming needs. Evangeline and her husband are doing their best to be productive in their businesses for the welfare of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en: Obadiah is a 31-year-old businessman who operates a supermarket dealing with foodstuffs and household items in Nairobi’s Pipeline estate. He has been in this business for the past four years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes 60,000 to add stock into his supermarket. Obadiah hopes to also own a wholesale shop and become one of the leading distributors of products in his estate. He describes himself as hardworking and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to his supermarket

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en:
Khurshid, the son of M. Wail, lives in shewa of Nangrahar province. He works hard in agriculture because he feels a lot of responsibility toward his family members as the eldest son in the family. He lives in a family of 10 members including his father and mother. 

Khurshid wants to apply for an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing more seeds and materials for his farm. 
He hopes to expand and bring new changes in his business. He is confident that he can repay his loan on time and plans to join the second cycle loan after the full repayment of the first cycle loan. He would like to extend his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farming stocks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria V. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. In 2008 Maria joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Lionardo Yvan

texts.es:
El Señor Lionardo Yvan Méndez Palacios, Labora como colector de Ruta del Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en ese lapso ha invertido  15 créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, ella es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Lionardo Yvan Méndez Palacios works as a custodian at the Roberto Huembés Market in Managua. He cares for his two school-aged children, is married, and has worked with Ceprodel for seven years. In this time, he has invested fifteen credits in making improvements to his home, and he is an excellent client. He will invest the credit requested in the purchase of materials to remodel his roof and to pay for labor to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials to remodel the roof on his house.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme qui exerce depuis 2004 le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de produits de beauté. En période de fêtes de fin d’année la demande de pagnes et de produits de beauté est très élevée parce que les femmes aiment se faire belle en cette période. Elle voudrait profiter de cette opportunité pour accroître ses recettes raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 20 pagnes de diverses qualités, 4 cartons de crème « VIT-FEE » et 10 mèches.
texts.en:
This woman has, since 2004, had a business selling "pagnes" (a West African term for brightly coloured fabric); she has since combined this business with the sale of beauty products. During the holiday period at the end of the year the demand for "pagnes" and beauty products is very high because women want to make themselves beautiful during this period. She would like to take advantage of this opportunity to increase her income and it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 20 "pagnes" of varying quality, 4 boxes of "VIT-FEE" cream and ten hair extensions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and beauty products

loans.name: Sawura

texts.en:
Sawura is a 30-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in school while her last-born is breastfeeding.

Sawura operates a local food restaurant and has been in business for fifteen years now. She serves different kinds of local dishes such as banku, waakye and tuozafi. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot soup, waakye is prepared from local rice with beans, and tuozafi is prepared from milled cassava and maize and is taken with okra like soup. She has two assistants that assist in serving her customers with food and she pays them by the close of the work.

Sawura has many customers since her food is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, rice, beans, cowhide, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Sawura hopes to raise increased income to support her business and to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers and to support her children’s education. She always saves parts of her profit for unforeseen occurrences. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Oriental Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "Oriental" esta representado por la señora Dalia y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría van cursando ya un tercer ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad en sus pagos, responsabilidad y unidad en sus grupo, son gente muy trabajadora como lo demuestran en sus puestos de venta de empanadas, tortas, tarjetas, comida y barrotes algunos de los varones se dedican al transporte de pasajeros. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que los socios no les dan mucha importancia tan solo trabajan para salir adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicación. Dalia que es la presidenta de grupo se dedica a la venta de tortas tiene un experiencia de 20 años, Yovanna se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y tiene experiencia de 1 año en este rubro, Juana se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace 2 años, Blanca nieve es promotora desde hace 3 años, Veronica se dedica a atender en su restaurante desde hace 2 años atrás, Francys	 también es promotora desde hace 2 años, Tomas es taxista y tiene una experiencia como chofer de 9 años, Maria Nelly se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace 1 año, Blanca vende comida y tiene experiencia de 2 años en el rubro, Marithza se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace 1 año atrás, Erika también se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace 2 años atrás, Mabel atiende su tienda de abarrotes y tiene una experiencia en este negocio de 3 años. 

El destino del crédito es mayormente para incrementar su mercadería para la venta así como la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus masitas y principalmente para la mayoría de la socias que venden comida en sus restaurantes o de manera ambulante, los socios desean retapizar sus vehículos y comprar algunos repuestos para otorgar un mejor servicio y generar mejores ganancias para el sustento de sus hogares. Las expectativas de los socios es poder brindarles a sus hijos una profesión y un hogar mas cómodo es por ello que seguirán trabajado hasta ver sus sueños hechos realidad.
texts.en:
The Oriental Communal Bank is represented by Sra. Dalia and consists of 12 group members. Most of the group is currently in its third loan cycle and has been punctual in making previous loan payments. The group is responsible and united. They are very hard-working people, as can be seen at their stands, where they sell empanadas (meat pastries), cards, food and groceries. Some of the male group members work in passenger transport. The group members are not very worried about competition in their respective fields; they just focus on working hard in order to get ahead through effort and dedication. Dalia is the group president, and has been selling cakes for the past 20 years. Yovanna has been selling cards for the past year, Juana has been selling empanadas for 2 years, Blanca Nieve has been working as a promoter for the past 3 years, Veronica has been working at her restaurant for the past 2 years, Francys has been working as a promoter for 2 years, Tomas is a taxi driver and has 9 years of experience, Maria Nelly has been selling empanadas for one year, Blanca has two years of experience selling prepared meals, Marithza has been selling empanadas for the past year, Erika has been selling empanadas for the past 2 years, and Mabel has 3 years of experience running her grocery store. Most of the group members will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell: for example, the members who sell food in restaurants or on the street will buy ingredients to prepare their pastries. The male group members will re-upholster their vehicles and buy some replacement parts in order to better serve their clients and earn more income for their families. The group members want to be able to provide their children with a professional-level education and a more comfortable home, and so they will continue to work until their dreams become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Rigners Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Rigners. She is 36 years old and is married with 2 children aged 9 and 12 years old whose educational levels are 5th and 8th grades.  Kadiatu and her family live and work at the ELWA Junction about 5 miles from downtown of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.  She is a high school graduate as she was unable to complete her education due to poverty.

Kadiatu’s business is the sale of bread and butter. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table to residents of ELWA.   She has been running this business for 2 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.  Kadiatu started by selling with 1,500 Liberian dollars as working capital but now operates with about 4,000 Liberian Dollars.

She sells good bread and communicates with her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Kadiatu needs this loan to purchase more bread and butter for resale to improve her business.  She dreams of being an educated person in society in the future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kadiatu is the one holding the sign.  Lamah D. is in the inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and butter.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. is from the village of South Pob., Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Editha is married and has 7 adult children. Editha owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Editha is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: To make a living, Macrina R. plants and harvests rice to sell. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Villaramos. Macrina has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) as a monthly average. In 2009, Macrina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Macrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. Macrina is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alida Sulay

texts.es:
la sra. Alida Sulay L. M. tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la repostería,  su especialidad es la elaboración de donas con azúcar de diferentes tamaño ademas hace donas con chocolate, relámpagos, hamburguesas, pan, semitas, marquesotes y bollitos; todo estos productos de buen tamaño y de buen gusto.
Es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, tiene un empleado varon que es el que reparte el producto.
El lugar donde elabora sus productos se mantiene con buena higiene.
Doña Alida ya tiene los clientes con quienes tiene contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo reparte diariamente. muchos de sus clientes son personas que tienen cafeterias en colegios y escuelas de la ciudad de Danli.
Doña Alida es una mujer Soltera que a trabajado fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos de los cuales ya solo depende uno de ella.

Doña Alida utilizara el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser: Harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, vainilla, canela molida, margarina, huevos.
texts.en:
Alida Sulay L. M. has had a pastry business for 18 years. Her specialty is making sugared donuts of various sizes. In addition she makes chocolate donuts, eclairs, hamburger buns, bread, coffee cake, syrup cake, and scones. All of her products are of a good size and taste great. It is notable that during all this time she has managed the business herself. She has a male employee who distributes her products. She maintains the place where she makes her products with good hygiene. Alida has customers with permanent contracts, and everything she makes is distributed daily. Many of her customers are people who have cafeterias in schools in the city of Danli. Alida is a single woman who has worked hard to succeed for her children, who depend only upon her. She will use this loan to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, vanilla, ground cinnamon, margarine and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, vanilla, ground cinnamon, margarine and eggs.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Gonido sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires (telle la présidente du groupe Kamissa Traoré), de céréales et du charbon de bois.
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois, des colis de condiments alimentaires et des sacs de céréales. La présidente du groupe qui est dans le créneau des condiments alimentaires compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des  colis de condiments (feuilles de baobab, poudre de Sounbala, poudre de gombo, sel de cuisine, cube maggi, etc.)
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Fana et à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguissèmè group are all married, are on average 35 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in Gonido, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties, and they are retailers of food condiments (like the group’s president Kamissa Traoré), grain cereals and charcoal. The Djiguissèmè group women are requesting a fourth group loan which will serve to buy bags of charcoal, packages of food condiments and bags of grain cereals. The group’s president - who retails food condiments - will use her portion of the loan to buy packages of condiments: baobab leaves, Sounbala powder (a very nutritious condiment, made from seeds of the néré tree), okra powder, kitchen salt, Maggi cubes, etc. She gets her condiment supplies mainly from Fana and Bamako, and sells locally at the Tingolé market and in surrounding market fairs, for cash, retail and on credit, to both women and men customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 30,000 FCFA, which will be used for daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Nelsón

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson es soltero y vive aún con sus padres.
El tiene 2 panaderías bien surtidas, además de la panadería es contador tiene una oficina montada.
El consiguió con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo todo lo que tiene.
Con la ayuda de su padre que también tiene una panadería en la cuidad monto su propio negocio y con las ganancias del mismo termino sus estudios universitario.
Hoy día el es un micro empresario y un excelente profesional.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita el préstamos para la compra de un horno eléctrico para confites.
texts.en:
Nelson is single and still lives at home with his parents. He has two, well-stocked bakeries. Besides the bakeries he’s also an accountant and has a well-set-up office. He got all he has through much sacrifice and effort. With help from his father, who also has a bakery in the city, he set up his own business and used the profits from it to pay for his university studies. Today, he is a micro entrepreneur and an excellent professional. He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to his commitments. He is requesting funds to buy an electric oven for his sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric oven.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Valeriana es soltera, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Valeriana tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 3 personas, también vende licores.
Valeriana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sillas y mesas.
Los sueños de Valeriana son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is single, 48 years old and has 4 children. Valeriana runs a restaurant everyday in a rented locale; she has three people who help her to run the restaurant. She also sells liquor. She needs a $350 loan to invest in tables and chairs.
